Authors: Fefelov V.F., Gorbunov V.A., Myshlyavtsev A.V., Myshlyavtseva M.D., Evseeva S.
Title: The simplest model of adsorption of molecules with different orientations in adlayer on the stepped surface
Affiliations: Omsk State Technical University, Omsk, Russian Federation; Institute of Hydrocarbons Processing SB RAS, Omsk, Russian Federation
Authors with affiliations: Fefelov, V.F., Omsk State Technical University, Omsk, Russian Federation; Gorbunov, V.A., Omsk State Technical University, Omsk, Russian Federation; Myshlyavtsev, A.V., Omsk State Technical University, Omsk, Russian Federation, Institute of Hydrocarbons Processing SB RAS, Omsk, Russian Federation; Myshlyavtseva, M.D., Omsk State Technical University, Omsk, Russian Federation; Evseeva, S., Omsk State Technical University, Omsk, Russian Federation
Abstract: In this article we have constructed and studied using the Monte Carlo and transfer-matrix techniques the simple lattice gas models of self-assembled monolayer, which consists of molecules with different orientations in the adlayer on the stepped surfaces. It was shown that in the case of adsorption of complex molecules the surface heterogeneity of stepped type leads to a great variety of ordered structures comparatively with homogeneous one. The constructed models fairly well reproduce the main features of real SAMs consisting of molecules with different orientations with respect to interface and the model ordered phases are also analogues to the structures of real SAMs. © 2009 Elsevier B.V. All rights reserved.
Author Keywords: Adsorption; Different orientations; Dimer; Monte Carlo method; Self-assembled monolayer
Index Keywords: Adsorption; Dimers; Molecules; Self assembled monolayers; Transfer matrix method; Complex molecules; Different orientations; Lattice gas model; Ordered phasis; Ordered structures; Stepped surfaces; Surface heterogeneities; Transfer matrix technique; Monte Carlo methods

Authors: Myshlyavtsev A.V., Stishenko P.V.
Title: Monte Carlo model of CO adsorption on supported Pt nanoparticle
Affiliations: Omsk State Technical University, Omsk, Russian Federation; Institute of Hydrocarbons Processing SB RAS, Omsk, Russian Federation
Authors with affiliations: Myshlyavtsev, A.V., Omsk State Technical University, Omsk, Russian Federation, Institute of Hydrocarbons Processing SB RAS, Omsk, Russian Federation; Stishenko, P.V., Omsk State Technical University, Omsk, Russian Federation
Abstract: For molecular simulations with thousands of atoms it is desirable to use a lattice gas model because it is fast and easy-to-use for computations. Unfortunately, simulation of adsorption on heterogeneous surfaces within this model is rather complicated due to a large variety of available adsorption site types. We propose the combined model with lattice representation of adsorbent atoms and arbitrary location of adsorbate atoms. Using this model simulation of CO adsorption on supported Pt nanoparticles has been performed. With the proposed approach the above-mentioned difficulties were successfully overcome. © 2009 Elsevier B.V. All rights reserved.
Author Keywords: Adsorption; Carbon monoxide; Monte Carlo simulation; Pt nanoparticle
Index Keywords: Adsorption; Atoms; Carbon monoxide; Intelligent systems; Metal nanoparticles; Platinum; Adsorption site; Heterogeneous surface; Lattice gas model; Lattice representation; Model simulation; Molecular simulations; Monte Carlo model; Pt nanoparticles; Monte Carlo methods

Authors: Shatalin Yu.V., Shubina V.S., Fisyuk A.S.
Title: Influence of biginelli pyrimidine on production reactive oxygen species by polymorphonuclear leukocytes
Affiliations: Pushchino State University, Russian Federation; Institute of Theoretical and Experimental Biophysics RAS, Pyshchino, Russian Federation; F. M. Dostoevsky Omsk State University, Russian Federation
Authors with affiliations: Shatalin, Yu.V., Pushchino State University, Russian Federation, Institute of Theoretical and Experimental Biophysics RAS, Pyshchino, Russian Federation; Shubina, V.S., Pushchino State University, Russian Federation, Institute of Theoretical and Experimental Biophysics RAS, Pyshchino, Russian Federation; Fisyuk, A.S., F. M. Dostoevsky Omsk State University, Russian Federation
Abstract: The effect of 6 synthetic Biginelli pyrimidines on production of reactive oxygen species by polymorphonuclear neutrophils was investigated. It has been shown by method of luminol-dependent chemiluminescence that test compounds in a concentrations of 10-100 μM stimulate production of reactive oxygen species. An increase in the reactive oxygen species production by stimulated neutrophils in the presence of 10 μM 1-(3, 4-di- metoxyphenyl)ethyl-4(alkyl/aryl) substituted Biginelli pyrimidines was 50-90 %. An increase in the priming effect of Biginelli pyrimidines on reactive oxygen species production by neutrophils was noted in the case of replacement of phuryl radical by phenyl and alkyl radicals at C(4) pyrimidine cycle and in the case of replacement benzyl radical at N(1) by 3, 4-dimetoxyphenyl radical. It has been revealed a high inhibitory effect of 1-(3, 4-dimetoxyphenylethyl)-4(alkyl/aryl) substituted Biginelli pyrimidine in concentration 0.01-0.10 μM. It has been found that high concentration of ethyl-1-[2-(3, 4-dimethoxyphenyl)ethyl]-6- methyl-4-phenyl-2- thioxo-1, 2, 3, 4-tetrahydropyrimidine -5-carboxylate (1 mM and more) is able to cause respiratory burst of neutrophils without additional stimulation.
Author Keywords: Biginelli pyrrolidine; Neutrophils; Purine (pyrrolidine) receptors; Reactive oxygen species production

Authors: Bubnov A.V., Bubnova T.A.
Title: Methods of phasing electric drive with phase lock
Authors with affiliations: Bubnov, A.V.; Bubnova, T.A.
Abstract: Questions of constructing phase regulators for synchronous in-phase electric drives of survey and search systems are considered. The phase methods most widely applied in constructing synchronous in-phase electric drives are those with stepwise turning of the electric-drive shaft and that use a phase regulator with quasi-optimal operational speed have been improved. © 2010 Allerton Press, Inc.
Author Keywords: electric drive with phase lock; phasing of the electric drive; survey and search system; synchronous in-phase electric drive
Index Keywords: Drive shaft; In-phase; Phase lock; Phase methods; phasing of the electric drive; Quasi-optimal; Search system; Phase control; Safety devices; Surveys; Electric drives

Authors: Pyanova L.G., Luzyanina L.S., Drozdov V.A., Veselovskaya A.V., Arbuzov A.B., Likholobov V.A.
Title: Study of the effect of a number of oxidizers on variation of composition of surface functional groups, porous structure, and adsorption properties of composite carbon-carbon sorbent
Source title: Protection of Metals and Physical Chemistry of Surfaces
Affiliations: Institute of Hydrocarbon Conversion Problems, Siberian Branch, Russian Academy of Sciences, Omsk, Russian Federation
Authors with affiliations: Pyanova, L.G., Institute of Hydrocarbon Conversion Problems, Siberian Branch, Russian Academy of Sciences, Omsk, Russian Federation; Luzyanina, L.S., Institute of Hydrocarbon Conversion Problems, Siberian Branch, Russian Academy of Sciences, Omsk, Russian Federation; Drozdov, V.A., Institute of Hydrocarbon Conversion Problems, Siberian Branch, Russian Academy of Sciences, Omsk, Russian Federation; Veselovskaya, A.V., Institute of Hydrocarbon Conversion Problems, Siberian Branch, Russian Academy of Sciences, Omsk, Russian Federation; Arbuzov, A.B., Institute of Hydrocarbon Conversion Problems, Siberian Branch, Russian Academy of Sciences, Omsk, Russian Federation; Likholobov, V.A., Institute of Hydrocarbon Conversion Problems, Siberian Branch, Russian Academy of Sciences, Omsk, Russian Federation
Abstract: The oxidation of a carbon-carbon composite sorbent by a number of oxidants results in the variations of the chemical nature of the surface, including an increase in the overall content of surface oxygencontaining groups and, in separate cases, increased variations in its structure-chemical characteristics, primarily in an increase in the percentage of large mesopores. The oxidative modification of the initial sorbent increases the hydrophilicity of its surface and enhances the specific sorption of water vapors. © 2010 Pleiades Publishing, Ltd.

Title: Control of the adsorption capacity of a carbon sorbent with respect to protein molecules by surface modification with aminocaproic acid
Affiliations: Institute of Hydrocarbon Processing Problems, Siberian Branch, Russian Academy of Sciences, Omsk, Russian Federation; Omsk Scientific Center, Siberian Branch, Russian Academy of Sciences, Omsk, Russian Federation; Boreskov Institute of Catalysis, Siberian Branch, Russian Academy of Sciences, Novosibirsk, Russian Federation

Abstract: The carbon sorbent surface was modified with carboxy and amino groups. As modifying agent served aminocaproic acid combining the hydrophilic terminal groups with the hydrophobic hydrocarbon chain, which affords a balance between the groups when contacting proteins. The conditions and parameters of aminocaproic acid polycondensation were elucidated that allows the polymeric modifier to be strongly fixed on the carbon surface. © 2010 Pleiades Publishing, Ltd.

Title: Effect of the concentration of Pt(IV) and Pd(II) chloro complexes on the proportions of their ion-exchanged and coordinatively bound species on the γ-Al2O3 surface
Affiliations: Institute of Hydrocarbon Processing, Siberian Branch, Russian Academy of Sciences, Omsk 644040, Russian Federation
Authors with affiliations: Bel'skaya, O.B., Institute of Hydrocarbon Processing, Siberian Branch, Russian Academy of Sciences, Omsk 644040, Russian Federation; Maevskaya, O.V., Institute of Hydrocarbon Processing, Siberian Branch, Russian Academy of Sciences, Omsk 644040, Russian Federation; Arbuzov, A.B., Institute of Hydrocarbon Processing, Siberian Branch, Russian Academy of Sciences, Omsk 644040, Russian Federation; Kireeva, T.V., Institute of Hydrocarbon Processing, Siberian Branch, Russian Academy of Sciences, Omsk 644040, Russian Federation; Duplyakin, V.K., Institute of Hydrocarbon Processing, Siberian Branch, Russian Academy of Sciences, Omsk 644040, Russian Federation; Likholobov, V.A., Institute of Hydrocarbon Processing, Siberian Branch, Russian Academy of Sciences, Omsk 644040, Russian Federation
Abstract: The interaction of platinum(IV) and palladium(II) chloro complexes with the γ-Al2O3 surface in a wide range of surface metal concentrations is reported. Varying the concentration of the adsorbed metal complex on the alumina surface causes changes both in the proportions of weakly and strongly bound desorbable platinum species and in the proportions of desorbable (ion-exchanged) and nondesorbable (coordinatively bound) complexes. The adsorbed palladium complexes are more uniform in chemical composition and binding strength and consist largely of desorbable species removable from the surface by competitive sorption of anions. The absolute amount of coordinatively bound platinum and palladium species increases as the total metal content of the sample is raised to 1.0% and remains almost invariable at higher metal contents. © 2010 Pleiades Publishing, Ltd.
Funding Text 1: This study was supported by the Russian Founda tion for Basic Research, grant no. 06 03 32862.

Authors: Bel'skaya O.B., Gulyaeva T.I., Arbuzov A.B., Duplyakin V.K., Likholobov V.A.
Title: Interaction between Pt(IV) and Pd(II) chloro complexes in solution and on the γ-Al2O3 surface
Affiliations: Institute of Hydrocarbon Processing, Siberian Branch, Russian Academy of Sciences, Omsk 644040, Russian Federation
Authors with affiliations: Bel'skaya, O.B., Institute of Hydrocarbon Processing, Siberian Branch, Russian Academy of Sciences, Omsk 644040, Russian Federation; Gulyaeva, T.I., Institute of Hydrocarbon Processing, Siberian Branch, Russian Academy of Sciences, Omsk 644040, Russian Federation; Arbuzov, A.B., Institute of Hydrocarbon Processing, Siberian Branch, Russian Academy of Sciences, Omsk 644040, Russian Federation; Duplyakin, V.K., Institute of Hydrocarbon Processing, Siberian Branch, Russian Academy of Sciences, Omsk 644040, Russian Federation; Likholobov, V.A., Institute of Hydrocarbon Processing, Siberian Branch, Russian Academy of Sciences, Omsk 644040, Russian Federation
Abstract: The conversions of a mixture of platinum(IV) and palladium(II) chloro complexes in aqueous solution and on the γ-Al2O3 surface at 25-150°C are reported. Heat treatment can initiate interaction between the complexes, both dissolved and adsorbed. The hydrolysis of the chloroplatinate ion is accelerated by the palladium chloro complex, whose composition remains unchanged. © 2010 Pleiades Publishing, Ltd.

Authors: Rybalov A.N.
Title: Generic complexity of presburger arithmetic
Affiliations: Omsk Branch of the Institute of Mathematics of SB RAS, Pevtsova, 13, Omsk 644099, Russian Federation
Authors with affiliations: Rybalov, A.N., Omsk Branch of the Institute of Mathematics of SB RAS, Pevtsova, 13, Omsk 644099, Russian Federation
Abstract: Fischer and Rabin proved in (Proceedings of the SIAM-AMS Symposium in Applied Mathematics, vol. 7, pp. 27-41, 1974) that the decision problem for Presburger Arithmetic has at least double exponential worst-case complexity (for deterministic and for nondeterministic Turing machines). In Kapovich et al. (J. Algebra 264(2):665-694, 2003) a theory of generic-case complexity was developed, where algorithmic problems are studied on "most" inputs instead of set of all inputs. A question rises about existing of more efficient (say, polynomial) generic algorithm deciding Presburger Arithmetic on a set of closed formulas of asymptotic density 1. We prove in this paper that there is not an exponential generic decision algorithm working correctly on an input set of asymptotic density exponentially converging to 1 (so-called strongly generic sets). © 2008 Springer Science+Business Media, LLC.
Author Keywords: Generic complexity; Presburger arithmetic
Index Keywords: Computer programming; Digital arithmetic; Turing machines; Algorithmic problems; Applied mathematics; Asymptotic density; Double exponential; Generic algorithm; Generic complexity; Presburger arithmetic; Worst-case complexity; Parallel processing systems
Funding Details: Russian Foundation for Basic Research, RFBR: 07-01-00392, 08-01-00067

Authors: Kuznetsova O.P., Yumayev E.A.
Title: Priority support policy regarding constituent entities being the «engines» of the Russian economy
Authors with affiliations: Kuznetsova, O.P.; Yumayev, E.A.
Abstract: Two principal directions of state regional policy adoption have been considered: «equalization» and support of the «engine» constituent entities. Drawbacks of the priority support policy of the most developed entities have been singled out. Recommendations have been formulated; following them will make it possible to eliminate the revealed drawbacks and to use the priority support of the «engine» constituent entities in the context of the state regional policy adoption as a top-priority. Foreign experience of adopting regional policy has been employed in the course of writing the paper (European Union, China, France).

Authors: Morar P.V., Shevlyakov A.N.
Title: Algebraic geometry over the additive monoid of natural numbers: Systems of coefficient free equations
Affiliations: Omsk Department of Institute of Mathematics, Siberian Branch of the Russian Academy of Sciences, Pevtsova st. 13, Omsk, 644099, Russian Federation
Authors with affiliations: Morar, P.V., Omsk Department of Institute of Mathematics, Siberian Branch of the Russian Academy of Sciences, Pevtsova st. 13, Omsk, 644099, Russian Federation; Shevlyakov, A.N., Omsk Department of Institute of Mathematics, Siberian Branch of the Russian Academy of Sciences, Pevtsova st. 13, Omsk, 644099, Russian Federation
Abstract: In the paper we consider homogeneous systems of linear equations and classify coordinate monoids over the additive monoid of natural numbers which are defined by such systems. Further, we apply our results to the wide class of commutative monoids. © 2010 Springer Basel AG.

Authors: Naumenko A.P.
Title: Diagnostics and condition monitoring of piston compressors
Source title: 7th International Conference on Condition Monitoring and Machinery Failure Prevention Technologies 2010, CM 2010/MFPT 2010
Affiliations: Omsk State Technical University, Omsk, 644050, Russian Federation
Authors with affiliations: Naumenko, A.P., Omsk State Technical University, Omsk, 644050, Russian Federation
Abstract: The analysis of vibroacoustic oscillations sources of reciprocating compressors is made. The model of vibroacoustic signal of reciprocating compressor based on vibroacoustic oscillations sources analysis is presented. The model of a signal is formed on the basis of noise and periodic components of vibroacoustic signal and their intermodulation component. Diagnostic features of reciprocating compressor units' defects which are formed on the basis of vibroacoustic signal model are considered. Use of these diagnostic features allows to implement the condition monitoring of all units and details of a reciprocating compressor and to execute automatic diagnosing without participation of experts. The scheme of system for diagnostics and condition monitoring of various reciprocating compressors components based on parameters of vibroacoustic signals is offered. Practical examples of operation of system for diagnostics and condition monitoring of reciprocating compressors state are reviewed. Opportunities of results use of a condition monitoring system operation with the purpose of improvement of reciprocating compressor state are shown. The designed diagnostics and condition monitoring system of reciprocating compressors uses five sensors of vibroacoustic signals on one cylinder and provides safe and accident-free operation of reciprocating compressors.
Author Keywords: Automatic expert system; Diagnostics; Piston compressor; Real-time condition monitoring; Reciprocating compressor; Vibrodiagnostic
Index Keywords: Compressors; Condition monitoring; Expert systems; Pistons; Plasma diagnostics; Condition monitoring systems; Diagnostic features; Inter-modulation components; Periodic components; Piston compressor; Real time condition monitoring; Signal modeling; Vibrodiagnostic; Reciprocating compressors

Authors: Kruglov A.G., Nikiforova A.B., Shatalin Y.V., Shubina V.V., Fisyuk A.S., Akatov V.S.
Title: Sulfur-containing compounds quench 3,7-dihydro-2-methyl-6-(4-methoxyphenyl)imidazol[1,2-a]pyrazine-3-one chemiluminescence: Discrimination between true antioxidants and quenchers using xanthine oxidase
Affiliations: Institute of Theoretical and Experimental Biophysics, Russian Academy of Sciences, Pushchino, 142290 Moscow Region, Russian Federation; Dostoevsky Omsk State University, 644077 Omsk, Russian Federation
Authors with affiliations: Kruglov, A.G., Institute of Theoretical and Experimental Biophysics, Russian Academy of Sciences, Pushchino, 142290 Moscow Region, Russian Federation; Nikiforova, A.B., Institute of Theoretical and Experimental Biophysics, Russian Academy of Sciences, Pushchino, 142290 Moscow Region, Russian Federation; Shatalin, Y.V., Institute of Theoretical and Experimental Biophysics, Russian Academy of Sciences, Pushchino, 142290 Moscow Region, Russian Federation; Shubina, V.V., Institute of Theoretical and Experimental Biophysics, Russian Academy of Sciences, Pushchino, 142290 Moscow Region, Russian Federation; Fisyuk, A.S., Dostoevsky Omsk State University, 644077 Omsk, Russian Federation; Akatov, V.S., Institute of Theoretical and Experimental Biophysics, Russian Academy of Sciences, Pushchino, 142290 Moscow Region, Russian Federation
Abstract: The probe 3,7-dihydro-2-methyl-6-(4-methoxyphenyl)imidazol[1,2-a]pyrazine-3-one (MCLA) is widely used for studying the superoxide anion production and the efficiency of antioxidants in biological systems. Here we report that a number of sulfur-containing compounds applied in biochemical and cytological studies are able to suppress MCLA-derived chemiluminescence (MDCL) independent of their capability to scavenge superoxide anion. The most effective MDCL quenchers appeared to be the substances with thiocarbamoyl and thiocarbonyl groups coupled to cyclic molecules and several thiol- and disulfide-containing compounds. The analysis of MDCL kinetics in a xanthine oxidase system allows one to rapidly discriminate between true antioxidants and the quenchers of chemiluminescence. © 2010 Elsevier Inc.

Authors: Zadorozhnyi V.N.
Title: Optimizing uniform non-Markov queueing networks

Abstract: We propose a new efficient analytic-imitational method of optimizing non-Markov queueing networks. We estimate its convergence speed and precision with experiments and give practical recommendations for its use. © Pleiades Publishing, Ltd., 2010.

Authors: Gontchar I.I., Chushnyakova M.V.
Title: A C-code for the double folding interaction potential of two spherical nuclei
Affiliations: Omsk State Railway University, Omsk, 644042, Russian Federation; Omsk State University, Omsk, 644077, Russian Federation
Authors with affiliations: Gontchar, I.I., Omsk State Railway University, Omsk, 644042, Russian Federation; Chushnyakova, M.V., Omsk State University, Omsk, 644077, Russian Federation
Abstract: We present a C-code designed to obtain the nucleus-nucleus potential by using the double folding model (DFM) and in particular to find the Coulomb barrier. The program calculates the nucleus-nucleus potential as a function of the distance between the centers of mass of colliding nuclei. The most important output parameters are the Coulomb barrier energy and the radius. Since many researchers use a Woods-Saxon profile for the nuclear term of the potential we provide an option in our code for fitting the DFM potential by such a profile. Program summary: Program title: DFMSPH. Catalogue identifier: AEFH_v1_0. Program summary URL: http://cpc.cs.qub.ac.uk/summaries/AEFH_v1_0.html. Program obtainable from: CPC Program Library, Queen's University, Belfast, N. Ireland. Licensing provisions: Standard CPC licence, http://cpc.cs.qub.ac.uk/licence/licence.html. No. of lines in distributed program, including test data, etc.: 5929. No. of bytes in distributed program, including test data, etc.: 115 740. Distribution format: tar.gz. Programming language: C. Computer: PC. Operating system: Windows XP (with the GCC-compiler version 2). RAM: Below 10 Mbyte. Classification: 17.9. Nature of problem: The code calculates in a semimicroscopic way the bare interaction potential between two colliding spherical nuclei as a function of the center of mass distance. The height and the position of the Coulomb barrier are found. The calculated potential is approximated by a conventional Woods-Saxon profile near the barrier. Dependence of the barrier parameters upon the characteristics of the effective NN forces (like, e.g. the range of the exchange part of the nuclear term) can be investigated. Solution method: The nucleus-nucleus potential is calculated using the double folding model with the Coulomb and the effective M3Y NN interactions. For the direct parts of the Coulomb and the nuclear terms, the Fourier transform method is used. In order to calculate the exchange parts the density matrix expansion method is applied. Running time: Less than 1 minute using a PC with a 1.60 GHz processor. © 2009 Elsevier B.V. All rights reserved.

Authors: Kalekin V.S., Kalekin D.V., Bakulina V.D., Kapanin S.N., Leonov A.L., Plotnikov V.A., Riger F.
Title: Hydrodynamics and heat and mass exchange in a centrifugal-bubbling vessel
Affiliations: Omsk State Technical University, Omsk, Russian Federation; Kuzbass State Technical University, Kemerovo, Russian Federation; Czech Technical University, Prague, Czech Republic
Authors with affiliations: Kalekin, V.S., Omsk State Technical University, Omsk, Russian Federation; Kalekin, D.V., Omsk State Technical University, Omsk, Russian Federation; Bakulina, V.D., Omsk State Technical University, Omsk, Russian Federation; Kapanin, S.N., Omsk State Technical University, Omsk, Russian Federation; Leonov, A.L., Omsk State Technical University, Omsk, Russian Federation; Plotnikov, V.A., Kuzbass State Technical University, Kemerovo, Russian Federation; Riger, F., Czech Technical University, Prague, Czech Republic
Abstract: Results of experimental investigations of the hydrodynamics and heat and mass exchange of a centrifugal-bubbling vessel are presented in the form of criterial relationships. Owing to the high rate of heat mass transfer, the possibility of regulating the dwell time in the zone of contact with a gaseous flow, small clearance dimensions, low splash over, and simple design, centrifugal-bubbling (vortical-foam) vessels can be referred to as promising for use as water and gas coolers, absorbers, reactors for gas-liquid systems, etc. © 2009 Springer Science+Business Media, Inc.

Authors: Fefelov V.F., Gorbunov V.A., Myshlyavtsev A.V., Myshlyavtseva M.D.
Title: The simplest self-assembled monolayer model with different orientations of complex organic molecules. Monte Carlo and transfer-matrix techniques
Affiliations: Omsk State Technical University, Omsk, Russian Federation; Institute of Hydrocarbons Processing SB RAS, Omsk, Russian Federation
Authors with affiliations: Fefelov, V.F., Omsk State Technical University, Omsk, Russian Federation; Gorbunov, V.A., Omsk State Technical University, Omsk, Russian Federation; Myshlyavtsev, A.V., Omsk State Technical University, Omsk, Russian Federation, Institute of Hydrocarbons Processing SB RAS, Omsk, Russian Federation; Myshlyavtseva, M.D., Omsk State Technical University, Omsk, Russian Federation
Abstract: In the present paper we construct and study the simplest model of self-assembled monolayer (SAM) with several different orientations of complicated organic molecules with respect to the interface. In order to study the model we used transfer-matrix and Monte Carlo techniques. It was shown that the structures of the model ordered phases are analogous to the structures of real SAMs. Our model of SAMs demonstrates the non-monotonous dependence of the total coverage versus pressure (chemical potential), i.e. at the increase of pressure the empty surface area can grow that can take some effect on physicochemical processes on surface. © 2009 Elsevier B.V. All rights reserved.

Authors: Bumagin G.I., Bur'yan Y.A., Rogal'skii E.I.
Title: Updating K-0.4 and AK-1.5 type of medium-pressure air-fractionating installations
Affiliations: Omsk State Technical University, Omsk, Russian Federation; Scientific and Technical Complex for Cryogenic Engineering (NTK Kriogennaya Tekhnika), Omsk, Russian Federation
Authors with affiliations: Bumagin, G.I., Omsk State Technical University, Omsk, Russian Federation; Bur'yan, Y.A., Omsk State Technical University, Omsk, Russian Federation; Rogal'skii, E.I., Scientific and Technical Complex for Cryogenic Engineering (NTK Kriogennaya Tekhnika), Omsk, Russian Federation
Abstract: Updating of K-0.4-type medium-pressure air-fractionating installation (AFI) built by Kislorodmash, which is in operation at the Omsk Autogenous (Gas) Plant, is described. Promising AFI updating schemes for increasing liquid oxygen yield are given. Some updating alternatives are compared. The salient results of the updating are reported. © 2009 Springer Science+Business Media, Inc.

Authors: Bumagin G.I., Bur'yan Y.A., Lapkova A.G., Rakhanskii A.E., Rogal'skii E.I.
Title: Physics of processes in the expansion stages of an electrogasdynamic generator with a new electrode system with a pulsed voltage
Affiliations: Omsk State Technical University (OmGTU), Omsk, Russian Federation; Scientific and Technical Complex for Cryogenic Engineering (NTK Kriogennaya Tekhnika), Omsk, Russian Federation
Authors with affiliations: Bumagin, G.I., Omsk State Technical University (OmGTU), Omsk, Russian Federation; Bur'yan, Y.A., Omsk State Technical University (OmGTU), Omsk, Russian Federation; Lapkova, A.G., Omsk State Technical University (OmGTU), Omsk, Russian Federation; Rakhanskii, A.E., Scientific and Technical Complex for Cryogenic Engineering (NTK Kriogennaya Tekhnika), Omsk, Russian Federation; Rogal'skii, E.I., Scientific and Technical Complex for Cryogenic Engineering (NTK Kriogennaya Tekhnika), Omsk, Russian Federation
Abstract: A construction is proposed for an electrogasdynamic expansion generator with a new electrode system making it possible to create beside an emitter with a corona discharge a relatively large volume of charges, and as a consequence considerable convective current strength, that makes it possible to develop in one generator expansion stage relatively considerable power (up to several kilowatts). This construction provide a solution to the problem of determining the convective current strength and displacement current strength, that arises around the surface of the corona electrode with a pulsed voltage in relation to the magnitude and shape of the applied voltage, electrode system construction, working medium parameters and flow rate. © 2009 Springer Science+Business Media, Inc.

Authors: Bel'skaya O.B., Drozdov V.A., Gulyaeva T.I., Arbuzov A.B., Moroz E.M., Zyuzin D.A., Paukshtis E.A., Larina T.V., Duplyakin V.K.
Title: Effect of hydrothermal treatment on the composition and structure of Pt(IV) hydroxo complexes as model precursors of the active component in Pt/Al2O3 catalysts
Affiliations: Institute of Hydrocarbon Processing, Siberian Branch, Russian Academy of Sciences, Omsk 644040, Russian Federation; Boreskov Institute of Catalysis, Siberian Branch, Russian Academy of Sciences, Novosibirsk 630090, Russian Federation
Authors with affiliations: Bel'skaya, O.B., Institute of Hydrocarbon Processing, Siberian Branch, Russian Academy of Sciences, Omsk 644040, Russian Federation; Drozdov, V.A., Institute of Hydrocarbon Processing, Siberian Branch, Russian Academy of Sciences, Omsk 644040, Russian Federation; Gulyaeva, T.I., Institute of Hydrocarbon Processing, Siberian Branch, Russian Academy of Sciences, Omsk 644040, Russian Federation; Arbuzov, A.B., Institute of Hydrocarbon Processing, Siberian Branch, Russian Academy of Sciences, Omsk 644040, Russian Federation; Moroz, E.M., Boreskov Institute of Catalysis, Siberian Branch, Russian Academy of Sciences, Novosibirsk 630090, Russian Federation; Zyuzin, D.A., Boreskov Institute of Catalysis, Siberian Branch, Russian Academy of Sciences, Novosibirsk 630090, Russian Federation; Paukshtis, E.A., Boreskov Institute of Catalysis, Siberian Branch, Russian Academy of Sciences, Novosibirsk 630090, Russian Federation; Larina, T.V., Boreskov Institute of Catalysis, Siberian Branch, Russian Academy of Sciences, Novosibirsk 630090, Russian Federation; Duplyakin, V.K., Boreskov Institute of Catalysis, Siberian Branch, Russian Academy of Sciences, Novosibirsk 630090, Russian Federation
Abstract: The influence of hydrothermal treatment conditions (temperature, duration, acidity of the medium) on the structural and chemical transformations of the complex H2[Pt(OH)6] was studied. The composition and structure of the resulting compounds were determined by several physicochemical methods. Thermal analysis coupled with mass spectrometry showed that, as the hydrothermal treatment temperature is raised from 25 to 120 and 150°C, the product composition in terms of empirical formulas changes as follows: PtO2 • 4H2O → PtO2 • 3.5H2O → PtO2 • 1.5H2O. X-ray diffraction and UV and IR spectroscopy demonstrated that the changes in the chemical composition are accompanied by the amorphization of the structure and Pt-O bond strengthening. X-ray structure determination using the radial electron density distribution method showed that polynuclear species 10-15 Å in size with a structure similar to that of orthorhombic PtO2 form in the complexes subjected to "hard" hydrothermal treatment (T ≥ 150°C). © 2009 Pleiades Publishing, Ltd.

Authors: Smolikov M.D., Dzhikiya O.V., Zatolokina E.V., Kir'Yanov D.I., Belyi A.S.
Title: Isomerization of n-hexane over bifunctional Pt/SO4 /ZrO 2 catalysts
Affiliations: Institute of Hydrocarbon Processing Problems, Siberian Branch, Russian Academy of Sciences, ul. Neftezavodskaya 54, Omsk 644040, Russian Federation
Authors with affiliations: Smolikov, M.D., Institute of Hydrocarbon Processing Problems, Siberian Branch, Russian Academy of Sciences, ul. Neftezavodskaya 54, Omsk 644040, Russian Federation; Kir'Yanov, D.I., Institute of Hydrocarbon Processing Problems, Siberian Branch, Russian Academy of Sciences, ul. Neftezavodskaya 54, Omsk 644040, Russian Federation; Belyi, A.S., Institute of Hydrocarbon Processing Problems, Siberian Branch, Russian Academy of Sciences, ul. Neftezavodskaya 54, Omsk 644040, Russian Federation
Abstract: The catalytic properties of model Pt/SiO2 and Pt/Al 2O3 catalysts and their physical mixtures with SO 4/ZrO2 in the reaction of n-hexane isomerization have been studied. Significant effects of the influence of the platinum state on the characteristics of isomerization on the catalysts and their physical mixtures with SO4/ZrO2 have been revealed. The observed changes in catalytic performance of the mixed catalysts have been explained from the position of a bifunctional mechanism with the participation of ionic platinum promoting the formation of hydride ions, which play an important role in the activation of transformations of intermediates in isomerization reactions. © 2009 Pleiades Publishing, Ltd.

Authors: Khamitov R.N., Aver'yanov G.S., Korchagin A.B.
Title: Pneumatic shock absorber with an active damping system
Affiliations: Omsk State Technical University, Omsk, Russian Federation
Authors with affiliations: Khamitov, R.N., Omsk State Technical University, Omsk, Russian Federation; Aver'yanov, G.S., Omsk State Technical University, Omsk, Russian Federation; Korchagin, A.B., Omsk State Technical University, Omsk, Russian Federation
Abstract: A device with improved damping properties is considered. A model describing the thermodynamic and gas-dynamic processes within the device and the dynamics of the protected object is outlined. On the basis of the model, the principles governing the operation of the device may be identified, and the elastic-damping characteristic may be derived. © Allerton Press, Inc. 2009.

Authors: Syrkin V.V., Shalaev V.S., Dranitsin V.V.
Title: Selecting the design parameters for wind-power systems
Affiliations: Siberian State Highway Academy, Omsk, Russian Federation
Authors with affiliations: Syrkin, V.V., Siberian State Highway Academy, Omsk, Russian Federation; Shalaev, V.S., Siberian State Highway Academy, Omsk, Russian Federation; Dranitsin, V.V., Siberian State Highway Academy, Omsk, Russian Federation
Abstract: Rotor design for wind-power systems is analyzed. The most effective design is based on a vertical rotor axis. The design parameters of a wind-power unit for wind conditions in the Omsk region are selected on the basis of calculation and cost analysis. Recommendations are made regarding the number of wind-power units for a wind-power station. © Allerton Press, Inc. 2009.

Title: Effect of ethanol on optical and electrical parameters of porous silicon
Affiliations: Omsk Branch of the Rzhanov Institute of Semiconductor Physics, Siberian Branch of the Russian Academy of Sciences, Pyataya Kordnaya ul. 29, Omsk, 644018, Russian Federation
Authors with affiliations: Bolotov, V.V., Omsk Branch of the Rzhanov Institute of Semiconductor Physics, Siberian Branch of the Russian Academy of Sciences, Pyataya Kordnaya ul. 29, Omsk, 644018, Russian Federation; Sten'kin, Y.A., Omsk Branch of the Rzhanov Institute of Semiconductor Physics, Siberian Branch of the Russian Academy of Sciences, Pyataya Kordnaya ul. 29, Omsk, 644018, Russian Federation; Roslikov, V.E., Omsk Branch of the Rzhanov Institute of Semiconductor Physics, Siberian Branch of the Russian Academy of Sciences, Pyataya Kordnaya ul. 29, Omsk, 644018, Russian Federation; Kang, V.E., Omsk Branch of the Rzhanov Institute of Semiconductor Physics, Siberian Branch of the Russian Academy of Sciences, Pyataya Kordnaya ul. 29, Omsk, 644018, Russian Federation; Ponomareva, I.V., Omsk Branch of the Rzhanov Institute of Semiconductor Physics, Siberian Branch of the Russian Academy of Sciences, Pyataya Kordnaya ul. 29, Omsk, 644018, Russian Federation; Nesov, S.N., Omsk Branch of the Rzhanov Institute of Semiconductor Physics, Siberian Branch of the Russian Academy of Sciences, Pyataya Kordnaya ul. 29, Omsk, 644018, Russian Federation
Abstract: The effect of ethanol vapor adsorption on the properties of porous silicon-based structures was studied by Raman scattering, infrared spectroscopy, and I-V characteristics. A decrease in the resistance of porous silicon layers and a simultaneous increase in the intensity of the band of infrared absorption caused by the presence of (OH)-...x(OH)- (x = 1, 2, ...) groups upon exposure to ethanol vapor and vice versa in the case of degassing were detected. The observed effect is attributed to a change in the depletion region in por-Si skeleton elements due to the electrostatic interaction of (OH)- groups with positively charged surface defects. The effect of hydrogen-bonded Si-OH...OH-C2H5 centers on the increase in the silicon conductivity is discussed. © Pleiades Publishing, Ltd., 2009.

Title: L-class enumeration algorithms for a discrete production planning problem with interval resource quantities
Affiliations: Omsk State Technical University, 11, Mir av, Omsk, 644050, Russian Federation; Omsk Branch, Sobolev Institute of Mathematics, Russian Academy of Sciences, 13, Pevtsov St, Omsk, 644099, Russian Federation

Abstract: A discrete production planning problem which may be formulated as the multidimensional knapsack problem is considered, while resource quantities of the problem are supposed to be given as intervals. An approach for solving this problem based on using its relaxation set is suggested. Some L-class enumeration algorithms for the problem are described. Results of computational experiments are presented. © 2007 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Authors: Naumenko A.P.
Title: Real-time condition monitoring of reciprocating machines
Source title: 6th International Conference on Condition Monitoring and Machinery Failure Prevention Technologies 2009
Affiliations: Omsk State Technical University, Omsk, 644050, Russian Federation
Authors with affiliations: Naumenko, A.P., Omsk State Technical University, Omsk, 644050, Russian Federation
Abstract: Development of automatic diagnostics principles and on-line condition monitoring of reciprocating machines is an actual problem. Multipleparameter processing vibroacoustic signals received in various points of the reciprocating compressor, allows to define a state practically all important units and details of the reciprocating compressor. So, the analysis of a vibroacoustic signal level according to a cyclogram of valves job allows to fix degradation of valves, and also an originating of their various malfunctions. Thus change of a signal magnitude, displacement vibroacoustic impulses on a shaft turn corner characterizes change of compression a shaft depending on physical and chemical properties of gas, including occurrence of hydraulic microshocks, change of an operating mode of valves and occurrence of malfunctions of their details. The analysis of vibration in various high-frequency bands allows to estimate on the basis of magnitudes interrelation analysis of frequency combinational making harmonics of a cranked shaft rotation technical states of the reciprocating compressor units. Real-time condition monitoring system of reciprocating machines is described. This system allows by the analysis of parameters vibroacoustic a signal and parameters of other physical processes to carry out automatic without participation of the operator diagnosing of the basic defects and malfunctions of reciprocating compressors. Examples of real-time condition monitoring of reciprocating compressors which confirm a high system efficiency are described.
Index Keywords: Compressors; Condition monitoring; Frequency bands; Hydraulic machinery; Shaft displacement; Automatic diagnostics; High frequency bands; Online condition monitoring; Physical and chemical properties; Real time condition monitoring; Reciprocating machine; Signal magnitude; System efficiency; Reciprocating compressors

Authors: Devyaterikova M.V., Kolokolov A.A., Kolosov A.P.
Title: One approach to solving a discrete production planning problem with interval data
Source title: Proceedings of the Steklov Institute of Mathematics
Affiliations: Omsk Branch of the Sobolev Institute of Mathematics, Siberian Division, Russian Academy of Sciences, ul. Pevtsova 13, 644099, Omsk, Russian Federation
Authors with affiliations: Devyaterikova, M.V., Omsk Branch of the Sobolev Institute of Mathematics, Siberian Division, Russian Academy of Sciences, ul. Pevtsova 13, 644099, Omsk, Russian Federation; Kolokolov, A.A., Omsk Branch of the Sobolev Institute of Mathematics, Siberian Division, Russian Academy of Sciences, ul. Pevtsova 13, 644099, Omsk, Russian Federation; Kolosov, A.P., Omsk Branch of the Sobolev Institute of Mathematics, Siberian Division, Russian Academy of Sciences, ul. Pevtsova 13, 644099, Omsk, Russian Federation
Abstract: In this paper, we develop an approach to solving integer programming problems with interval data based on using the possibilities of varying the relaxation set of the problem. This is illustrated by means of an L-class enumeration algorithm for solving a dicrete production planning problem. We describe the algorithm and a number of its modifications and present results of a computational experiment for families of problems from the OR Library and with randomly generated initial data. This approach is also applied to obtain approximate solutions of the mentioned problem in its conventional setting. © 2008 Pleiades Publishing, Ltd.

Authors: Syrkin V.V., Dranitsin V.V.
Title: Hydraulic drives in wind-power systems
Affiliations: Siberian State Highway Academy, Omsk, Russian Federation
Authors with affiliations: Syrkin, V.V., Siberian State Highway Academy, Omsk, Russian Federation; Dranitsin, V.V., Siberian State Highway Academy, Omsk, Russian Federation
Abstract: Choke regulation of the shaft speed in a hydraulic motor connected to an electrogenerator is considered on the basis of a mathematical model, with a view to stabilizing the speed. Linearization of the basic nonlinearities permits identification of the capabilities of the given drive, which may be used as a braking mechanism when the windmill turns at impermissible speeds. © Allerton Press, Inc. 2008.

Authors: Zykina A.V.
Title: Inverse complementarity in a resource deficit model
Affiliations: Omsk State Technical University, pr. Mira 11, Omsk 644050, Russian Federation
Authors with affiliations: Zykina, A.V., Omsk State Technical University, pr. Mira 11, Omsk 644050, Russian Federation
Abstract: The concept of inverse complementarity for a parametric family of optimization problems is introduced. This concept is an effective tool for solving complicated applied problems arising in socioeconomic systems. As an example, a nonlinear resource deficit model is constructed in which the equilibrium is characterized by an external market value of resources coinciding with internal objectively determined resource estimates. An extraproximal method is proposed for computing an equilibrium solution. The convergence of the method is proved. © 2008 Pleiades Publishing, Ltd.

Abstract: The classification of monitoring systems and communication systems as a base of MS are examined in this paper. Authors: Bel'skaya O.B., Karymova R.Kh., Kochubey D.I., Duplyakin V.K.
Title: Genesis of the active-component precursor in the synthesis of Pt/Al 2O3 catalysts: I. Transformation of the [PtCl 6]2- complex in the interaction between chloroplatinic acid and the γ-Al2O3 surface
Affiliations: Institute of Hydrocarbon Processing, Siberian Branch, Russian Academy of Sciences, Omsk 644040, Russian Federation; Boreskov Institute of Catalysis, Siberian Branch, Russian Academy of Science, Novosibirsk 630090, Russian Federation
Authors with affiliations: Bel'skaya, O.B., Institute of Hydrocarbon Processing, Siberian Branch, Russian Academy of Sciences, Omsk 644040, Russian Federation; Karymova, R.Kh., Institute of Hydrocarbon Processing, Siberian Branch, Russian Academy of Sciences, Omsk 644040, Russian Federation; Kochubey, D.I., Boreskov Institute of Catalysis, Siberian Branch, Russian Academy of Science, Novosibirsk 630090, Russian Federation; Duplyakin, V.K., Institute of Hydrocarbon Processing, Siberian Branch, Russian Academy of Sciences, Omsk 644040, Russian Federation
Abstract: Gradient elution experiments have revealed the difference between platinum complexes in terms of the strength of their interaction with the alumina surface. A considerable part (30-40%) of the supported platinum is nondesorbable via competitive ion exchange reactions or upon changes in the charge state of the support surface. The surface platinum complexes can be divided into ion-exchangeable and coordinatively fixed species according to the nature of their bonding with aluminum oxide. Combining desorption and spectroscopic methods (EXAFS and diffuse reflectance spectroscopy) has made it possible to characterize the surface complexes. The strongest metal-support interaction takes place in the fixation of hydrolyzed platinum species. © 2008 MAIK Nauka.
Funding Details: Russian Foundation for Basic Research, RFBR: 06-03-32862
Funding Text 1: demonstrated that, even in dilute solutions, most of the chloride ions are in the coordination sphere of platinum and the average composition of the complexes is [PtCl5.7(H2O)0.3]–1.7. This inference is supported by spectroscopic data for the solutions.

Authors: Bel'skaya O.B., Karymova R.Kh., Kochubei D.I., Duplyakin V.K.
Title: Genesis of the active-component precursor in the synthesis of Pt/Al 2O3 catalysts: II. Synthesis of platinum hydroxo complexes on the alumina surface as precursors of the active component of Pt/Al 2O3 catalysts
Affiliations: Institute of Hydrocarbon Processing, Siberian Branch, Russian Academy of Sciences, Omsk 644040, Russian Federation; Boreskov Institute of Catalysis, Siberian Branch, Russian Academy of Science, Novosibirsk 630090, Russian Federation
Authors with affiliations: Bel'skaya, O.B., Institute of Hydrocarbon Processing, Siberian Branch, Russian Academy of Sciences, Omsk 644040, Russian Federation; Karymova, R.Kh., Institute of Hydrocarbon Processing, Siberian Branch, Russian Academy of Sciences, Omsk 644040, Russian Federation; Kochubei, D.I., Boreskov Institute of Catalysis, Siberian Branch, Russian Academy of Science, Novosibirsk 630090, Russian Federation; Duplyakin, V.K., Institute of Hydrocarbon Processing, Siberian Branch, Russian Academy of Sciences, Omsk 644040, Russian Federation
Abstract: The thermal hydrolysis of chloroplatinate adsorbed on γ-Al 2O3 is a possible approach to the synthesis of surface platinum hydroxo complexes as precursors to the active component of supported platinum catalysts. It is demonstrated by EXAFS and diffuse reflectance spectroscopy that the surface chloro complexes undergo deep hydrolysis under hydrothermal conditions at various processing times and temperatures. The average oxygen coordination number of platinum in these complexes is as large as 4.5. According to gradient elution data obtained using both the competitive replacement of adsorbed complex anions and variation of the charged state of the oxide surface, the resulting hydrolyzed precursor differs from the conventional chloride precursor in the nature of binding to the surface and interacts with alumina via a coordination mechanism. © 2008 MAIK Nauka.

Abstract: The damping properties of pneumatic shock absorbers may be improved by controlling the restoring force. Authors: Magazev A.A., Shirokov I.V., Yurevich Yu.A.
Title: Integrable magnetic geodesic flows on lie groups
Affiliations: Irtysh Branch, Novosibirsk State Academy for Water Transport, Omsk, Russian Federation; Omsk State University, Omsk, Russian Federation
Authors with affiliations: Magazev, A.A., Irtysh Branch, Novosibirsk State Academy for Water Transport, Omsk, Russian Federation; Shirokov, I.V., Irtysh Branch, Novosibirsk State Academy for Water Transport, Omsk, Russian Federation; Yurevich, Yu.A., Omsk State University, Omsk, Russian Federation
Abstract: On Lie group manifolds, we consider right-invariant magnetic geodesic flows associated with 2-cocycles of the corresponding Lie algebras. We investigate the algebra of the integrals of motion of magnetic geodesic flows and also formulate a necessary and sufficient condition for their integrability in quadratures, giving the canonical forms of 2-cocycles for all four-dimensional Lie algebras and selecting integrable cases. © 2008 MAIK/Nauka.

Abstract: A new approach to improving the damping of pneumatic shock absorbers is described; this method based on active regulation of the gas flow between different volumes of the shock absorber. Authors: Gul'kin A.V., Postnikov D.V.
Title: Damage of beryllium surface under irradiation with a high-current electron beam
Affiliations: Institute of Atomic Energy, National Nuclear Center of the Republic of Kazakhstan, Kurchatov, Kazakhstan; Omsk State Technical University, Omsk, Russian Federation
Authors with affiliations: Gul'kin, A.V., Institute of Atomic Energy, National Nuclear Center of the Republic of Kazakhstan, Kurchatov, Kazakhstan; Postnikov, D.V., Omsk State Technical University, Omsk, Russian Federation
Abstract: Radiation damage of a beryllium surface by a high-current electron beam at the GSEP-3 accelerator is considered. The degree of damage of beryllium samples has been determined. The temperature fields inside the sample and the distributions of thermal stresses have been calculated. The reasons for beryllium surface cracking formation have been found. The concentrations of point defects have been calculated. The possible reasons for an increase in microhardness of the irradiated beryllium surface layer are discussed. © 2008 MAIK Nauka.

Title: UV-Vis-NIR spectroelectrochemical and in situ conductance studies of unusual stability of n- and p-doped poly(dimethyldioctylquaterthiophene-alt- oxadiazole) under high cathodic and anodic polarizations
Affiliations: Department of Chemistry, Bar-Ilan University, Ramat-Gan, 52900, Israel; DRFMC, UMR 5819-SPrAM (CEA-CNRS-Univ. J. Fourier-Grenoble I), CEA Grenoble, 17 Rue des Martyrs, 38054 Grenoble Cedex 9, France; Department of Chemistry, Omsk State University, Russian Federation

J. Fourier-Grenoble I), CEA Grenoble, 17 Rue des Martyrs, 38054 Grenoble Cedex 9, France; Fisyuk, A., DRFMC, UMR 5819-SPrAM (CEA-CNRS-Univ. J. Fourier-Grenoble I), CEA Grenoble, 17 Rue des Martyrs, 38054 Grenoble Cedex 9, France, Department of Chemistry, Omsk State University, Russian Federation; Zaban, A., Department of Chemistry, Bar-Ilan University, Ramat-Gan, 52900, Israel; Aurbach, D., Department of Chemistry, Bar-Ilan University, Ramat-Gan, 52900, Israel; Pron, A., DRFMC, UMR 5819-SPrAM (CEA-CNRS-Univ. J. Fourier-Grenoble I), CEA Grenoble, 17 Rue des Martyrs, 38054 Grenoble Cedex 9, France
Abstract: Combined CV studies and UV-Vis-NIR spectroelectrochemical investigations revealed an unusual stability of the p- and n-doped PMOThOD in the wide potential window of 4 V. The n-doping process occurs in this polymer down to -2.7 V (vs. Ag/Ag+) in a non-destructive way with the characteristic development of the ω3 transition as a function of the doping level. In situ electronic transport studies revealed a high conductivity of the n-doped polymer which implies high mobility of the negatively charged carriers in the freshly doped PMOThOD film electrodes. An increase in the cathodic polarization, long-term cycling of the film electrodes, especially of higher thickness, results in a growing contribution of the negatively charged carriers trapping to the redox properties of the PMOThOD. The trapping of the charged carriers reduces gradually the electronic conductance of the PMOThOD film, but its effect on the redox-capacity of the film (in a typical scan rates range up to 50 mV s-1) is only minor. © the Owner Societies.

Authors: Kovalyov E.V., Elokhin V.I., Myshlyavtsev A.V.
Title: Stochastic simulation of physicochemical processes performance over supported metal nanoparticles
Affiliations: Boreskov Institute of Catalysis, SB, RAS, Novosibirsk, Russian Federation; Novosibirsk State University, Novosibirsk, Russian Federation; Omsk State Technical University, Omsk, Russian Federation
Authors with affiliations: Kovalyov, E.V., Boreskov Institute of Catalysis, SB, RAS, Novosibirsk, Russian Federation; Elokhin, V.I., Boreskov Institute of Catalysis, SB, RAS, Novosibirsk, Russian Federation, Novosibirsk State University, Novosibirsk, Russian Federation; Myshlyavtsev, A.V., Omsk State Technical University, Omsk, Russian Federation
Abstract: The statistical lattice model has been proposed which permits one to take into account the change in the shape and surface morphology of the nanoparticle under the influence of the reaction media. The influence of mono-molecular and dissociative adsorption on the particles equilibrium shape and surface morphology has been studied. It has been shown that by taking into account of attraction "adsorbate-metal" the reshaping of the initial hemispheric particle into cone-shaped one occurs induced by adsorption, similar to the experimentally observed reversible reshaping of active nanoparticles. The model reaction A+B2 has been studied taking into account the roughening of the active particle surface and the spillover phenomena of the adsorbed A ads species over the support surface. © 2007 Wiley Periodicals, Inc.

Authors: Myasnikov A.G., Rybalov A.N.
Title: Generic complexity of undecidable problems
Affiliations: Department of Mathematics and Statistics, McGill University, 805 Sherbrooke St, Montreal, QC, Canada; Omsk Branch of the Institute of Mathematics, Siberian Branch, Russian Academy of Science, Pevtsova, 13, Omsk 644099, Russian Federation
Authors with affiliations: Myasnikov, A.G., Department of Mathematics and Statistics, McGill University, 805 Sherbrooke St, Montreal, QC, Canada; Rybalov, A.N., Omsk Branch of the Institute of Mathematics, Siberian Branch, Russian Academy of Science, Pevtsova, 13, Omsk 644099, Russian Federation
Abstract: In this paper we study generic complexity of undecidable problems. It turns out that some classical undecidable problems are, in fact, strongly undecidable, i.e., they are undecidable on every strongly generic subset of inputs. For instance, the classical Halting Problem is strongly undecidable. Moreover, we prove an analog of the Rice theorem for strongly undecidable problems, which provides plenty of examples of strongly undecidable problems. Then we show that there are natural super-undecidable problems, i.e., problem which are undecidable on every generic (not only strongly generic) subset of inputs. In particular, there are finitely presented semigroups with super-undecidable word problem. To construct strongly- and super-undecidable problems we introduce a method of generic amplification (an analog of the amplification in complexity theory). Finally, we construct absolutely undecidable problems, which stay undecidable on every non-negligible set of inputs. Their construction rests on generic immune sets. © 2008. Association for Symbolic Logic.

Authors: Nikonov A.V., Nikonova G.V.
Title: A frequency converter with controllable characteristics
Affiliations: Omsk State Technical University, Russian Federation
Authors with affiliations: Nikonov, A.V., Omsk State Technical University, Russian Federation; Nikonova, G.V., Omsk State Technical University, Russian Federation
Abstract: The area of practical application of measuring instruments with frequency conversion, in which the economic costs of their operating cycle are related to the control of the accuracy of the converters, is considered. Methods of constructing stroboscopic frequency converters, adapted to a specific class of measurement problems with respect to the "accuracy" parameter, are described. © 2008 Springer Science+Business Media, Inc.

Authors: Zadorozhnii V.N.
Title: Asymptotic analysis of systems with intensive interrupts
Affiliations: Omsk State Technical University, Omsk, Russian Federation
Authors with affiliations: Zadorozhnii, V.N., Omsk State Technical University, Omsk, Russian Federation
Abstract: Consideration is given to queueing systems GI2|GI2|n with absolute priorities and afterservice of customers (n ≥ 1). For the case of high intensity of interrupts, we derive approximate computational formulae based on the asymptotic analysis of nonpriority customer service cycle and propose a method for accelerated simulation modeling of a system. © 2008 MAIK Nauka.
Index Keywords: Computation theory; Computer simulation; Mathematical models; Computational formulae; Customer service cycle; Queueing theory

Authors: Barabanov M.Yu., Vodop'yanov A.S., Nartov B.K., Chukanov S.N., Yamaleev R.M., Babkin V.A.
Title: A search for radially excited charmonium states in experiments with low-energy antiproton beams
Affiliations: Joint Institute of Nuclear Research; S. L. Sobolev Institute of Mathematics of the Omsk, Siberian Branch, Russian Academy of Sciences
Authors with affiliations: Barabanov, M.Yu., Joint Institute of Nuclear Research; Vodop'yanov, A.S., Joint Institute of Nuclear Research; Nartov, B.K., S. L. Sobolev Institute of Mathematics of the Omsk, Siberian Branch, Russian Academy of Sciences; Chukanov, S.N., S. L. Sobolev Institute of Mathematics of the Omsk, Siberian Branch, Russian Academy of Sciences; Yamaleev, R.M., Joint Institute of Nuclear Research; Babkin, V.A., Joint Institute of Nuclear Research
Abstract: A spectrum of radially excited charmonium states is calculated for the model of relativistic spherically symmetric top for decay products. Within the integral formalism, the widths of these states are calculated for hadron resonance decay. Mass and width values obtained are in good agreement with the results of experiments. Six new radially excited charmonium states are predicted above the DD̄-pair generation threshold equal to 3.73 GeV/s; three of them are experimentally confirmed. The possibility of application of antiproton beams with momentum from 1 to 15 GeV/s for charmonium spectroscopy is discussed, especially for masses exceeding the threshold of DD̄-pair generation. The advantage of antiproton beams is that intensive generation of particle-antiparticle pairs is observed during antiproton-proton annihilation. This fact allows spectroscopic investigations to be performed with sufficient statistics and good accuracy. Therefore, masses and widths of scalar and vector charmonium states can be measured with high accuracy. © 2007 Springer Science+Business Media, Inc.

Abstract: The article contains the information about numerically-analytical solution of model of SC-quartz resonator. Affiliations: Institute of Hydrocarbon Processing, Siberian Branch, Russian Academy of Sciences, Neftezavodskaya ul. 54, Omsk 644040, Russian Federation
Authors with affiliations: Lavrenov, A.V., Institute of Hydrocarbon Processing, Siberian Branch, Russian Academy of Sciences, Neftezavodskaya ul. 54, Omsk 644040, Russian Federation; Basova, I.A., Institute of Hydrocarbon Processing, Siberian Branch, Russian Academy of Sciences, Neftezavodskaya ul. 54, Omsk 644040, Russian Federation; Kazakov, M.O., Institute of Hydrocarbon Processing, Siberian Branch, Russian Academy of Sciences, Neftezavodskaya ul. 54, Omsk 644040, Russian Federation; Finevich, V.P., Institute of Hydrocarbon Processing, Siberian Branch, Russian Academy of Sciences, Neftezavodskaya ul. 54, Omsk 644040, Russian Federation; Belskaya, O.B., Institute of Hydrocarbon Processing, Siberian Branch, Russian Academy of Sciences, Neftezavodskaya ul. 54, Omsk 644040, Russian Federation; Buluchevskii, E.A., Institute of Hydrocarbon Processing, Siberian Branch, Russian Academy of Sciences, Neftezavodskaya ul. 54, Omsk 644040, Russian Federation; Duplyakin, V.K., Institute of Hydrocarbon Processing, Siberian Branch, Russian Academy of Sciences, Neftezavodskaya ul. 54, Omsk 644040, Russian Federation
Abstract: Experimental evidence on the production, structure, and physiochemical properties of aluminum, zirconium, and titanium oxides modified with halides, sulfates, and boron and tungsten oxides. Information on the application of anion-modified metal oxides as catalysts in the production of ecologically pure components of motor fuels, with decreased contents of aromatic hydrocarbons and sulfur compounds. Therewith, along with traditional hydrocarbon oligomerization, isomerization, alkylation reactions, actual arene hydroisomerization processes and production of diesel fuels from vegetable materials are considered. © 2007 Pleiades Publishing, Ltd.

Authors: Kiryanov D.I., Smolikov M.D., Pashkov V.V., Proskura A.G., Zatolokina E.V., Udras I.E., Belyi A.S.
Title: Modern state of the catalytic reforming of petrol fractions. Experience of manufacture and industrial exploitation of reforming catalysts of the PR series
Affiliations: Institute of Hydrocarbon Processing, Siberian Branch, Russian Academy of Sciences, Neftezavodskaya ul. 54, Omsk 644040, Russian Federation
Authors with affiliations: Kiryanov, D.I., Institute of Hydrocarbon Processing, Siberian Branch, Russian Academy of Sciences, Neftezavodskaya ul. 54, Omsk 644040, Russian Federation; Smolikov, M.D., Institute of Hydrocarbon Processing, Siberian Branch, Russian Academy of Sciences, Neftezavodskaya ul. 54, Omsk 644040, Russian Federation; Pashkov, V.V., Institute of Hydrocarbon Processing, Siberian Branch, Russian Academy of Sciences, Neftezavodskaya ul. 54, Omsk 644040, Russian Federation; Proskura, A.G., Institute of Hydrocarbon Processing, Siberian Branch, Russian Academy of Sciences, Neftezavodskaya ul. 54, Omsk 644040, Russian Federation; Zatolokina, E.V., Institute of Hydrocarbon Processing, Siberian Branch, Russian Academy of Sciences, Neftezavodskaya ul. 54, Omsk 644040, Russian Federation; Udras, I.E., Institute of Hydrocarbon Processing, Siberian Branch, Russian Academy of Sciences, Neftezavodskaya ul. 54, Omsk 644040, Russian Federation; Belyi, A.S., Institute of Hydrocarbon Processing, Siberian Branch, Russian Academy of Sciences, Neftezavodskaya ul. 54, Omsk 644040, Russian Federation
Abstract: Analysis of the modern state of catalytic reforming is performed. Comparative assessment of the efficiency of various technologies of the process is given and their distribution in Russia and abroad is shown. Experience of the modernization of reforming installations with periodic catalyst regeneration is summarized. The state of manufacture of reforming catalysts in our country and accumulated experience of the development of catalysts of the PR series are presented. Results of industrial exploitation of new domestic reforming catalysts are shown. On this basis comparative assessment of Russian and imported catalysts is given. © 2007 Pleiades Publishing, Ltd.

Authors: Belyi A.S., Smolikov M.D., Kir'Yanov D.I., Udras I.E.
Title: Modern views on the state of platinum in supported catalysts for production of motor fuels
Affiliations: Institute of Hydrocarbon Processing, Siberian Branch, Russian Academy of Sciences, Neftezavodskaya ul. 54, Omsk 644040, Russian Federation
Authors with affiliations: Belyi, A.S., Institute of Hydrocarbon Processing, Siberian Branch, Russian Academy of Sciences, Neftezavodskaya ul. 54, Omsk 644040, Russian Federation; Smolikov, M.D., Institute of Hydrocarbon Processing, Siberian Branch, Russian Academy of Sciences, Neftezavodskaya ul. 54, Omsk 644040, Russian Federation; Kir'Yanov, D.I., Institute of Hydrocarbon Processing, Siberian Branch, Russian Academy of Sciences, Neftezavodskaya ul. 54, Omsk 644040, Russian Federation; Udras, I.E., Institute of Hydrocarbon Processing, Siberian Branch, Russian Academy of Sciences, Neftezavodskaya ul. 54, Omsk 644040, Russian Federation
Abstract: Modern models of the state of disperse platinum in low-percentage industrial catalysts for production of motor fuels (reforming catalysts) are considered. The state of surface platinum atoms was assessed by means of an original approach based on division of surface centers on metallic (Pt 0) and ionic platinum (Ptσ). Physical and chemical properties of specific Pt0 and Ptσ centers and their role in basic catalytic reforming reactions are discussed. © 2007 Pleiades Publishing, Ltd.

Authors: Bel'skaya O.B., Duplyakin V.K.
Title: Molecular mechanism of formation of supported platinum catalysts of the Pt/Al2O3 family
Affiliations: Institute of Hydrocarbon Processing, Siberian Branch, Russian Academy of Sciences, Neftezavodskaya ul. 54, Omsk 644040, Russian Federation
Authors with affiliations: Bel'skaya, O.B., Institute of Hydrocarbon Processing, Siberian Branch, Russian Academy of Sciences, Neftezavodskaya ul. 54, Omsk 644040, Russian Federation; Duplyakin, V.K., Institute of Hydrocarbon Processing, Siberian Branch, Russian Academy of Sciences, Neftezavodskaya ul. 54, Omsk 644040, Russian Federation
Abstract: Certain stages of the classical procedure for preparing aluminum-platinum catalysts, whose understanding is important from both the basic and practical viewpoints, are considered on the molecular level. Properties of both participants (active component precursor solution and oxide surface) are shown to be inhomogeneous, which can affect interaction of the components at the fixing stage. Existing views (and their evolution) on the mechanism of adsorption of platinum complexes from aqueous solutions on aluminum oxide surface are discussed. The role of chemical processes on the stage of fixing precursor on the electronic and structural properties of the supported metal is demonstrates. Strong metal-support interaction is shown to endow platinum with specific adsorption and catalytic properties in hydrocarbon transformation reactions. © 2007 Pleiades Publishing, Ltd.

Authors: Kostyukov V.N., Naumenko A.P., Starikov V.A., Sinitsyn A.A., Volkov A.M., Rubanenko A.S., Rykin A.V., Kuznetsov O.V.
Title: New high-efficiency low-waste technology at the Vyksa Metallurgical Plant for operating metallurgical equipment with the use of Kompaks® monitoring systems
Affiliations: Dinamika Center, Vyksa Metallurgical Plant, VMZ-Servis
Authors with affiliations: Kostyukov, V.N., Dinamika Center, Vyksa Metallurgical Plant, VMZ-Servis; Naumenko, A.P., Dinamika Center, Vyksa Metallurgical Plant, VMZ-Servis; Starikov, V.A., Dinamika Center, Vyksa Metallurgical Plant, VMZ-Servis; Sinitsyn, A.A., Dinamika Center, Vyksa Metallurgical Plant, VMZ-Servis; Volkov, A.M., Dinamika Center, Vyksa Metallurgical Plant, VMZ-Servis; Rubanenko, A.S., Dinamika Center, Vyksa Metallurgical Plant, VMZ-Servis; Rykin, A.V., Dinamika Center, Vyksa Metallurgical Plant, VMZ-Servis; Kuznetsov, O.V., Dinamika Center, Vyksa Metallurgical Plant, VMZ-Servis
Abstract: Introduction of the BER™ KOMPAKS® automated system at the Vyksa Metallurgical Plant to safely and efficiently manage the operation of the plant's equipment has allowed the facility to begin operating that equipment based on real-time evaluations of its actual physical condition. Introduction of the new system has also allowed better coordination of repair-scheduling with ongoing production operations, significantly improved the reliability and readiness of the equipment for operation at 100% capacity, completely eliminated the human factor from the process of monitoring the condition of equipment, and made it possible to check the quality and timeliness of equipment maintenance and repair work so as to ensure safe, efficient operation of the entire production complex. © 2007 Springer Science+Business Media, Inc.
Index Keywords: Equipment maintenance; Repair-scheduling; Metallurgy; Real time systems; Reliability theory; Scheduling; Industrial management
References: Response to the IV Plenum of the Russian GMPR; Kostyukov, V.N., (2002) Monitoring the Safety of Production Facilities, , Mashinostroenie Moscow; Kostyukov, V.N., Boichenko, S.N., Kostyukov, A.V., (1999) Automated Systems for Managing the Safe and Efficient Operation of Equipment in the Petroleum-Refining and Petrochemical Industries (BER™ KOMPAKS® Automated Control System), , Mashinostroenie Moscow; (2005) Monitoring Systems for Hazardous Production Facilities: General Technical Requirements, , Rostekhekspertiza Association Standard SA 03-002-04 Series 03/Col. Authors: Yusha V.L., Novikov D.G., Busarov S.S., Mel'nikov S.G.
Title: Effect of microribbing on the instantaneous convective heat transfer coefficient in the working chamber of an unlubricated piston compressor
Affiliations: Omsk State Technical University, Russian Federation; UKZ OAO, Ekaterinburg, Russian Federation
Authors with affiliations: Yusha, V.L., Omsk State Technical University, Russian Federation; Novikov, D.G., Omsk State Technical University, Russian Federation; Busarov, S.S., Omsk State Technical University, Russian Federation; Mel'nikov, S.G., UKZ OAO, Ekaterinburg, Russian Federation
Abstract: Experimental comparative evaluation is performed for elementary heat flows and instantaneous convective heat transfer coefficients in the working chamber of a piston compressor with smooth and microribbed surfaces. An experimental procedure is developed, and an experimental test unit is manufactured. The experimental data obtained show that instantaneous convective heat transfer coefficients for the microribbed and smooth surfaces for the working chamber of an unlubricated piston compressor are approximately the same, but the elementary heat flow is directly proportional to the ribbing factor of the heat exchange surface and the temperature difference of the working gas and a given surface. © 2007 Springer Science+Business Media, Inc.
References: Bolshtyanskii, A.P., Belyi, V.D., Doroshevich S.E.́, (2002) Compressors with Gas Static Piston Centering, , OmGTU Omsk; Plastinin, P.I., (2006) Piston Compressors, Vol. 1. Authors: Bur'yan Yu.A., Kalekin V.S., Silkov M.V.
Title: A vibrational isolation system for a piston machine
Affiliations: Omsk State Technical University, Russian Federation
Authors with affiliations: Bur'yan, Yu.A., Omsk State Technical University, Russian Federation; Kalekin, V.S., Omsk State Technical University, Russian Federation; Silkov, M.V., Omsk State Technical University, Russian Federation
Abstract: A mathematical model has been developed for this oscillatory system: a piston compressor with pneumatic supports (pneumatic springs). The frequency-response characteristics of the elastic support have been derived, and also graphs for the vibrational loading on the base of the machine. A method is given for attaching additional masses to the body to bring the center of mass of the plant to the intersection of the symmetry axes of the body. © 2007 Springer Science+Business Media, Inc.

Authors: Kirovskaya I.A., Novgorodtseva L.V., Vasina M.V.
Title: The adsorption of gases on the surface of solid solutions and binary compounds of the GaSb-ZnTe system
Source title: Russian Journal of Physical Chemistry A
Affiliations: Omsk State Technical University, Omsk, Russian Federation
Authors with affiliations: Kirovskaya, I.A., Omsk State Technical University, Omsk, Russian Federation; Novgorodtseva, L.V., Omsk State Technical University, Omsk, Russian Federation; Vasina, M.V., Omsk State Technical University, Omsk, Russian Federation
Abstract: The adsorption of ammonia, carbon monoxide, and oxygen on solid solution and binary compound films of the GaSb-ZnTe system was studied. The mechanism of adsorption and rules governing adsorption processes depending on adsorption conditions and system composition were determined by analyzing adsorption isobars, equilibrium and kinetic isotherms, the thermodynamic and kinetic characteristics of adsorption, and the electronic nature of adsorbate molecules. The behavior of (GaSb)x(ZnTe)1-x solid solutions was similar to that of binary compounds (GaSb and ZnTe) and had special features characteristic of multicomponent systems. The latter manifested themselves by the presence of extrema in adsorption characteristic-composition diagrams. The use of such diagrams allowed us to identify system components most active with respect to NH3, CO, and O2 and use them to create high-sensitivity and selectivity sensors. © 2007 Pleiades Publishing, Ltd.
Index Keywords: Adsorption; Ammonia; Carbon monoxide; Chemical sensors; Gallium compounds; Oxygen; Zinc compounds; Compound films; GaSb-ZnTe system; Multicomponent systems; Metallic films

Ignatiev, N.N., Research Laboratory of Aerospace Technology (NILAKT ROSTO), Kaluga, Russian Federation; Yamnikov, V.S., Research Laboratory of Aerospace Technology (NILAKT ROSTO), Kaluga, Russian Federation
Abstract: The complex of scientific pay load installed onboard the research and educational Universitetskii-Tatyana microsatellite of Moscow State University is described. The complex is designed to study charged particles in the near-earth space and ultraviolet emissions of the atmosphere. Data of the measurements of charged particle fluxes in the microsatellite orbit are presented, spectra are calculated, and the dynamics of penetration boundaries for protons of solar cosmic rays (SCR) during geomagnetic disturbances in 2005 is investigated. Intensities of the ultraviolet emission are measured in the entire range of variation of the atmospheric irradiation, as well as intensities of auroras in the polar regions of the Northern and Southern hemispheres. The experimental data on flashes of ultraviolet radiation (transient light phenomena in the upper atmosphere) are considered, and some examples of oscillograms of their temporal development and their distribution over geographical coordinates are presented. © 2007 Pleiades Publishing, Ltd.

Authors: Myshlyavtsev A.V., Myshlyavtseva M.D.
Title: Lateral interactions in the adsorption layer and critical phenomena in the Langmuir-Hinshelwood reaction
Affiliations: Omsk State Technical University, Omsk, 644050, Russian Federation; Institute of Hydrocarbon Processing, Siberian Branch, Russian Academy of Sciences, Omsk, 644040, Russian Federation
Authors with affiliations: Myshlyavtsev, A.V., Omsk State Technical University, Omsk, 644050, Russian Federation, Institute of Hydrocarbon Processing, Siberian Branch, Russian Academy of Sciences, Omsk, 644040, Russian Federation; Myshlyavtseva, M.D., Omsk State Technical University, Omsk, 644050, Russian Federation
Abstract: The report deals with the effect of the lateral interactions between adsorbed species on the steady state multiplicity area and on the possible rate self-oscillations for a reaction proceeding via the Langmuir-Hinshelwood mechanism. The adsorption layer is modeled as a lattice gas on a square lattice. For irreversible adsorption, the maximum possible number of interior steady states is at least ten. Reaction rate self-oscillations resulting from Andronov-Hopf bifurcation take place for some lateral interaction energy sets. These self-oscillations are associated with a checkerboard-type ordered dense phase existing owing to the attraction between different adsorbed species. © 2007 MAIK "Nauka/Interperiodica".

Authors: Rybalov A.
Title: On the strongly generic undecidability of the Halting Problem
Affiliations: Department of Mathematical Logic, Omsk State University, prospekt Mira 55a, Omsk, 644077, Russian Federation
Authors with affiliations: Rybalov, A., Department of Mathematical Logic, Omsk State University, prospekt Mira 55a, Omsk, 644077, Russian Federation
Abstract: It has been shown in [J.D. Hamkins, A. Miasnikov, The halting problem is decidable on a set of asymptotic probability one, Notre Dame J. Formal Logic 47(4) (2006) 515-524] that the classical Halting Problem for Turing machines with one-way tape is decidable on a "large" set of Turing machines (a so-called generic set). However, here we prove that the Halting Problem remains undecidable when restricted to an arbitrary "very large" set of Turing machines (a so-called strongly generic set). Our proof is independent of a Turing machine model. © 2007 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.
Author Keywords: Generic complexity; Halting Problem
Index Keywords: Asymptotic analysis; Mathematical models; Probability; Problem solving; Set theory; Turing machines; Asymptotic probability; Generic complexity; Halting Problems; Computer science

Authors: Myshlyavtsev A.V., Myshlyavtseva M.D.
Title: Modeling of adsorption and phase diagrams for stepped surfaces: Transfer matrix approach
Affiliations: Omsk State Technical University, Omsk, Russian Federation; Institute of Hydrocarbons Processing SB RAS, Omsk, Russian Federation
Authors with affiliations: Myshlyavtsev, A.V., Omsk State Technical University, Omsk, Russian Federation, Institute of Hydrocarbons Processing SB RAS, Omsk, Russian Federation; Myshlyavtseva, M.D., Omsk State Technical University, Omsk, Russian Federation
Abstract: The simplest model of stepped surface has been constructed and scrutinized with different values of model parameters. The transfer matrix method was shown to be a very effective approach. Phase diagrams and local isotherms have been obtained. It was shown that the local coverage can be the non-monotonous function of the total coverage or the chemical potential. © 2007 Elsevier B.V. All rights reserved.

Authors: Kirovskaya I.A., Zemtsov A.E.
Title: Adsorption properties of GaAs-CdS system
Source title: Russian Journal of Physical Chemistry A
Affiliations: Omsk State University, pr. Mira 55, Omsk, 644077, Russian Federation
Authors with affiliations: Kirovskaya, I.A., Omsk State University, pr. Mira 55, Omsk, 644077, Russian Federation; Zemtsov, A.E., Omsk State University, pr. Mira 55, Omsk, 644077, Russian Federation
Abstract: The adsorption properties of GaAs-CdS solid solutions and the constituent binary systems with respect to CO and NH3 were studies by piezoquartz microweighing, temperature-programmed desorption, and IR spectroscopy. On the basis of an analysis of the measured α p = f(T), α T = f(p), and α T = f(t) dependences, the thermodynamic and kinetic characteristics of adsorption, earlier obtained acid-base and other physicochemical characteristics of adsorbents, and the electronic properties of the adsorbate molecules, the mechanism and regularities of the adsorption processes at various conditions and compositions of the system were established. A comparison of the adsorption properties of the GaAs and CdS individual binary compounds with their (GaAs)x(CdS) 1-x solutions, multicomponent systems, revealed common and distinctive features. Optimal compositions of adsorbents suitable for manufacturing primary transducers in sensors for medical and environmental purposes were determined. © Nauka/Interperiodica 2007.
