Authors: Rybalov A.N.
Title: Generic complexity of presburger arithmetic
Source title: Lecture Notes in Computer Science (including subseries Lecture Notes in Artificial Intelligence and Lecture Notes in Bioinformatics)
Affiliations: Omsk Branch, Institute of Mathematics, RAS, Pevtsova, 13, Omsk 644099, Russian Federation
Authors with affiliations: Rybalov, A.N., Omsk Branch, Institute of Mathematics, RAS, Pevtsova, 13, Omsk 644099, Russian Federation
Abstract: Fischer and Rabin proved in [4] that Presburger Arithmetic has at least double exponential worse-case complexity. In [6] a theory of generic-case complexity was developed, where algorithmic problems are studied on "most" inputs instead of all set of inputs. An interesting question rises about existing of more efficient (say, polynomial) generic algorithm deciding Presburger Arithmetic on some "large" set of closed formulas. We prove, however, that there is no even exponential generic algorithm working correctly on arbitrary "very large" sets of inputs (so-called strongly generic sets). © Springer-Verlag Berlin Heidelberg 2007.
Index Keywords: Algorithms; Computability and decidability; Digital arithmetic; Problem solving; Theorem proving; Algorithmic problems; Generic algorithms; Generic complexity; Presburger arithmetics; Computational complexity

Title: International educational project synergy
Source title: Annals of DAAAM and Proceedings of the International DAAAM Symposium
Authors with affiliations: Mogilnikov, P.; Bagimov, I.; Klevakin, V.; Mikhailov, M.; Roslyakov, P.; Shalai, V.; Stazhkov, S.; Kramar, V.; Khomchenko, V.; Fuersinn, G.; Eliseev, A.
Abstract: Lab equipment in the field of Mechatronics can be very expensive, such all universities are not able to buy complete equipment the way how to solve this problem is to make international network and buy one part of equipment in such way that all network partners have complete equipment. Each partner in network gives own equipment to use to all partners using internet technology and possibilities. This project is one pilot international project which is following this strategy and philosophy.

Authors with affiliations: Kirovskaya, I.A., Omsk State University, pr. Mira 55, Omsk, 644077, Russian Federation; Zemtsov, A.E., Omsk State University, pr. Mira 55, Omsk, 644077, Russian Federation
Abstract: Chemical composition and acid-base properties of the surfaces of GaAs-CdS solid solutions and the constituent binary compounds exposed to air, vacuum, CO, and NH3 were analyzed using mass spectrometry, IR spectrometry, isoelectric-point pH (pHiso) analysis, and mechanochemical methods. Powders and films were prepared from the solid solutions by isothermal diffusion and discrete vacuum evaporation, respectively. XRD and Raman analysis revealed that a solid solution has a sphalerite or wurtzite structure, depending on its composition. The initial surface of all the systems studied exhibited acidic properties: the pH value ranged from 4.9 to 6.45. The surfaces contained Lewis (electron accepting) and Brönsted (adsorbed H2O and CO 2 molecules, OH- groups) sites. The acidity of the surface increased upon treatment with CO and decreased upon treatment with NH 3. For all types of treatment, the concentration dependence of the acid-base properties of the surface exhibited an extremum. The strongest acidic sites were revealed on the surface of the (GaAs)0.95 (CdS) 0.05 solid solution. The adsorption activity of this solution, a promising material for manufacturing gas sensors, was evaluated. © Nauka/Interperiodica 2007.
Index Keywords: Cadmium sulfide; Composition; pH effects; Raman spectroscopy; Semiconducting gallium arsenide; X ray diffraction analysis; Acid-base properties; Concentration dependence; Mechanochemical methods; Wurtzite structure; Solid solutions

Authors: Kosykh A.V., Khomenko I.V.
Title: Dual-mode resonators for DTCXO and OCXO
Source title: Multiconference on Electronics and Photonics, MEP 2006
Affiliations: Omsk State Technical University, Omsk, Russian Federation
Authors with affiliations: Kosykh, A.V., Omsk State Technical University, Omsk, Russian Federation; Khomenko, I.V., Omsk State Technical University, Omsk, Russian Federation
Abstract: This article contains the information about the investigation of activity dips of planoconvex resonators for dual-mode crystal oscillators. It is proved, that the reason is acoustic interaction between the inharmonic components of C-mode with a high index and the B-mode. Conditions of existence of interfering vibration are determined. Using these data it is possible to define the geometrical sizes of the resonator which is not having activity dip of B-mode owing to influence inharmonic components of C-mode. ©2006 IEEE.
Author Keywords: Activity dip; Dual-mode excitation; Dynamic resistances; Inharmonic components of C-mode

Title: Methods of imitational computer modeling of decameter communication channels
Affiliations: Omsk State Technical University, Russian Federation

Abstract: Imitational models of one-dimensional discrete communication channels with and without edge distortions of message fragments and of one-dimensional discrete-continuous, two-dimensional linear and nonlinear, and three-dimensional continuous linear (space and time) communication channels are suggested that allow comparative tests of decameter communication systems to be performed on paths under conditions of multibeam propagation in the presence of every possible additive noise component. © 2006 Springer Science+Business Media, Inc.

Authors: Fisyuk A.S., Mukanov A.Yu.
Title: Synthesis of 3-isothiocyanatopropion-and-butyraldehyde diethyl acetals and their reactions with N-nucleophiles
Affiliations: Omsk State University, pr. Mira 55A, Omsk, 644077, Russian Federation
Authors with affiliations: Fisyuk, A.S., Omsk State University, pr. Mira 55A, Omsk, 644077, Russian Federation; Mukanov, A.Yu., Omsk State University, pr. Mira 55A, Omsk, 644077, Russian Federation
Abstract: A one-pot procedure was developed for the synthesis of 3- isothiocyanatopropionaldehyde and 3-isothiocyanatobutyraldehyde diethyl acetals from the corresponding α,β-unsaturated aldehydes. Reactions of 1,1-diethoxy-3-isothiocyanatobutane with aliphatic amines and hydrazines gave, respectively, substituted thioureas and thiosemicarbazides which underwent acid-catalyzed cyclization to form 6-ethoxytetrahydropyrimidine-2(1H)-thiones, 9,10-dimethoxy-2-methyl-1,2,3,6,7,11b-hexahydro-4H-pyrimido[6,1-a] isoquinoline-4-thiones, and 2-methyl-2,3,6,7,12,12b-hexahydropyrimido[1′, 6′:1,2]pyrido[3,4-b]indole-4(1H)-thione. © 2006 Nauka/Interperiodica.

Authors: Cherezov E.A., Kovalev E.V., Elokhin V.I., Myshlyavtsev A.V.
Title: Statistical lattice model for the bimolecular reaction on the dynamically changing surface of a body-centered metal crystal
Affiliations: Tuvinian Institute for the Exploration of Natural Resources Development, Siberian Division, Russian Academy of Sciences, Kyzyl, 667007, Russian Federation; Boreskov Institute of Catalysis, Siberian Division, Russian Academy of Sciences, Novosibirsk, 630090, Russian Federation; Institute of Hydrocarbons Processing, Siberian Division, Russian Academy of Sciences, Omsk, 644040, Russian Federation; Omsk State Technical University, Omsk, 644050, Russian Federation
Authors with affiliations: Cherezov, E.A., Tuvinian Institute for the Exploration of Natural Resources Development, Siberian Division, Russian Academy of Sciences, Kyzyl, 667007, Russian Federation, Boreskov Institute of Catalysis, Siberian Division, Russian Academy of Sciences, Novosibirsk, 630090, Russian Federation; Kovalev, E.V., Boreskov Institute of Catalysis, Siberian Division, Russian Academy of Sciences, Novosibirsk, 630090, Russian Federation; Elokhin, V.I., Boreskov Institute of Catalysis, Siberian Division, Russian Academy of Sciences, Novosibirsk, 630090, Russian Federation; Myshlyavtsev, A.V., Institute of Hydrocarbons Processing, Siberian Division, Russian Academy of Sciences, Omsk, 644040, Russian Federation, Omsk State Technical University, Omsk, 644050, Russian Federation
Abstract: A statistical lattice model has been constructed for the surface of a body-centered cubic (bcc) crystal whose morphology varies under the action of external factors (temperature and adsorbate coverage). Monomolecular and dissociative bimolecular adsorption on the bcc crystal surface has been investigated. In this model, adsorption smoothens the originally rough surface owing to adsorbate molecules stabilizing their flat adsorption areas, as distinct from adsorption on the primitive cubic lattice. Our model differs from the models with invariable surface morphology in that the number of its accessible adsorption sites is variable and depends on external conditions. The kinetics of a catalytic reaction proceeding by the Langmuir-Hinshelwood mechanism have been studied for the (100) face of a bcc crystal whose morphology varies under the action of the reaction medium. © MAIK "Nauka/Interperiodica", 2006.

Authors: Yusha V.L., Yanvarev I.A., Krinitskii V.I.
Title: Reduction of weight-size parameters for heat-exchange equipment in mobile compressor plants
Affiliations: Omsk State Technical University, Russian Federation; Ural'skii Kompressornyi Zavod OAO, Ekaterinburg, Russian Federation
Authors with affiliations: Yusha, V.L., Omsk State Technical University, Russian Federation; Yanvarev, I.A., Omsk State Technical University, Russian Federation; Krinitskii, V.I., Ural'skii Kompressornyi Zavod OAO, Ekaterinburg, Russian Federation
Abstract: It is demonstrated that more attention should be focused on problems of the in-stage cooling of the compressed gas, since intensification of this process will result in a lower total heat load on the cooling system, and reduced weight and clearance dimensions of the heat-exchange equipment. The cooling rate of the compressed gas is examined for variation in the relative total heat load, relative variation in the temperature at the start of heating, and variation in the relative amount of heat dissipated in the compression process. Relationships are presented for the influence exerted by the effective pressure and cooling rate of the compressed gas on the weight and size parameters of the heat-exchange vessels. ©2006 Springer Science+Business Media, Inc.

Title: On the stability of some integer programming algorithms
Affiliations: Omsk Branch, Sobolev Institute of Mathematics, Russian Academy of Sciences, 13, Pevtsov St., Omsk 644099, Russian Federation

Abstract: In the present paper we develop our approach for studying the stability of integer programming problems. We prove that the L-class enumeration method is stable on integer linear programming problems in the case of bounded relaxation sets [9]. The stability of some cutting plane algorithms is discussed. © 2005 Elsevier B.V. All rights reserved.

Abstract: A discrete production planning problem with interval input data is considered. An approach for solving this problem based on using its relaxation set is suggested. Authors: Yuferova L.V., Ivantsova T.M., Chizhik M.A., Smirnova N.A.
Title: Investigating the dimensional stability of elastic fabrics
Source title: Izvestiya Vysshikh Uchebnykh Zavedenii, Seriya Teknologiya Tekstil'noi Promyshlennosti
Affiliations: KGTU, Kostroma, Russian Federation
Authors with affiliations: Yuferova, L.V., KGTU, Kostroma, Russian Federation; Ivantsova, T.M., KGTU, Kostroma, Russian Federation; Chizhik, M.A., KGTU, Kostroma, Russian Federation; Smirnova, N.A., KGTU, Kostroma, Russian Federation
Abstract: Tests have revealed that the insertion of polyurethane yarns in woollen outerwear fabrics improves their dimensional stability because of the increase in their ability to withstand compression and extension stresses during laundering operations. The dimensional stability depends both on the number of yarns in the structure of the fabric and on the structure of yarns with a polyurethane core. The orientation of the polyurethane yarns has a pronounced effect on the dimensional property anisotropy of elastic fabrics.

Abstract: In the given paper the effective simulation technique of quartz oscillators the in time domain with use of general purpose EDA software (PSPICE, MicroCAP, etc) is offered. The main idea is reception of averaged on the first harmonic parameters of nonlinear active part of self-oscillating circuit with the help of widespread programs of circuit simulation, with the subsequent analysis of complete self-oscillatory circuit by analytical methods. Detailed procedures both analysis of single and dual-mode crystal oscillators with use of MicroCAP 6 program are given. © 2005 IEEE.

Authors: Bubnov A.V.
Title: Improving drive dynamics with phase synchronization
Affiliations: Omsk State Technical University, Russian Federation
Authors with affiliations: Bubnov, A.V., Omsk State Technical University, Russian Federation
Abstract: Improvement of drive dynamics with phase synchronization is considered. An effective method of drive regulation is proposed, with anticipatory unblocking of the two-channel logical comparison unit in proportional operation relative to the signal of an auxiliary frequency discriminator. In the operational algorithm developed for the frequency discriminator, coincidences of pulses in two pulse sequences are monitored. As a result, the transient process is abbreviated, and overcorrection in the drive with phase synchronization may be minimized. ©2006 by Allerton Press, Inc.
Index Keywords: Drive regulation; Phase synchronization; Transient processes; Algorithms; Discriminators; Laser pulses; Natural frequencies; Optimization; Synchronization; Electric drives

Authors: Bubnov A.V.
Title: The mathematical model of a logic comparator for an electric drive with phase synchronization
Affiliations: Omskij Gosudarstvennyj Tekhnicheskij Univ., Omsk, Russian Federation
Authors with affiliations: Bubnov, A.V., Omskij Gosudarstvennyj Tekhnicheskij Univ., Omsk, Russian Federation
Abstract: The operating conditions of a digital logic comparator used in an electric drive with phase synchronization are analysed. A generalized functional diagram of a pulsed frequency-phase discriminator, which constitutes the core of the logical comparator, is presented. A full mathematical model of the logic comparator is developed for studying the dynamic processes in the electric drive, which lakes into account all nonlinear features of the pulsed frequency-phase discriminator.

Authors: Fisyuk A.S., Demadrille R., Querner C., Zagorska M., Bleuse J., Pron A.
Title: Mixed alkylthiophene-based heterocyclic polymers containing oxadiazole units via electrochemical polymerisation: Spectroscopic, electrochemical and spectroelectrochemical properties
Affiliations: Laboratoire de Physique des Métaux Synthétiques, DRFMC (CEA-CNRS-Université J. Fourier Grenoble I UMR 5819 SPrAM), CEA Grenoble, 17 Rue des Martyrs, 38054 Grenoble Cedex 9, France; Faculty of Chemistry, Warsaw University of Technology, Noakowskiego 3, 00 664 Warszawa, Poland; Laboratoire Nanophysique des Semiconducteurs, DRFMC, CEA Grenoble, 17 Rue des Martyrs, 38054 Grenoble Cedex 9, France; Department of Chemistry, Omsk State University, Pr. Mira 55a, 644077 Omsk, Russian Federation; Demadrille, R., Laboratoire de Physique des Métaux Synthétiques, DRFMC (CEA-CNRS-Université J. Fourier Grenoble I UMR 5819 SPrAM), CEA Grenoble, 17 Rue des Martyrs, 38054 Grenoble Cedex 9, France; Querner, C., Laboratoire de Physique des Métaux Synthétiques, DRFMC (CEA-CNRS-Université J. Fourier Grenoble I UMR 5819 SPrAM), CEA Grenoble, 17 Rue des Martyrs, 38054 Grenoble Cedex 9, France; Zagorska, M., Faculty of Chemistry, Warsaw University of Technology, Noakowskiego 3, 00 664 Warszawa, Poland; Bleuse, J., Laboratoire Nanophysique des Semiconducteurs, DRFMC, CEA Grenoble, 17 Rue des Martyrs, 38054 Grenoble Cedex 9, France; Pron, A., Laboratoire de Physique des Métaux Synthétiques, DRFMC (CEA-CNRS-Université J. Fourier Grenoble I UMR 5819 SPrAM), CEA Grenoble, 17 Rue des Martyrs, 38054 Grenoble Cedex 9, France
Abstract: Symmetric alkylthiophene-based mixed heterocyclic trimer and pentamer. containing central oxadiazole units, have been prepared. Because of the electron-withdrawing properties of oxadiazole, the trimer cannot be electropolymerised and undergoes an oxidative-type destruction at high potentials. In contrast, the pentamer readily polymerises, giving a short chain polymer. Both trimer and pentamer exhibit strong photoluminescence with a maximum at 399 nm (13% quantum yield) and 467 nm (46% quantum yield), respectively. The polymer resulting from the electropolymerisation of the pentamer is also luminescent with the maximum of the excitation band at 528 nm (33% quantum yield). The polymer can be oxidatively doped as demonstrated by cyclic voltammetry, showing a clear anodic peak at 0.62 V versus Ag/Ag + and its cathodic counterpart at 0.56 V, associated with the undoping process. The significantly higher potential of the oxidative doping of the prepared mixed heterocyclic polymer, as compared to the poly(alkylthiophene) homopolymer of similar molecular weight, is caused by the presence of the oxadiazole unit, which lowers the electron density in the π-electron system of the oligothiophene subunit and makes its oxidation more difficult. The spectroelectrochemical investigation of the polymer is consistent with its voltammetric behaviour, exhibiting doping-induced bleaching of the band originating from the π-π* transition and simultaneous growth of the bipolaron bands. The observed clear and reversible spectroelectrochemical behaviour makes the developed polymer a promising candidate for applications in electrochromic devices or electrochemical sensors. ©The Royal Society of Chemistry and the Centre National de la Recherche Scientifique 2005.

Authors: Vanyashov A.D., Maksimenko V.A., Myshlyavtsev A.V., Yusha V.L., Yanvarev I.A.
Title: Influence of efficiency of heat-exchange systems on characteristics of compressor equipment
Affiliations: Omskij GTU, Omsk, Russian Federation
Authors with affiliations: Vanyashov, A.D., Omskij GTU, Omsk, Russian Federation; Maksimenko, V.A.; Myshlyavtsev, A.V.; Yusha, V.L.; Yanvarev, I.A.
Abstract: Processes of gas catalytic production in compressor - heat exchange systems are considered. The compressor - heat exchange systems determine efficiency of functioning the reforming plants. Scheme of the reforming plant has been presented. These systems provide circulation of hydrogen-containing gases, evaporation of liquid phase during production of gasoline. Evaluation of efficiency of operation of compressors and heat-exchange units under various temperature and hydraulic conditions has been made. Particular role is connected with reliability of heat exchangers. Measures for improvement in the efficiency have been determined.
Index Keywords: Chemical plants; Composition effects; Heat exchangers; Petrochemical plants; Petroleum products; Compressor characteristics; Compressor equipment; Production efficiency; Reforming reactions
Correspondence Address: Vanyashov, A.D.; Omskij GTU, Omsk, Russian Federation

Authors: Yanishevskaya A.G., Zherebtsov S.N.
Title: Centrifugal electroslag casting of the flat flanges
Authors with affiliations: Yanishevskaya, A.G.; Zherebtsov, S.N.
Abstract: The technology of electroslag remelting, combined with centrifugal casting into metallic chill, enables to cast the flanges with the required service and physical-mechanical properties of metal and with the high geometrical preciseness of workpiece. The metal using coefficient upon casting the flat square and round flanges from the St20, 20L, 10G2L, 09G2S steels is equal to 0.6-0.8. Comparison of chemical composition and mechanical properties of metal, produced by induction melting, forging and above method showed a considerable preference of the latter. The flanges of different types and sizes may be used in the vital pipelines.
Index Keywords: Centrifugal casting; Composition; Efficiency; Flanges; Mechanical properties; Quality assurance; Steel castings; Chemical composition; Geometrical preciseness; Electroslag process

Authors: Olenchenko A.V., Nosovets A.I., Mostovov A.P., Fedorov A.A.
Title: Lining of ladle covers using the high-alumina concrete mixture
Affiliations: RUP 'BMZ', Zhlobin, Belarus
Authors with affiliations: Olenchenko, A.V., RUP 'BMZ', Zhlobin, Belarus; Nosovets, A.I.; Mostovov, A.P.; Fedorov, A.A.
Abstract: Process of smelting the steels have been considered. The steel is produced in electric arc furnace and processed in ladle. Operation of the steel-teeming ladle has been discussed. It has been shown that service life of lining of the ladle cover should be improved. In connection with this, various thermal insulating materials have been tested in the ladle cover. The materials of MKRB-200, MKH-94, SUPRAFEST HL81/CH4, SIBRAL-SUPER grades have been utilized in the cover. However, service life of the cover has been low. Then, thermal insulating high-alumina concrete mixture of RANTAL-65 grade has been utilized. Service life of the cover has been improved.
Index Keywords: Aluminous refractories; Composition effects; Foundry practice; Refractory concrete; Steel metallurgy; Cover lining; Ladle cover; Refractory quality; Refractory materials
Correspondence Address: Olenchenko, A.V.; RUP 'BMZ', Zhlobin, Belarus

Authors: Chzhu D.P., Tsyrul'Nikov P.G., Kryukova G.N., Borbat V.F., Kudrya E.N., Smolikov M.D., Bubnov A.V.
Title: The effect of support nature and the temperature of preliminary calcination on the atomic catalytic activity of supported palladium catalysts for the complete oxidation of hydrocarbons
Affiliations: Boreskov Institute of Catalysis, Siberian Division, Russ. Acad. Sci., Omsk, 644053 R., Russian Federation; Boreskov Institute of Catalysis, Siberian Division, Russ. Acad. Sci., N., Russian Federation; Omsk State University, Omsk, 644077 Russia, Russian Federation

Sci., Omsk, 644053 R., Russian Federation; Tsyrul'Nikov, P.G., Boreskov Institute of Catalysis, Siberian Division, Russ. Acad. Sci., Omsk, 644053 R., Russian Federation; Kryukova, G.N., Boreskov Institute of Catalysis, Siberian Division, Russ. Acad. Sci., N., Russian Federation; Borbat, V.F., Omsk State University, Omsk, 644077 Russia, Russian Federation; Kudrya, E.N., Boreskov Institute of Catalysis, Siberian Division, Russ. Acad. Sci., Omsk, 644053 R., Russian Federation; Smolikov, M.D., Boreskov Institute of Catalysis, Siberian Division, Russ. Acad. Sci., Omsk, 644053 R., Russian Federation; Bubnov, A.V., Boreskov Institute of Catalysis, Siberian Division, Russ. Acad. Sci., Omsk, 644053 R., Russian Federation
Abstract: It is shown that for palladium catalysts supported on various supports, there is no effect of thermal activation consisting of an increase in the turnover number (TON) of palladium with an increase in the temperature of sample calcination from 500 to 700°C, as was observed in the case of similar supported platinum catalysts; for two palladiumalumina catalysts calcined at 500°C and differing in the concentration of palladium and dispersity, the TON of low-dispersity palladium is substantially higher than the TON of high-dispersity palladium; all other conditions being the same, the TON of supported palladium is determined by the support nature.
Index Keywords: aluminum oxide; hydrocarbon; palladium; platinum; article; catalysis; dispersion; oxidation; sampling; temperature dependence; thermal analysis

Title: Stability analysis of some algorithms of discrete optimization
Affiliations: Omskij Filial, Inst. Matematiki, SO RAN, Omsk, Russian Federation
Authors with affiliations: Devyaterikova, M.V., Omskij Filial, Inst. Matematiki, SO RAN, Omsk, Russian Federation; Kolokolov, A.A.
Abstract: The results are reviewed on stability of the integer programming algorithms based on using the relaxation sets. The algorithms stability of branches and boundaries is studied for the integer linear programming problem. It is shown that these algorithms are not stable in rather small oscillations of relaxation sets of the considered problems.

Abstract: A process reforming plant for the refining of broad naphtha fractions is discussed. Various alternate layout schemes for the heat-exchange subassembly, which consists of heat exchangers distinguished by number of series- and parallel-connected shells are investigated. Authors: Rybalov A.
Title: On the P-NP problem over real matrix rings
Affiliations: Department of Mathematical Logic, Omsk State University, prospekt Mira 55a, Omsk 644077, Russian Federation; CUNY, Graduate Center of CUNY, Computer Science Department, New York, NY 10036, United States
Authors with affiliations: Rybalov, A., Department of Mathematical Logic, Omsk State University, prospekt Mira 55a, Omsk 644077, Russian Federation, CUNY, Graduate Center of CUNY, Computer Science Department, New York, NY 10036, United States
Abstract: We prove that P ≠ DNP over rings of matrices with real elements in a restricted Blum-Shub-Smale computational model. The restriction is that machines can use only two constants (zero-matrix and identity matrix) in computations. Also we show that in the unrestricted Blum-Shub-Smale model P=DNP over real matrix rings iff P = DNP over the non-ordered real ring and the same is true for the equality P = NP. The latter assertion implies that P ≠ NP over real matrix rings. © 2003 Elsevier B.V. All rights reserved.
Author Keywords: Blum-Shub-Smale model; Matrix ring; Polynomial complexity classes

Authors: Rybalov A.N.
Title: Computational complexity in algebraic systems
Affiliations: Omsk State University, Russian Federation
Authors with affiliations: Rybalov, A.N., Omsk State University, Russian Federation
Abstract: Computability and computational complexity were first considered over the fields of real and complex numbers and generalized to arbitrary algebraic systems. This article approaches the theory of computational complexity over an arbitrary algebraic system by taking computability over the list extension for a computational model of it. We study the resultant polynomial complexity classes and mention some NP-complete problems.

Authors: Devyaterikova M.V., Kolokolov A.A.
Title: Stability analysis of some discrete optimization algorithms
Affiliations: Omsk Affil. Institute of Mathematics, Siberian Branch, Russian Academy of Sciences, Omsk, Russian Federation
Authors with affiliations: Devyaterikova, M.V., Omsk Affil. Institute of Mathematics, Siberian Branch, Russian Academy of Sciences, Omsk, Russian Federation; Kolokolov, A.A., Omsk Affil. Institute of Mathematics, Siberian Branch, Russian Academy of Sciences, Omsk, Russian Federation
Abstract: Facts established for stability of the relaxation set-based integer programming algorithms were reviewed. For the problem of integer linear programming, the branch-and-bound algorithms were examined for stability within the framework of the Land-Doig method. They were shown to be unstable for sufficiently small oscillations of the relaxation sets of the problems at hand. A similar result was obtained for algorithms with the Dantzig cuts.

Authors: Magazev A.A.
Title: Casimir functions for five-dimensional lie groups with a non–semi-hausdorff space of orbits
Affiliations: Omsk State University, Russian Federation
Authors with affiliations: Magazev, A.A., Omsk State University, Russian Federation
Abstract: In the present paper, Lie groups with the multivalued Casimir functions are examined, in particular, a definition of the multivalued Casimir functions is given. It is demonstrated that when a Lie group consists of the essentially multivalued Casimir functions, the space of orbits of the coadjoint representation is non–semi-Hausdorff one, which allows a criterion for identification of these groups to be formulated. As an example, complete involute sets of the Casimir functions are retrieved for all real five-dimensional Lie algebras, and two Lie algebras with a non- Hausdorff space of orbits are identified by this criterion. © 2003 Plenum Publishing Corporation.

Authors: Magazev A.A., Shirokov I.V.
Title: Integration of geodesic flows on homogeneous spaces: The case of a wild Lie group
Affiliations: Omsk State University, Omsk, Russian Federation
Authors with affiliations: Magazev, A.A., Omsk State University, Omsk, Russian Federation; Shirokov, I.V., Omsk State University, Omsk, Russian Federation
Abstract: We obtain necessary and sufficient conditions for the integrability in quadratures of geodesic flows on homogeneous spaces M with invariant and central metrics. The proposed integration algorithm consists in using a special canonical transformation in the space T* M based on constructing the canonical coordinates on the orbits of the coadjoint representation and on the simplectic sheets of the Poisson algebra of invariant functions. This algorithm is applicable to integrating geodesic flows on homogeneous spaces of a wild Lie group.

Authors: Fisyuk A.S., Poendaev N.V.
Title: N-3-oxoalkylamides and -thioamides in the synthesis of heterocyclic compounds. 7*. Study of the cyclization of N-(3-oxoalkyl)amides of tosylacetic acid
Affiliations: Omsk State University, Omsk 644077, Russian Federation
Authors with affiliations: Fisyuk, A.S., Omsk State University, Omsk 644077, Russian Federation; Poendaev, N.V., Omsk State University, Omsk 644077, Russian Federation
Abstract: Alkyl-substituted N-(3-oxoalkyl)amides of tosylacetic acid are cyclized under the action of bases with the formation of 3-tosyl-3,6-dihydropyridin-2(1H) -ones. In the presence of a phenyl substituent at position C(1) of the 3-oxoalkyl chain the reaction proceeds with the formation of 2-pyridones. The principles influencing the regiodirection of cyclization are explained.

Authors: Fisyuk A.S., Peretokin N.V., Unkovsky B.V.
Title: New approach to the synthesis of 1,3-chloroisothiocyanatoalkanes. Synthesis of tetrahydro-1,3-thiazine-2-thiones and 2-alkylamino-5,6-dihydro-1,3-thiazines
Affiliations: Omsk State University, Omsk 644077, Russian Federation
Authors with affiliations: Fisyuk, A.S., Omsk State University, Omsk 644077, Russian Federation; Peretokin, N.V., Omsk State University, Omsk 644077, Russian Federation; Unkovsky, B.V., Omsk State University, Omsk 644077, Russian Federation
Abstract: A method was developed to prepare 1,3-chloroisothiocyanatoalkanes by reducing 1,3-isothiocyanato ketones using sodium borohydride at pH ∼7 and subsequent treatment of the resultant 1,3-isothiocyanato alcohols with thionyl chloride. The reaction of 1,3-chloroisothiocyanatoalkanes with sodium hydrosulfide or amines gives substituted tetrahydro-1,3-thiazine-2-thiones or 2-amino-5,6-dihydro-1,3-thiazines.

Authors: Kovalyov E.V., Resnyanskii E.D., Elokhin V.I., Bal'zhinimaev B.S., Myshlyavtsev A.V.
Title: Novel statistical lattice model for the supported nanoparticle. Features of the reaction performance influenced by the dynamically changed shape and surface morphology of the supported active particle
Affiliations: Boreskov Institute of Catalysis, Russian Academy of Sciences, Novosibirsk 630090, Russian Federation; Omsk State Technical University, Omsk, Russian Federation; Omsk Department, Boreskov Institute of Catalysis, Omsk, Russian Federation
Authors with affiliations: Kovalyov, E.V., Boreskov Institute of Catalysis, Russian Academy of Sciences, Novosibirsk 630090, Russian Federation; Resnyanskii, E.D., Boreskov Institute of Catalysis, Russian Academy of Sciences, Novosibirsk 630090, Russian Federation; Elokhin, V.I., Boreskov Institute of Catalysis, Russian Academy of Sciences, Novosibirsk 630090, Russian Federation; Bal'zhinimaev, B.S., Boreskov Institute of Catalysis, Russian Academy of Sciences, Novosibirsk 630090, Russian Federation; Myshlyavtsev, A.V., Omsk State Technical University, Omsk, Russian Federation, Omsk Department, Boreskov Institute of Catalysis, Omsk, Russian Federation
Abstract: The aim of this study is to reveal the mutual influence of the shape and the surface morphology of supported nanoparticles on the reaction kinetics. The analysis has been provided by means of the novel statistical lattice model, which imitates the physicochemical processes that proceed over the supported particles. To simulate the active metal particle the finite Kossel crystal located on the inert support has been chosen. The surface morphology of the particle is defined by distribution of heights of the metal atom columns. The metal atoms attract the nearest neighbour metal atoms and the atoms of the support. The attraction is characterised by interaction energies between the nearest neighbour metal atoms and between the metal atom and the support underneath. The change of morphology is caused by the thermal diffusion of the surface atoms. As a result the equilibrium shape of the particle has been observed to depend on the temperature and the relative ratio of metal-metal and metal-support energies. The model reaction 2A + B2 → 2AB has been studied, taking into account the roughening of the particle surface and the spillover phenomenon of the adsorbed Aads over the support. It has been shown that the kinetics of the roughened nanometer-sized particle can be notably different from those corresponding to the flat homogeneous surface. The shape of the nanoparticle can change under the influence of the adsorbed layer even in the absence of the adsorbate-metal interactions.
Index Keywords: metal; adsorption; article; chemical interaction; chemical reaction; crystal; equilibrium constant; kinetics; model; molecular dynamics; morphology; nanoparticle; physical chemistry; statistical analysis; surface property

Authors: Stepanov V.N.
Title: First-kind equations on a sphere and some problems of convex geometry
Source title: Journal of Inverse and Ill-Posed Problems
Affiliations: Omsk State Technical University, Russian Federation
Authors with affiliations: Stepanov, V.N., Omsk State Technical University, Russian Federation
Abstract: The properties of integral operators (with a kernel depending on scalar product) acting on Banach spaces of measures and functions on the sphere S n-1 are studied. A theorem of unique solvability of a first-kind equation for measure is proved. Asymptotic formulae for eigenvalues of the kernel are derived. The results are used in proving theorems on the unique reconstructibility of a closed convex hypersurface from its curvature integrals and on its smoothness. Existence of a centrally symmetric closed convex hypersurface with a given curvature integral of projection is also demonstrated. © VSP 2003.

Title: Hydromechanical source of seismic waves with force closure in the inertial mass - Soil system

Authors with affiliations: Bur'yan, Yu.A., Omsk State Technical University, Omsk, Russian Federation; Sorokin, V.N., Omsk State Technical University, Omsk, Russian Federation
Abstract: A model for powerful low-frequency hydromechanical source with force closure in the inertial mass-soil system was considered. The basic characteristics of the source in question were determined. The efficiency of seismic radiation in the operating frequency range was estimated. The oscillations decreased considerably upon switching off the damper and proceeded with a very small phase shift.
Author Keywords: Damping; Hydromechanical vibration source; Rubber-cord casings
Index Keywords: Damping; Differential equations; Vibrations (mechanical); Rubber cord casings; Seismic prospecting

Authors: Bur'yan Yu.A., Sorokin V.N.
Title: Hydromechanical source of seismic waves
Affiliations: Omskij GTU, pr. Mira 11, Omsk, 644050, Russian Federation
Authors with affiliations: Bur'yan, Yu.A., Omskij GTU, pr. Mira 11, Omsk, 644050, Russian Federation; Sorokin, V.N., Omskij GTU, pr. Mira 11, Omsk, 644050, Russian Federation
Abstract: Creation of powerful low-frequency source of seismic waves for solving various problems including vibration treatment of petroleum fields, regional seismic prospecting etc. is current problem. Traditional sources seismic waves are characterized by low efficiency. In order to improve efficiency of generation of seismic waves, it is necessary to locate inertial mass on elastic elements with low rigidity. Model of powerful low-frequency hydromechanical source of seismic waves with force closure in system of inertial mass - ground has been considered. The main characteristics of the source have been determined. Evaluation of efficiency of seismic wave generation has been given.
Index Keywords: Mathematical models; Petroleum deposits; Rock mechanics; Rocks; Seismic prospecting; Hydromechanical source; Rubber-cord shells; Source efficiency; Seismic waves
Correspondence Address: Bur'yan, Yu.A.; Omskij GTU, pr. Mira 11, Omsk, 644050, Russian Federation

Authors: Chernyavskii D.I.
Title: Strength design for the elements of mining machines under elastoplastic impact
Affiliations: Omsk State Technical University, Omsk, Russian Federation
Authors with affiliations: Chernyavskii, D.I., Omsk State Technical University, Omsk, Russian Federation
Abstract: A report on the strength design for the elements of mining machines under elastoplastic impact was presented. The primary wave of compressive and tensile strain was taken into account neglecting the secondary waves generating under the action of the primary wave. The relations between the elastic and plastic strains were found using the momentum and energy conservation laws.
Author Keywords: Energy; Engineering procedure; Impact; Plasticity
Index Keywords: Deformation; Elastoplasticity; Shock waves; Strength of materials; Contact theory; Mining machinery

Title: Effect of thermal activation of supported catalysts Pt/MeOx, where MOx = Al2O3, La2O3, and ZrO2, for complete oxidation
Affiliations: Boreskov Inst. Catalys. (Omsk Br.), Siberian Division, Russian Academy of Sciences, Omsk, 644053, Russian Federation; Omsk State University, Omsk, 644077, Russian Federation

(Omsk Br.), Siberian Division, Russian Academy of Sciences, Omsk, 644053, Russian Federation; Borbat, V.F., Omsk State University, Omsk, 644077, Russian Federation; Bubnov, A.V., Boreskov Inst. Catalys. (Omsk Br.), Siberian Division, Russian Academy of Sciences, Omsk, 644053, Russian Federation
Abstract: A sharp increase in the atomic catalytic activity (ACA) of supported platinum catalysts in the model reaction of n-pentane complete oxidation is found on going from the preliminary calcination temperature of 500-600°C to a temperature of 700°C. ACA increases by an order of magnitude for the Pt/γ-Al2O3 system, ∼3 times for Pt/ZrO2, and ∼1.5 times for Pt/CeO2. The per-gram activities of all catalysts decrease because of a decrease in the dispersion of supported platinum with an increase in the temperature of preliminary calcination.

Authors: Belyaev P.P., Polyakov S.V., Ermakova E.N., Isaev S.V., Yakunin M.N., Sobchakov L.A., Vasilyev A.V., Astakhova N.L., Vladimirov D.N., Volosevich V.S., Protopopov L.N., Gordyushkin S.M., Savitsky A.P., Red’Ko G.V., Eliseev A.A., Fedorov A.B., Ratnikov K.D.
Title: First experiments on generating and receiving artificial ULF (0.3–12 hz) emissions at a distance of 1500 km
Affiliations: Radiophysical Research Institute, Nizhny Novgorod, Russian Federation; Russian Institute of Powerful Radio Construction, St. Petersburg, Russian Federation; A. A. Logachev All-Russian Research Institute of Exploratory Geology, St. Petersburg, Russian Federation
Authors with affiliations: Belyaev, P.P., Radiophysical Research Institute, Nizhny Novgorod, Russian Federation; Polyakov, S.V., Radiophysical Research Institute, Nizhny Novgorod, Russian Federation; Ermakova, E.N., Radiophysical Research Institute, Nizhny Novgorod, Russian Federation; Isaev, S.V., Radiophysical Research Institute, Nizhny Novgorod, Russian Federation; Yakunin, M.N., Radiophysical Research Institute, Nizhny Novgorod, Russian Federation; Sobchakov, L.A., Russian Institute of Powerful Radio Construction, St. Petersburg, Russian Federation; Vasilyev, A.V., Russian Institute of Powerful Radio Construction, St. Petersburg, Russian Federation; Astakhova, N.L., Russian Institute of Powerful Radio Construction, St. Petersburg, Russian Federation; Vladimirov, D.N., Russian Institute of Powerful Radio Construction, St. Petersburg, Russian Federation; Volosevich, V.S., Russian Institute of Powerful Radio Construction, St. Petersburg, Russian Federation; Protopopov, L.N., Russian Institute of Powerful Radio Construction, St. Petersburg, Russian Federation; Gordyushkin, S.M., Russian Institute of Powerful Radio Construction, St. Petersburg, Russian Federation; Savitsky, A.P., A. A. Logachev All-Russian Research Institute of Exploratory Geology, St. Petersburg, Russian Federation; Red’Ko, G.V., A. A. Logachev All-Russian Research Institute of Exploratory Geology, St. Petersburg, Russian Federation; Eliseev, A.A., A. A. Logachev All-Russian Research Institute of Exploratory Geology, St. Petersburg, Russian Federation; Fedorov, A.B., A. A. Logachev All-Russian Research Institute of Exploratory Geology, St. Petersburg, Russian Federation; Ratnikov, K.D., A. A. Logachev All-Russian Research Institute of Exploratory Geology, St. Petersburg, Russian Federation
Abstract: We present first results on generation and reception of an artificial ULF signal at distances of 800 and 1500 km in the frequency range 0.3–12 Hz. The high-sensitivity receiving equipment and a stable current in the antenna exciting the ULF field in the Earth-ionosphere cavity allowed us to detect the signal with high accuracy. It was found that the amplitude-frequency dependences and the polarization of an artificial signal are strongly different in the daytime and at night, which is related to the influence of the near-Earth waveguide and resonance structures on the detected signal. We calculate the signal amplitude for different models of the ionosphere. It is shown that the model of an anisotropic, vertically inhomogeneous ionosphere describes adequately the amplitude-frequency dependences of the measured ULF signal. We calculate the apparent resistance of the underlying surface at the reception point using two measured orthogonal components Hx and Ey of an electromagnetic field. It is shown that the calculation accuracy of the apparent resistance obtained using a controlled ULF source exceeds significantly the accuracy achieved using natural electromagnetic fields. © 2002 Plenum Publishing Corporation.

Authors: Veshkurtsev J.M., Odinets A.I., Altyntsev M.P.
Title: The new methods automated photoelectric spectral analysis with use the standard samples and virtual standards
Source title: 2002 6th International Conference on Actual Problems of Electronic Instrument Engineering, APEIE 2002 - Proceedings
Affiliations: Omsk State Tech. Univ., Russian Federation; JSC Omskagregat, Russian Federation
Authors with affiliations: Veshkurtsev, J.M., Omsk State Tech. Univ., Russian Federation; Odinets, A.I., Omsk State Tech. Univ., Russian Federation; Altyntsev, M.P., JSC Omskagregat, Russian Federation
Abstract: The essential deficiency of traditional methods of spectral analysis, founded on building of calibration graphs on kits for state standard samples (SSS), is the impossibility of the determination of inaccuracy and validity obtained separately results when undertaking current production analyses. As a rule, the degree of accuracy of spectral methods is realized only for industrial laboratories. Herewith the main attention is paid to the definition of accuracy and convergence of results for existing types of material by way of frequent repetitions of cycles from ten and more measurements. © 2002 IEEE.

Authors: Bösinger T., Haldoupis C., Belyaev P.P., Yakunin M.N., Semenova N.V., Demekhov A.G., Angelopoulos V.
Title: Spectral properties of the ionospheric Alfvén resonator observed at a low-latitude station (L = 1.3)
Source title: Journal of Geophysical Research: Space Physics
Affiliations: Department of Physical Sciences, University of Oulu, Oulu, Finland; Physics Department, University of Crete, Iraklion, Greece; Radiophysical Research Institute, Nizhny Novgorod, Russian Federation; Polar Geophysical Institute Apatity, Murmansk, Russian Federation; Institute of Applied Physics, Nizhny Novgorod, Russian Federation; Space Science Laboratory, University of California, Berkeley, CA, United States; University of California, Space Science Laboratory, Berkeley, CA 94720-7450, United States; Radiophysical Research Institute, B. Pecherskaya 25, 603950 Nizhny Novgorod, Russian Federation; Yakunin, M.N., Radiophysical Research Institute, Nizhny Novgorod, Russian Federation, Radiophysical Research Institute, B. Pecherskaya 25, 603950 Nizhny Novgorod, Russian Federation; Semenova, N.V., Polar Geophysical Institute Apatity, Murmansk, Russian Federation, Polar Geophysical Institute Apatity, Murmansk region 184200, Russian Federation; Demekhov, A.G., Institute of Applied Physics, Nizhny Novgorod, Russian Federation, Institute of Applied Physics, 46, Ulyanov Str., 603950 Nizhny Novgorod, Russian Federation; Angelopoulos, V., Space Science Laboratory, University of California, Berkeley, CA, United States, University of California, Space Science Laboratory, Berkeley, CA 94720-7450, United States
Abstract: Data of the first half year of operation of a sensitive search coil magnetometer at a remote site in the island of Crete, Greece (35.15°N, 25.20°E), was used to investigate properties of the spectral resonance structure (SRS) of the ionospheric Alfvén resonator (IAR) at L = 1.3. Most of the properties known from earlier reports and a recent paper (A. G. Yahnin et al., Morphology of the spectral resonance structure of the electromagnetic background noise in the range of 0.1-4 Hz at L = 5.2, submitted to Annales Geophysicae, 2002) (hereinafter referred to as paper CP) at mid and high latitude (L = 2.65 and L = 5.2) could be verified as being valid also at L - 1.3, but several new features were also found. In contrast to mid and high latitudes, SRS signatures were detected every night but not at all during daytime. The average frequency difference Δf between two adjacent harmonics is very small (0.2 Hz) and does not exhibit a local time dependence from evening to night hours. The seasonal dependence is very weak though distinct. A large variability of Δf from night to night was found which increases when proceeding from summer to winter. This variability could not be accounted for by standard IAR models employing an International Reference Ionosphere (IRI). Moreover, the modeled Δf values typically exhibited a systematic offset to higher values as compared to observed ones. It is expected that calibration of the IRI model by local foF2 ionosonde measurements will improve the agreement between model and observation, but it cannot explain fully the variability of Δf and the systematic offset. Most likely the standard IAR model itself requires revision to be fully applicable in the low-latitude ionosphere. Copyright 2002 by the American Geophysical Union.
Author Keywords: Alfvén wave; Ionosphere; Low latitude; Resonance

Authors: Fisyuk A.S., Poendaev N.V.
Title: Cyclization of N-(3-oxoalkyl)chloroacetamides under basic conditions. Synthesis of cis-3,4-epoxypiperidin-2-ones
Affiliations: Department of Organic Chemistry, Omsk State University, Omsk 644077, Russian Federation
Authors with affiliations: Fisyuk, A.S., Department of Organic Chemistry, Omsk State University, Omsk 644077, Russian Federation; Poendaev, N.V., Department of Organic Chemistry, Omsk State University, Omsk 644077, Russian Federation
Abstract: It has been shown that N-(3-oxoalkyl)chloroacetamides (1) can be converted into cis-3,4-epoxypiridin-2-ones (2) upon treatment with t-BuOK in a t-BuOH-C6H6 solution due to a resulting intramolecular Darzens reaction. It has been found that under kinetically controlled reaction conditions (NaOH/C6H6), besides the intramolecular Darzens reaction an intramolecular alkylation takes place.

Authors: Pritykin F.N.
Title: Graphical presentation of hand solid angle and its environmental space in implementation of instant manipulators states
Authors with affiliations: Pritykin, F.N.
Abstract: A method is described that allows graphical presentation of the admissible values region of instant velocities vector of a generalized coordinates variation of the manipulator mechanism. The method can be used in motions synthesis by the velocities vector of the output unit. The hand solid angle and environmental space are determined in implementation of these vectors from the admissible values region that are formed by the longitudinal grip-carrier axis and mechanism units axes.
Index Keywords: Graphic methods; Grippers; Industrial robots; Mechanisms; Vectors; Hand solid angle; Manipulators

Authors: Chernyavskij D.I.
Title: Strength analysis of elements of the mining machines
Affiliations: Omskij GTU, pr. Mira 11, Omsk, 644050, Russian Federation
Authors with affiliations: Chernyavskij, D.I., Omskij GTU, pr. Mira 11, Omsk, 644050, Russian Federation
Abstract: Problems in strength analysis of the mining machines under conditions of elastic and elastoplastic shock have been considered. Parameters of rock bursts have been taken into account. Mathematical model of process of shock action has been developed. The model makes it possible to determine energy of shock waves, elastic and plastic deformations during collision of solid bodies. The engineering procedure based on Hertz contact theory is applied in this case. Calculations of shock load and local deformation have been performed. Propagation of shock waves has been discussed. Results of the calculations are compared with experimental data.
Index Keywords: Deformation; Mathematical models; Mining machinery; Shock waves; Strength of materials; Engineering procedure; Local deformation; Strength analysis; Rocks
Correspondence Address: Chernyavskij, D.I.; Omskij GTU, pr. Mira 11, Omsk, 644050, Russian Federation

Authors: Chesnokova M.G., Poluéktov V.L.
Title: Morphological characteristics of colon polyps [Morfologicheskaia kharakteristika polipoza tolstoi kishki.]
Source title: Ėksperimental'naia i klinicheskaia gastroėnterologiia = Experimental & clinical gastroenterology
Affiliations: Omsk State Medical Academy, Omsk, Russian Federation
Authors with affiliations: Chesnokova, M.G., Omsk State Medical Academy, Omsk, Russian Federation; Poluéktov, V.L., Omsk State Medical Academy, Omsk, Russian Federation
Abstract: The most widespread method of removal of the polyps was polypectomy through colonoscope with electrocoagulation of polyp leg or basis. The survey morphological study of 123 bioptates, received from the patients with polyposis, was carried out. For histological study of bioptates, preparations were painted with hematoxylin and cosine. It was determined, that adenomatous polyps were revealed in 66.7 +/- 4.2% of cases, fibrous polyps in 3.3 +/- 1.6% of cases. The results of comparative research of adenomatous polyps have shown, that common tubular polyps were revealed much more onen among adenomatous polyps--in 74.4 +/- 4.8% of cases. Tubular-papillar-villiferous polyps are revealed only in 25.6 +/- 4.8% of cases. Tubular polyps in the majority of cases (62 5.3%) had the expressed degree of dysplasia. The received data correspond the literary data, which shows that glandular T)olvDS concern to the most eood-cmalitv colonal tumours.
Index Keywords: article; colon; colon polyp; colon polyposis; colonoscopy; human; pathology; Adenomatous Polyposis Coli; Colon; Colonic Polyps; Colonoscopy; Humans
Correspondence Address: Chesnokova, M.G.

Authors: Fisyuk A.S., Ryzhova E.A., Unkovskii B.V.
Title: Interaction of methyl N-(3-oxoalkyl)carbamates, S-methyl-carbamates, and -dithiocarbamates with sodium borohydride. Synthesis of tetrahydro-1,3-oxazin-2-ones and -thiones
Affiliations: Omsk State University, Omsk 644077, Russian Federation
Authors with affiliations: Fisyuk, A.S., Omsk State University, Omsk 644077, Russian Federation; Ryzhova, E.A., Omsk State University, Omsk 644077, Russian Federation; Unkovskii, B.V., Omsk State University, Omsk 644077, Russian Federation
Abstract: The interaction of N-(3-oxoalkyl)carbamates, -thiocarbamates, and -dithiocarbamates with sodium borohydride has been studied. It was shown that reaction proceeds diastereoselectively, and reductive cyclization with the formation of tetrahydro-1,3-oxazin-2-ones and -thiones may occur. The tend to cyclization of the N-(3-hydroxyalkyl)carbamates, -thiocarbamates, and -dithiocarbamates formed as intermediates depends on the number of substituents in the alkyl chain.

Authors: Chesnokova M.G.
Title: Dysbacteriosis in patients with colon polyposis [Disbakterioz u bol'nykh polipozom tolstoi kishki.]
Affiliations: State Medical Academy, Omsk, Russian Federation
Authors with affiliations: Chesnokova, M.G., State Medical Academy, Omsk, Russian Federation
Abstract: The study revealed the most profound changes in the composition of intestinal microflora in patients with polyposis of the large intestine. In these patients anaerobic microflora (bifidobacteria, lactic acid bacteria) was more often suppressed than in other examined groups, in particular, patients with cholelithic disease. The associations of hemolytic Escherichia with Klebsiella pneumoniae, Pseudomonas aeruginosa, Citrobacter freundii were often observed as well as the increased content of enterococci and fungi of the genus Candida. The determination of frequency and degree of manifestations showed that dysbacteriosis was registered in the absolute majority of patients (97.4%) with polyposis of the large intestine. Among patients with cholelithic disease disturbances in microbiocenosis were detected in 60.0% of cases, the profundity and character of the microflora composition changes being less pronounced.
Index Keywords: article; Bifidobacterium; Candida; colon; colon polyp; human; intestine mucosa; isolation and purification; Lactobacillaceae; microbiology; pathology; Bifidobacterium; Candida; Colon; Colonic Polyps; Humans; Intestinal Mucosa; Lactobacillaceae
Correspondence Address: Chesnokova, M.G.

Authors: Myshlyavtsev A.V.
Title: Surface diffusion modelling: Transfer matrix approach
Source title: Studies in Surface Science and Catalysis
Affiliations: Tuvinian Inst. for Explor. Nat. R., Siberian Branch, Russian Academy of Science, Kyzyl, Tuva 667007, Russian Federation
Authors with affiliations: Myshlyavtsev, A.V., Tuvinian Inst. for Explor. Nat. R., Siberian Branch, Russian Academy of Science, Kyzyl, Tuva 667007, Russian Federation
Abstract: The transfer matrix technique is shown to be very effective for studies of two-dimensional systems with various lattices. In particular, transfer matrix method can be used for simulation of the surface diffusion. The results obtained for square and honeycomb lattices are briefly discussed. The transfer matrix method seems to be the best addition to the Monte Carlo simulations.

Authors: Mashkov Yu.K., Gladenko A.A., Kalistratova L.F., Ovchar Z.N., Mamaev O.A.
Title: The structure and properties of polyfluoroethylene modified by crystalline graphite
Authors with affiliations: Mashkov, Yu.K.; Gladenko, A.A.; Kalistratova, L.F.; Ovchar, Z.N.; Mamaev, O.A.
Abstract: The investigations of structure and physical-mechanical properties for polymer composite based on polyfluoroethylene with different content of ultradisperse crystalline graphite are presented. Influence of supermolecular structure parameters of polymer matrix on tribotechnical and mechanical properties of modified polyfluoroethylene is shown. The results of research into the influence of friction upon polymer matrix structure are given.
Index Keywords: Compressive stress; Crystalline materials; Friction; Graphite; Loads (forces); Mechanical properties; Modification; Physical properties; Stresses; Tribology; Wear of materials; Polytetrafluoroethylenes

Authors: Myshlyavtsev A.V., Myshlyavtseva M.D.
Title: Thermodynamics for Lattice Models with Randomly Distributed Quenched Impurities: Exact Solution
Affiliations: Tuvinian Inst. Explor. of Nat. Rsrc., Siberian Br. of Russ. Acad. of Sci., Kyzyl 607007, Tuva, Russian Federation; Tuvinian State University, Kyzyl 667000, Tuva, Russian Federation
Authors with affiliations: Myshlyavtsev, A.V., Tuvinian Inst. Explor. of Nat. Rsrc., Siberian Br. of Russ. Rsrc., Siberian Br. of Russ. Acad. of Sci., Kyzyl 607007, Tuva, Russian Federation, Tuvinian State University, Kyzyl 667000, Tuva, Russian Federation
Abstract: The transfer matrix technique is shown to be extendable to the lattice models with randomly distributed quenched impurities. As a result, the thermodynamic quantities for semi-infinite lattices are exactly calculated. The technique elaborated was employed for studies of the monomolecular thermodesorption spectra for square lattice with two kinds of active adsorption centers taking into account the nearest-neighbor lateral interactions. This technique is shown to be very efficient for studies of two-dimensional heterogeneous system with complex lattices.

Authors: Mashkov Yu.K., Gladenko A.A., Kalistratova L.F., Ovchar Z.N., Mamaev O.A.
Title: Structure and behavior of polytetrafluoroethylene modified by natural cryptocrystalline graphite
Authors with affiliations: Mashkov, Yu.K.; Gladenko, A.A.; Kalistratova, L.F.; Ovchar, Z.N.; Mamaev, O.A.
Abstract: The results are reported of studies in structure, physical-mechanical and tribological characteristics of polymer composites based on polytetrafluoroethylene (PTFE) containing the ultradispersed cryptocrystalline graphite. A relationship and dependence are found of the tribological and mechanical properties of the modified PTFE on the pattern and parameters of the supermolecular structure of polymer matrix. The effect of friction on the matrix structure is shown.

Authors: Lugovskoi A.I., Loginov S.A., Vashchenko P.M., Makeev S.A.
Title: Experience in modernization of the reforming units
Source title: Khimiya i Tekhnologiya Topliv i Masel
Authors with affiliations: Lugovskoi, A.I.; Loginov, S.A.; Vashchenko, P.M.; Makeev, S.A.
Abstract: There are five catalytic reforming units at Ryazan' Refinery (L-35/5, L-35/11-300, L-35/6, LCh-35/11-600, and LG-35/8-300B) which are constantly improved, specifically by introducing modern domestic catalysts. To provide stable operation of the hydrofining block, a circulation scheme of supplying hydrogen-containing gas was implemented and new highly efficient catalysts with higher rhenium content were introduced. The unit L-35/5 was revamped by introducing direct feeding and designing its own hydrofining block. In the unit L-35/11-300, the volume of reforming reactors was increased and the distribution of catalyst between steps was improved. The waste heat of reforming unit was used for heating columns in the stabilization block. New technologies were tested providing optimal use of polymetallic catalysts. As a result of revamping, in 1998-1999 the refinery increased production of high-octane gasolines.

Authors: Lugovskoi A.I., Loginov S.A., Rudyak K.B., Makeev S.A., Vashchenko P.M., Tambasov M.A.
Title: Optimization in operating the diesel fuel hydrofining units
Source title: Khimiya i Tekhnologiya Topliv i Masel
Authors with affiliations: Lugovskoi, A.I.; Loginov, S.A.; Rudyak, K.B.; Makeev, S.A.; Vashchenko, P.M.; Tambasov, M.A.
Abstract: At Ryazan' Refinery, two two-block diesel fuel hydrorefining units of hot gas separation, L-24-6 and LCh-24-7, were revamped to eliminate bottlenecks and to prepare the units for production of diesel fuels meeting new European standards. The revamping included installation of additional reactor in each reactor block, connected in series to two existing parallel reactors. This allowed to lower the volume velocity of stock feeding in order to lessen sulfur content in hydrofined diesel fuel. Trays in stabilization columns were changed and the power of ovens in this block was increase. This lowered final boiling point down to 170°C. The original system of removing H2S dissolved in gasoline by monoethanolamine was activated, so that this gasoline could be used as feedstock for catalytic reforming. New heat exchangers allowed to decrease hydraulic resistance of the system.

Authors: Trakhtengerts V.Y., Belyaev P.P., Polyakov S.V., Demekhov A.G., Bösinger T.
Title: Excitation of Alfvén waves and vortices in the ionospheric Alfvén resonator by modulated powerful radio waves
Source title: Journal of Atmospheric and Solar-Terrestrial Physics
Affiliations: Institute of Applied Physics, Nizhny Novgorod, Russian Federation; Radiophysical Research Institute, Nizhny Novgorod, Russian Federation; University of Oulu, Oulu, Finland
Authors with affiliations: Trakhtengerts, V.Y., Institute of Applied Physics, Nizhny Novgorod, Russian Federation; Belyaev, P.P., Radiophysical Research Institute, Nizhny Novgorod, Russian Federation; Polyakov, S.V., Radiophysical Research Institute, Nizhny Novgorod, Russian Federation; Demekhov, A.G., Institute of Applied Physics, Nizhny Novgorod, Russian Federation; Bösinger, T., University of Oulu, Oulu, Finland
Abstract: A review of the artificial excitation of Alfvén waves and vortices in the ionospheric Alfvén resonator (IAR) is presented. In the framework of simplified models of the IAR and the Alfvén vortex instability, we discuss the main physical phenomena arising under the periodic heating of the ionosphere by a powerful HF radio signal with a modulation frequency F which lies in the range of short-period geomagnetic pulsations (F = 0.1-10 Hz). The amplitudes, frequency spectra, and polarization characteristics of artificial pulsations on the ground are found, and a brief comparison with experimental data is made. The Alfvén vortex instability in the IAR is analysed from the point of view of its artificial triggering. Two ways of such a triggering are discussed. The first suggests the use of two spaced transmitter antenna which produce an ionospheric current being in resonance with Alfvén vortices. Existing heating facilities are suitable for this experiment. The second method is based on the change of macroscopic parameters of the ionosphere, such as the conductivity in the instability region. This method is simple, but requires more powerful heaters. © Elsevier Science Ltd.

Authors: Ermakova E.N., Belyaev P.P., Belova N.I., Trakhtengerts V.Y.
Title: A sunset effect in variations of the eigenfrequencies of the ionospheric Alfven resonator
Source title: Journal of Atmospheric and Solar-Terrestrial Physics
Affiliations: Radiophysical Res. Institute (NIRFI), 25/14 B. Pecherskaya Street, 603024, Nizhny Novgorod, Russian Federation; Inst. Appl. Phys. Russ. Acad. Sci., 46 Uljanov Street, 603600, Nizhny Novgorod, Russian Federation
Authors with affiliations: Ermakova, E.N., Radiophysical Res. Institute (NIRFI), 25/14 B. Pecherskaya Street, 603024, Nizhny Novgorod, Russian Federation; Belyaev, P.P., Radiophysical Res. Institute (NIRFI), 25/14 B. Pecherskaya Street, 603024, Nizhny Novgorod, Russian Federation; Belova, N.I., Radiophysical Res. Institute (NIRFI), 25/14 B. Pecherskaya Street, 603024, Nizhny Novgorod, Russian Federation; Trakhtengerts, V.Y., Inst. Appl. Phys. Russ. Acad. Sci., 46 Uljanov Street, 603600, Nizhny Novgorod, Russian Federation
Abstract: A method of detecting wavelike disturbances at heights of 200-400 km, based on the measurements of variations of the ionospheric Alfven resonator eigenfrequencies, is developed. The amplitude of these variations ΔF increases significantly after the solar terminator crosses at sunset. The period of this variation varies in the interval from 30 to 60 min; the relative amplitude of the variation lies in the range 2-5%. ΔF variations can be connected with the generation of internal gravity waves at heights about 200 km. © Elsevier Science Ltd.

Authors: Trakhtengerts V.Y., Demekhov A.G., Belyaev P.P., Polyakov S.V., Ermakova E.N., Isaev S.V.
Title: A mechanism of anticorrelation in the occurrence of ULF electromagnetic noise resonance structure and Pc 1 magnetic pulsations through the solar activity cycle
Source title: Journal of Atmospheric and Solar-Terrestrial Physics
Affiliations: Institute of Applied Physics, Nizhny Novgorod, Russian Federation; Radiophysical Research Institute, Nizhny Novgorod, Russian Federation
Authors with affiliations: Trakhtengerts, V.Y., Institute of Applied Physics, Nizhny Novgorod, Russian Federation; Demekhov, A.G., Institute of Applied Physics, Nizhny Novgorod, Russian Federation; Belyaev, P.P., Radiophysical Research Institute, Nizhny Novgorod, Russian Federation; Polyakov, S.V., Radiophysical Research Institute, Nizhny Novgorod, Russian Federation; Ermakova, E.N., Radiophysical Research Institute, Nizhny Novgorod, Russian Federation; Isaev, S.V., Radiophysical Research Institute, Nizhny Novgorod, Russian Federation
Abstract: The observed anticorrelation between the 11-year solar activity cycle and the appearance of Pc 1 geomagnetic pulsations as well as the resonance structure of the electromagnetic noise spectrum (SRS) in the frequency range 0.1-10 Hz is explained on the basis of the role of the ionospheric Alfvén resonator (IAR) in the formation of both phenomena. The reflection coefficient R of Alfvén waves from the IAR determines the threshold of the cyclotron instability (CI) which is the cause of Pc 1 pulsations. At the same time, the quality of the IAR, which varies synchronously with R, controls the SRS modulation depth. It is shown that the decrease of the maximum value of R during the maximum phase of the solar activity cycle remarkably increases the CI threshold and sharply decreases the modulation depth of SRS, thus decreasing the occurrence probability of both phenomena. © 2000 Elsevier Science Ltd.

Authors: Belyaev P.P., Polyakov S.V., Ermakova E.N., Isaev S.V.
Title: Solar cycle variations in the ionospheric Alfven resonator 1985-1995
Source title: Journal of Atmospheric and Solar-Terrestrial Physics
Affiliations: Radiophysical Res. Institute (NIRFI), 25/14 B. Pecherskaya Street, 603024, Nizhny Novgorod, Russian Federation
Authors with affiliations: Belyaev, P.P., Radiophysical Res. Institute (NIRFI), 25/14 B. Pecherskaya Street, 603024, Nizhny Novgorod, Russian Federation; Polyakov, S.V., Radiophysical Res. Institute (NIRFI), 25/14 B. Pecherskaya Street, 603024, Nizhny Novgorod, Russian Federation; Ermakova, E.N., Radiophysical Res. Institute (NIRFI), 25/14 B. Pecherskaya Street, 603024, Nizhny Novgorod, Russian Federation; Isaev, S.V., Radiophysical Res. Institute (NIRFI), 25/14 B. Pecherskaya Street, 603024, Nizhny Novgorod, Russian Federation
Abstract: Based on long-term observations of the resonance structure in the electromagnetic background noise spectrum (resonance spectrum structure, RSS), recorded in the frequency range 0.1-10 Hz over one complete solar cycle (11 years, from 1985 to 1995), it was found that the resonance conditions for Alfven waves in the ionosphere (ionospheric Alfven resonator) are determined at midlatitudes by the level of solar activity. RSS are regularly observed in years of minimum solar activity, and are practically absent in years of maximum solar activity. It is shown that consideration of the ionospheric Alfven resonator explains the dependence of the RSS on solar activity.

Authors: Demekhov A.G., Belyaev P.P., Isaev S.V., Manninen J., Turunen T., Kangas J.
Title: Modelling the diurnal evolution of the resonance spectral structure of the atmospheric noise background in the Pc 1 frequency range
Source title: Journal of Atmospheric and Solar-Terrestrial Physics
Affiliations: Institute of Applied Physics, Nizhny Novgorod, Russian Federation; Radiophysical Research Institute, Nizhny Novgorod, Russian Federation; Sodankyl Geophysical Observatory, Sodankyl, Finland
Authors with affiliations: Demekhov, A.G., Institute of Applied Physics, Nizhny Novgorod, Russian Federation; Belyaev, P.P., Radiophysical Research Institute, Nizhny Novgorod, Russian Federation; Isaev, S.V., Radiophysical Research Institute, Nizhny Novgorod, Russian Federation; Manninen, J., Sodankyl Geophysical Observatory, Sodankyl, Finland; Turunen, T., Sodankyl Geophysical Observatory, Sodankyl, Finland; Kangas, J., Sodankyl Geophysical Observatory, Sodankyl, Finland
Abstract: We calculate the frequency spectrum of the electromagnetic background noise in frequency range 0.1-5 Hz based on the model attributing its formation to the ionospheric resonant filtration of the radiation from distant lightning discharges (Belyaev, P.P., Polyakov, S.V., Rapoport, V.O., Trakhtengerts, V.Y., 1989. Theory of formation of the resonance spectral structure of atmospheric electromagnetic noise background in the range of short-period geomagnetic pulsations, Izvestiya vuzov-Radiofizika 32(7) 802-810). Characteristics of the spectral resonance structure (SRS) formed due to the ionospheric Alfvén resonator are obtained and their dependence on ionospheric parameters is considered; the SRS variation during a day is discussed. The calculations are compared with the ULF ground based observations at Sodankylä and Nizhny Novgorod; consistency of theory and experiment is demonstrated. Opportunities to use such data to determine some of ionosphere parameters are discussed. © Elsevier Science Ltd.

Authors: Bösinger T., Pashin T., Kero A., Pollari P., Belyaev P., Rietveld M., Turunen T., Kangas J.
Title: Generation of artificial magnetic pulsations in the Pc1 frequency range by periodic heating of the Earth's ionosphere: Indications of ionospheric Alfvén resonator effects
Source title: Journal of Atmospheric and Solar-Terrestrial Physics
Affiliations: University of Oulu, Department of Physical Sciences, Oulu, Finland; Polar Geophysical Institute, Apatity, Russian Federation; Radiophysical Research Institute, Nizhny Novgorod, Russian Federation; EISCAT Scientific Association, Tromsdalen, Norway; Geophysical Observatory, Sodankyla, Finland
Authors with affiliations: Bösinger, T., University of Oulu, Department of Physical Sciences, Oulu, Finland; Pashin, T., Polar Geophysical Institute, Apatity, Russian Federation; Kero, A., University of Oulu, Department of Physical Sciences, Oulu, Finland; Pollari, P., University of Oulu, Department of Physical Sciences, Oulu, Finland; Belyaev, P., Radiophysical Research Institute, Nizhny Novgorod, Russian Federation; Rietveld, M., EISCAT Scientific Association, Tromsdalen, Norway; Turunen, T., Geophysical Observatory, Sodankyla, Finland; Kangas, J., Geophysical Observatory, Sodankyla, Finland
Abstract: A series of six experiments with the EISCAT HF heater device assisted by the EISCAT (European-Incoherent-Scatter) radar were carried out with the purpose of producing artificial magnetic pulsations in the 0.1-3 Hz frequency range. In only 3 of the 30 h of experiment time under a variety of ionospheric conditions was an artificial magnetic signal detected by ground-based magnetometers. A numerical model was used to explain the sporadic nature of the artificial signal in terms of ionospheric parameters. For several experiments the EISCAT radar provided an in situ electric field and/or electron density values; otherwise standard neutral atmosphere and ionosphere models were used. The PGI model was only partially successful. It could produce the right order of magnitude for the artificial signal when it was observed and it could demonstrate the different efficiencies when using either the O- or the X-mode of the HF wave, but it could not explain why the artificial signal was observed at a particular time and not at others. This is only partially due to the uncertainty in one or more input parameters. When the artificial signal was observed its spectrum usually exhibited spectral resonance structures of the Ionospheric Alfvén Resonator (IAR), indicating that a "DC approach" is insufficient and that the generation of oscillating field-aligned currents, and thereby shear Alfvén waves, has to be taken into account. We believe, however, that even with the introduction of the IAR into the model it will not be possible to resolve the sporadic character of the heating-induced artificial magnetic signal entirely. A more realistic way of D-region modeling will without doubt also be an important factor in resolving the puzzle. © Elsevier Science Ltd.

Authors: Trakhtengerts V.Y., Demekhov A.G., Polyakov S.V., Belyaev P.P., Rapoport V.O.
Title: A mechanism of Pc 1 pearl formation based on the Alfvén sweep maser
Source title: Journal of Atmospheric and Solar-Terrestrial Physics
Affiliations: Institute of Applied Physics, Russ. Acad. Sci., 46 Uljanov S., Nizhny Novgorod, Russian Federation; Radiophysical Research Institute, Nizhny Novgorod, Russian Federation
Authors with affiliations: Trakhtengerts, V.Y., Institute of Applied Physics, Russ. Acad. Sci., 46 Uljanov S., Nizhny Novgorod, Russian Federation; Demekhov, A.G., Institute of Applied Physics, Russ. Acad. Sci., 46 Uljanov S., Nizhny Novgorod, Russian Federation; Polyakov, S.V., Radiophysical Research Institute, Nizhny Novgorod, Russian Federation; Belyaev, P.P., Radiophysical Research Institute, Nizhny Novgorod, Russian Federation; Rapoport, V.O., Radiophysical Research Institute, Nizhny Novgorod, Russian Federation
Abstract: A self-consistent model for the generation of Pc 1 pearl emissions based on the nonlinear coupling between the magnetospheric and ionospheric resonators for Alfvén waves is considered. Formation of pearls is attributed to the pulsating regime of the Alfvén sweep maser with nonlinear selective mirrors. Such mirrors are formed by the conjugate ionospheres: their reflection coefficient has an oscillatory frequency dependence due to eigenmodes of the ionospheric Alfvén resonator. Nonlinear magnetosphere/ionosphere feedback is provided by the dependence of the value and frequency of the reflection maxima on the flux of energetic protons precipitated into the ionospheres in the course of Alfvén wave generation in the magnetosphere. A nonlinear soliton-like solution of this model is found which corresponds to a single wave packet having the positive frequency drift and oscillating between the conjugate ionospheres. Properties of this solution are shown to explain many observational characteristics of Pc 1 pearls, such as their morningside predominance, correlation with low magnetic activity, spatio-temporal and spectral patterns. © Elsevier Science Ltd.

Authors: Shitova N.B., Drozdov V.A., Kolosov P.E., Smolikov M.D.
Title: Distinctive features of supported catalysts prepared from platinum carbonyl clusters
Affiliations: Boreskov Institute Catalysis, Siberian Division, Russian Academy of Sciences, Omsk, 644053, Russian Federation
Authors with affiliations: Shitova, N.B., Boreskov Institute Catalysis, Siberian Division, Russian Academy of Sciences, Omsk, 644053, Russian Federation; Drozdov, V.A., Boreskov Institute Catalysis, Siberian Division, Russian Academy of Sciences, Omsk, 644053, Russian Federation; Kolosov, P.E., Boreskov Institute Catalysis, Siberian Division, Russian Academy of Sciences, Omsk, 644053, Russian Federation; Smolikov, M.D., Boreskov Institute Catalysis, Siberian Division, Russian Academy of Sciences, Omsk, 644053, Russian Federation
Abstract: The formation of Pt/γ-Al2O3 and Pt/C catalysts from platinum carbonyl clusters H2[Pt3(CO)6]n (n = 2, 5) is studied. The strength of interaction between clusters (strong Lewis bases) and the support and the state of platinum in catalysts are governed by the acceptor strength of the support. The formation of a stable platinum compound with a surface of γ-Al2O3 (strong Lewis acid) is shown for a Pt/γ-Al2O3 catalyst by the method of radial distribution functions. In a Pt/C catalyst containing the same amount of Pt supported on a carbon material known to be a weaker acceptor, metallic platinum is formed along with surface-bonded platinum. Proceeding from the existence of the active phase of catalysts in the form of a surface platinum complex and platinum crystallites, the properties of catalysts are discussed in the complete oxidation of methane and the dehydrogenation of cyclohexane, as well as the high dispersity of platinum and its thermal stability.

Abstract: Nanocomposites based upon framework zirconium phosphates with supported WO3, MoO3 and Pt nanoparticles were synthesized via the incipient wetness impregnation of high-surface-area mesoporous phosphate samples with water solutions of corresponding salts followed by drying and calcination. The structure and surface properties of nanocomposites were studied by using combination of structural and spectral methods. Due to a strong interaction between supports and supported species, the structure of the latter differs considerably from that of the bulk phases. Surface acid centers typical for zirconium phosphates disappear suggesting their participation in bonding nanoparticles of promoters. Instead, new types of strong acid sites associated with tungsten oxide clusters emerge. The effect of these promoters on performance of zirconium phosphates in the reaction of pentane and hexane isomerization is considered.
Author Keywords: Catalysis of pentane and hexane isomerization; Framework zirconium phosphates; MoO3 and Pt; Nanocomposites; Supported nanoparticles of WO3

Authors: Kolosov P.E., Shitova N.B., Smolikov M.D., Drozdov V.A., Moroz E.M.
Title: Platinum supported catalysts prepared from metal carbonyl clusters for hydrocarbons conversion
Affiliations: Omsk State University, 55A Mira Prospect, Omsk, 644077, Russian Federation; Boreskov Institute of Catalysis, Omsk Department, 54 Neftezavodskaya Street, Omsk, 644040, Russian Federation; Boreskov Institute of Catalysis, 5 Lavrentieva Prospect, Novosibirsk, 630090, Russian Federation
Authors with affiliations: Kolosov, P.E., Omsk State University, 55A Mira Prospect, Omsk, 644077, Russian Federation; Shitova, N.B., Boreskov Institute of Catalysis, Omsk Department, 54 Neftezavodskaya Street, Omsk, 644040, Russian Federation; Smolikov, M.D., Boreskov Institute of Catalysis, Omsk Department, 54 Neftezavodskaya Street, Omsk, 644040, Russian Federation; Drozdov, V.A., Boreskov Institute of Catalysis, Omsk Department, 54 Neftezavodskaya Street, Omsk, 644040, Russian Federation; Moroz, E.M., Boreskov Institute of Catalysis, 5 Lavrentieva Prospect, Novosibirsk, 630090, Russian Federation
Abstract: The investigation of surface Pt/alumina, Pt/carbon (Sibunit) and Pt/SiO2 species prepared by anchoring of Pt carbonyl clusters of various nuclearity as precursors for high dispersive and thermostable platinum supported catalysts for hydrocarbons conversion, using RDF (radial distribution functions) and chemisorption methods, has shown strong metal-support interaction with formation of Pt/alumina phase with highly dispersed (practically monoatomic) and homogeneously distributed Pt atoms onto alumina surface. The catalytic properties were studied in methane oxidation and cyclohexane dehydrogenation reactions.
Index Keywords: Alumina; Carbon; Catalysts; Chemical reactions; Chemisorption; Hydrocarbons; Hydrogenation; Silica; Thermodynamic stability; Thermooxidation; Cyclohexane dehydrogenation reactions; Hydrocarbon conversions; Metal carbonyl clusters; Platinum
