Authors: Belyaev P.P.
Title: First evidence at high latitudes for the ionospheric Alfvén resonator
Source title: Journal of Geophysical Research: Space Physics
Affiliations: University of Oulu, Department of Physical Sciences, P.O.Box 3000, FIN-90401 Oulu, Finland
Authors with affiliations: Belyaev, P.P., University of Oulu, Department of Physical Sciences, P.O.Box 3000, FIN-90401 Oulu, Finland
Abstract: A high-sensitive, two-component induction magnetometer was used to measure natural electromagnetic background noise in the frequency range 0.110 Hz. The measurements were carried out in Kilpisjärvi/Finland (geographic latitude 69.02° N, longitude 20.87° E, L ∼ 6) in 1993. The average dynamic spectra were derived for four senses of polarization (two linear N-S and E-W and two circular R and L) with a spectral resolution of 0.1 Hz and time resolution of 20 min. During at least 4 out of 12 nights covered by the measurements, clear evidence of spectral resonance structures (SRS) known from midlatitude observations were seen in the magnetic noise spectra. As a rule, 3-4 spectral maxima were observed. The frequency spacing AF of SRS between the spectral peaks in the SRS varied between ∼ 0.5 and ∼ 1.5 Hz. The ratio of amplitudes between spectral maxima and minima constituting the SRS was about 2. The diurnal variation of ΔF did not differ in principle from the one observed at midlatitudes. The sense of polarization of the SRS signal varied between right-handed circular and linear with an arbitrary orientation of the magnetic axis. Electron density measurements in the ionospheric F region support the view that the SRS are due to the effect of the ionospheric Alfvén resonator. Copyright 1999 by the American Geophysical Union.
References: Althouse, E.L., Davis, J.R., Five-station observations of pc-1 micropulsation propagation (1978) J. Geophys. Aeron., 24, pp. 202-205; Belyaev, P.P., Polyakov, S.V., Rapoport, V.O., Trakhtengerts, V.Y., Characteristics of wave generation in an asymmetrical Alfvén maser (1985) Geomagn. Authors: Myshlyavtsev A.V., Myshlyavtseva M.D.
Title: Apparent Arrhenius parameters for desorption from a square lattice with top and bridge sites: Transfer-matrix approach
Affiliations: Tuvinian Interdisciplinary Institute, Siberian Branch, Russian Academy of Sciences, Kyzyl 667007, Tuva, Russian Federation; Tuvinian State University, Kyzyl 667000, Tuva, Russian Federation
Authors with affiliations: Myshlyavtsev, A.V., Tuvinian Interdisciplinary Institute, Siberian Branch, Russian Academy of Sciences, Kyzyl 667007, Tuva, Russian Federation; Myshlyavtseva, M.D., Tuvinian Interdisciplinary Institute, Siberian Branch, Russian Academy of Sciences, Kyzyl 667007, Tuva, Russian Federation, Tuvinian State University, Kyzyl 667000, Tuva, Russian Federation
Abstract: Apparent Arrhenius parameters for monomolecular desorption from the square lattice with a complex elementary cell are analyzed by employing the transfer-matrix technique. The results obtained are compared with the experimental data for the CO/Ni(100) system. The transfermatrix technique is shown to be very effective for studies of two-dimensional systems with complex lattices and large elementary cells.

Title: Structural modification of materials in metal-polymer tribosystems
Affiliations: Omsk State Technical University, Russian Federation

Authors: Elokhin V.I., Myshlyavtsev A.V., Latkin E.I., Resnyanskii E.D., Sheinin D.E., Bal'zhinimaev B.S.
Title: Statistical Lattice Models of Physicochemical Processes in Catalytic Reactions: Autooscillations, Adsorption on the Rough Surface, and Crystallization
Affiliations: Boreskov Institute of Catalysis, Siberian Division, Russian Academy of Sciences, Novosibirsk, 630090, Russian Federation; Tuva Inst. Complex Devmt. Nat. Rsrc., Siberian Division, Russian Academy of Sciences, Kyzyl, Tuva, Russian Federation; MIOO Research Institute, Novosibirsk State University, Novosibirsk, Russian Federation
Authors with affiliations: Elokhin, V.I., Boreskov Institute of Catalysis, Siberian Division, Russian Academy of Sciences, Novosibirsk, 630090, Russian Federation; Myshlyavtsev, A.V., Tuva Inst. Complex Devmt. Nat. Rsrc., Siberian Division, Russian Academy of Sciences, Kyzyl, Tuva, Russian Federation; Latkin, E.I., MIOO Research Institute, Novosibirsk State University, Novosibirsk, Russian Federation; Resnyanskii, E.D., Boreskov Institute of Catalysis, Siberian Division, Russian Academy of Sciences, Novosibirsk, 630090, Russian Federation; Sheinin, D.E., Boreskov Institute of Catalysis, Siberian Division, Russian Academy of Sciences, Novosibirsk, 630090, Russian Federation; Bal'zhinimaev, B.S., Boreskov Institute of Catalysis, Siberian Division, Russian Academy of Sciences, Novosibirsk, 630090, Russian Federation
Abstract: Imitation models of various catalytic processes are considered: autooscillations and autowaves in CO oxidation on platinum metals occurring with formation of the near-surface form of oxygen; monomolecular and dissociative adsorption on the catalyst surface with the dynamically changed morphology; and crystallization of a melt of an active component of vanadium catalysts for sulfur dioxide oxidation. All models are unified by the common statistical nature of the physicochemical processes under study.

Authors: Maystrenko V.A., Nikonov A.V., Sayfoutdinov K.R., Fedosov D.V.
Title: Non-linear dynamics of phase synchronization systems including frequency conversion devices
Source title: 1998 4th International Conference on Actual Problems of Electronic Instrument Engineering, APEIE 1998 - Proceedings
Affiliations: Omsk State Technical University, Omsk, Russian Federation
Authors with affiliations: Maystrenko, V.A., Omsk State Technical University, Omsk, Russian Federation; Nikonov, A.V., Omsk State Technical University, Omsk, Russian Federation; Sayfoutdinov, K.R., Omsk State Technical University, Omsk, Russian Federation; Fedosov, D.V., Omsk State Technical University, Omsk, Russian Federation
Abstract: A number of specific aspects is discussed concerning the performance of frequency conversion PLL systems in the UHF range. False lock-in probability at multiple frequencies due to wideband noise sources has been analyzed for pulse PLLs with varying division ratio dividers (VDRD). Recommendations have been obtained on the false lock-in elimination. A series of time delay PLL system models has been investigated. It has proved to be advisable in engineering calculations to apply the models using the first members of the ideal delay operator of Pade functions expansion and the small parameter approach. The results of theoretical investigations were practically used in time interval generators and UHF synthesizer developments. © 1998 Novosibirsk State Tech Univ.
Index Keywords: Electronics industry; Locks (fasteners); Engineering calculation; Frequency conversion devices; Multiple frequency; Non-linear dynamics; Pade functions; Phase synchronization; Theoretical investigations; Wideband noise; Phase locked loops
References: Zhilin, N.S., Maystrenko, V.A., Niconov, A.V., Sayfoutdinov, K.R., Vhf phase and freuency synthesizers based on pll principle II (1994) Proceedings 5th International Symposium on Personal, Indoor and Mobile Radio Communication (PIMRC'94) the Hague, the Netherlands, 1, pp. 329-331. , September
Publisher: Institute of Electrical and Electronics Engineers Inc.
Conference name: 1998 4th International Conference on Actual Problems of Electronic Instrument Engineering, APEIE 1998

Authors: Fisyuk A.S.
Title: A new route for the synthesis of 5,6-dihydropyridin-2(1H)-ones, 2-pyridones and (4-hydroxy-2-oxopiperid-3-yl)pyridinium chlorides by intramolecular cyclization of N-3-oxoalkylchloroacetamide derivatives
Affiliations: Department of Chemistry, Omsk State University, 644077 Omsk, Russian Federation
Authors with affiliations: Fisyuk, A.S., Department of Chemistry, Omsk State University, 644077 Omsk, Russian Federation
Abstract: The intramolecular cyclization of triphenylphosphonium and pyridinium derivatives of N-3-oxoalkylchloroacetamides leads to 5,6-dihydropyridin-2(1H)-ones, 2-pyridones and (4-hydroxy-2-oxopiperid-3-yl)pyridinium chlorides.

Authors: Fisyuk A.S., Vorontsova M.A.
Title: N-3-oxoalkylamides and -thioamides in synthesis of heterocyclic compounds. 3. Study of cyclization of N-3-oxoalkylthioamides into 5,6-dihydropyridine-2(1H)-thiones
Affiliations: Omsk State University, Omsk 644077, Russian Federation
Authors with affiliations: Fisyuk, A.S., Omsk State University, Omsk 644077, Russian Federation; Vorontsova, M.A., Omsk State University, Omsk 644077, Russian Federation
Abstract: 5,6-Dihydropyridine-2(1H)-thiones containing a hydrogen atom, aryl, or alkyl substituent in position 3 were obtained by cyclization of fatty acid N-3-oxoalkylthioamides with bases. ©1998 Plenum Publishing Corporation.
Funding Details: Russian Foundation for Basic Research, РФФИ: 97-03-33119a
Funding Text 1: The PMR spectra were recorded on a Bruker-AC 200P and Tesla BS-587 (80 MHz) in CDCI3, TMS internal standard. The IR spectra were recorded on a Specord IR-75 spectrometer in solutions of CHCI 3. The mass spectra were obtained on a Finnigan MAT-112 spectrometer with direct introduction of the substance in the ion source and ionization energy of 70 eV. The evolution of the reaction and purity of the compounds obtained were monitored by TLC on Silufol UV-254 plates with development with iodine vapors and UV light. N-3-Oxoalkylamides Ia-e were obtained by the methods in \[2, 3\]. 5,6-Dihydropyridine-2(1H)-thiones (IIa-e). A. Here 5 mmole of 1,3-oxoalkylthioacetamide la-e was added to 40 ml of a 6% solution of sodium ethylate in ethanol. The reaction mixture was stirred in an inert gas current until the starting compound disappeared (TLC monitoring), then neutralized with 10% HCI. The solvent was distilled off and the residue was extracted with benzene (2  20 ml). After distillation of the solvent, the compounds were purified by recrystallization. 5,6-Dihydropyridine-2(lll)-thiones (IIc, d-g). B. Here 4.6 mmole of 5,6-dihydropyridine-2(IH)one IIIa-d was dissolved in 30 ml of absolute toluene, and 1.00 g (4.5 mmole) of P2S5 was added by portions to the boiling solution. The reaction mixture was boiled until the starting compound disappeared (TLC monitoring), the hot solution was poured off the sediment, the solvent was distilled off, and the residue was purified by recrystallization. The research received financial support from the Russian Fund for Fundamental Research (Project Code 97-03-33119a).

Authors: Belyaev P.P., Polyakov S.V., Ermakova E.N., Isaev S.V.
Title: Experimental studies of the ionospheric Alfvén cavity using observations of electromagnetic noise background over the solar cycle of 1985 to 1995
Affiliations: Radiophysical Research Institute, Nizhny Novgorod, Russian Federation
Authors with affiliations: Belyaev, P.P., Radiophysical Research Institute, Nizhny Novgorod, Russian Federation; Polyakov, S.V., Radiophysical Research Institute, Nizhny Novgorod, Russian Federation; Ermakova, E.N., Radiophysical Research Institute, Nizhny Novgorod, Russian Federation; Isaev, S.V., Radiophysical Research Institute, Nizhny Novgorod, Russian Federation
Abstract: On the basis of many-year observations of the resonance structure of the spectrum (RSS) of the magnetic field in the frequency range 0.1 to 10 Hz over a 11-year solar cycle it has been concluded that resonance conditions for Alfvén waves inside the ionosphere (ionospheric Alfvén cavity IAC) are definitely controlled by the solar activity level. The RSS is observed segularly in the years of minimum solar activity and is practically absent in the years of maximum solar activity. This experimental fact is based on the analysis of observations carried out in the period of from 1985 to 1995. It is shown that allowance for the IAC permits a natural explanation of the dependence of the RSS on the solar activity. © 1998 Plenum Publishing Corporation.
Index Keywords: Ionosphere; Solar radiation; 11-year solar cycle; Electromagnetic noise; Frequency ranges; Resonance condition; Resonance structure; Solar activity; Solar activity level; Solar cycle; Solar energy

Authors: Samojlov V.S., Belyaev M.P., Popov A.Yu.
Title: Modern cutting tools for heavy and transport machine building
Affiliations: Moskovskij Kombinat Tverdykh Splavov, Moscow, Russian Federation
Authors with affiliations: Samojlov, V.S., Moskovskij Kombinat Tverdykh Splavov, Moscow, Russian Federation; Belyaev, M.P., Moskovskij Kombinat Tverdykh Splavov, Moscow, Russian Federation; Popov, A.Yu., Moskovskij Kombinat Tverdykh Splavov, Moscow, Russian Federation
Abstract: Modern cutting tools for lathes to process structural and special materials for power engineering are described. The cutting tools with mechanical fixing of replaceable non-turned-down hard alloy plates are designed. Plates of square, rhombic, round shapes and other shapes are created. Special technology for complexly alloyed hard materials covering with multilayer wear-resistant coating from TiN-TiCN-TiN system and TiN-TiCN-Al2O3 system is developed. Special shape allows to decrease the cutting force and wear. Cast rim is processed with tool with aluminium oxide coating, and cold-work hardened, high-alloy and stainless steels with titanium nitride coating.
Index Keywords: Aluminum compounds; Ceramic cutting tools; Cutting equipment; Special purpose machine tools; Titanium nitride; Casting processing; Hard alloy plates; Rotor processing; Cutting tools
Correspondence Address: Samojlov, V.S.; Moskovskij Kombinat Tverdykh Splavov, Moscow, Russian Federation

Authors: Resnyanskii E.D., Myshlyavtsev A.V., Elokhin V.I., Bal'zhinimaev B.S.
Title: Dissociative adsorption on rough surfaces with dynamically changing morphology: A Monte Carlo model
Affiliations: Boreskov Institute of Catalysis, pr. Lavrentieva 5, 630090 Novosibirsk, Russian Federation; Tuvinian Interdisc. Institute, Internalsional'naya str. 117a, 667007 Kysyl, Russian Federation
Authors with affiliations: Resnyanskii, E.D., Boreskov Institute of Catalysis, pr. Lavrentieva 5, 630090 Novosibirsk, Russian Federation; Myshlyavtsev, A.V., Tuvinian Interdisc. Institute, Internalsional'naya str. 117a, 667007 Kysyl, Russian Federation; Elokhin, V.I., Boreskov Institute of Catalysis, pr. Lavrentieva 5, 630090 Novosibirsk, Russian Federation; Bal'zhinimaev, B.S., Boreskov Institute of Catalysis, pr. Lavrentieva 5, 630090 Novosibirsk, Russian Federation
Abstract: A computer model based on the Monte Carlo technique for bimolecular dissociative adsorption on a rough surface with dynamically changing morphology is investigated. The model takes into account the mutual influence of adsorbed particles and substrate atoms. The common regularities of dissociative adsorption on the rough mobile surface in comparison with the Langmuir isotherm are revealed. Particularly, at low temperatures and when the attraction between adsorbate and substrate is strong, metastable states with long lifetimes arise, in contrast to the case of monomolecular adsorption.

Authors: Myshlyavtsev A.V., Dongak M.D.
Title: Statistics of adsorption on top and bridge sites of a square lattice: Transfer-matrix approach
Affiliations: Tuvinian Interdisciplinary Institute, Siberian Br. of Russ. Acad. of Sci., Kyzyl, 667007, Tuva, Russian Federation
Authors with affiliations: Myshlyavtsev, A.V., Tuvinian Interdisciplinary Institute, Siberian Br. of Russ. Acad. of Sci., Kyzyl, 667007, Tuva, Russian Federation; Dongak, M.D., Tuvinian Interdisciplinary Institute, Siberian Br. of Russ. Acad. of Sci., Kyzyl, 667007, Tuva, Russian Federation
Abstract: Statistics of particles adsorbed on the lattice with a complex elementary cell are analyzed by employing the transfer-matrix technique. The results obtained are compared with those given by the cluster approximation and also with the experimental data for the CO/Ni(100) system. The transfer-matrix technique is shown to be very effective for studies of two-dimensional systems with complex lattices.

Authors: Belskaya O.B.
Title: Specific properties of dehydrogenation centers in supported platinum catalysts
Affiliations: Federal Scientific Center, Boreskov Institute of Catalysis, Omsk Department, Omsk 644040, Russian Federation
Authors with affiliations: Belskaya, O.B., Federal Scientific Center, Boreskov Institute of Catalysis, Omsk Department, Omsk 644040, Russian Federation
Abstract: Cyclohexane dehydrogenation was used as a model reaction to study the dehydrogenation function of Pt/Al2O3 catalysts. Fresh and coked catalysts were tested in two ranges of reaction conditions: model conditions (T=280-340°C, P=1 atm) and the conditions used in the naphtha reforming process (7=420-460 °C, P=15 atm). Intrinsic properties of the dehydrogenation active centers were found to be identical throughout the experimental conditions. The coke deposits only block a part of the active centers without their qualitative modification.

Abstract: A problem of dependence of etching depth on the etching rate, time and inhibitor concentration is considered as applied to manufacturing the printing forms. The Mg-Ce-Zr alloys are subjected to etching in 0.7M nitric acid solution with a different content of inhibiting phosphate additives under controllable hydrodynamic conditions at 3-50°C. Abstract: A computer model based on the Monte Carlo method for monomolecular adsorption on a dynamically changing surface is investigated. The model takes into account the mutual influence of adsorbed layer and surface morphology. Title: Surface diffusion and anisotropic lateral interactions
Affiliations: Institute of Catalysis, Novosibirsk 630090, Russian Federation; Department of Applied Physics, Chalmers University of Technology, S-412 96 Göteborg, Sweden; Interface Science Western, Department of Physics and Chemistry, University of Western Ontario, London, Ont. N6A 3K7, Canada

Abstract: Anisotropic lateral interactions between particles on a rectangular lattice result in anisotropy in the coverage dependence of the chemical diffusion coefficient. This effect is studied in the framework of the lattice-gas model taking into account repulsive lateral interactions in the ground state and also lateral interactions in the activated state. To calculate the diffusion coefficient, the transfer-matrix technique is employed.

Title: Enhancement of VLF-ducts under the action of high power radio wave on the ionospheric F-region
Affiliations: Institute of Terrestrial Magnetism, Ionosphere and Radio Wave Propagation (IZMIRAN), Troitsk, Moscow Region 142092, Russia; Radiophysical Research Institute (NIRFI), B. Pecherskaya 25/14, Nizhniy Novgorod, 603600, Russian Federation

Abstract: Wave effects are discussed pointing to improvement of whistler propagation in the ionosphere illuminated by a powerful radio wave. The large scale irregularities (ducts) responsible for these effects are formed in the illuminated ionospheric region by the process of electron heating by the fields of the pump wave and excited plasma oscillations. These irregularities may also be created in the ionosphere and plasmasphere by fluxes of suprathermal electrons accelerated by the plasma turbulence in the reflection region of the pump wave. © 1995.

Authors: Khomchenko V.G.
Title: Synthesis of kinematic crack-and-rocker mechanisms in terms of the rocker swing angle and the cyclogram asymmetry angle
Authors with affiliations: Khomchenko, V.G.
Abstract: Possible ranges of kinematic parameters have been estimated for crack-and-rocker mechanisms. Simple methods of synthesis correlated for a permissible transmission angle. Formulae are derived to evaluate a relative intercentral distance and the mechanism rocker length as a function of the final set of kinematic schemes. Parameters and set of kinematic schemes are finally chosen from additional conditions.

Authors: Myshlyavtsev A.V., Stepanov A.A., Uebing C., Zhdanov V.P.
Title: Surface diffusion and continuous phase transitions in adsorbed overlayers
Affiliations: Tuvinian Department, Siberian Branch, Russian Academy of Sciences, Kyzyl 667000, Russian Federation; Max-Planck-Institut für Eisenforschung, Postfach 140444, 40074 Düsseldorf, Germany; Institute of Catalysis, Novosibirsk 630090, Russian Federation; Interface Science Western, University of Western Ontario, London, Ont. N6A 3K7, Canada
Authors with affiliations: Myshlyavtsev, A.V., Tuvinian Department, Siberian Branch, Russian Academy of Sciences, Kyzyl 667000, Russian Federation; Stepanov, A.A., Tuvinian Department, Siberian Branch, Russian Academy of Sciences, Kyzyl 667000, Russian Federation; Uebing, C., Max-Planck-Institut für Eisenforschung, Postfach 140444, 40074 Düsseldorf, Germany; Zhdanov, V.P., Institute of Catalysis, Novosibirsk 630090, Russian Federation, Interface Science Western, University of Western Ontario, London, Ont. N6A 3K7, Canada
Abstract: Singularities in the coverage dependence of the chemical diffusion coefficient near the critical points corresponding to transitions from one phase to another are studied by employing two different lattice-gas models. (i) For the hard hexagon model, the chemical diffusion coefficient is shown to be exactly equal to zero at the critical coverage and its behavior near this point is in agreement with the predictions of the scaling theory provided that one takes into account the Fisher renormalization of the specific-heat exponent. (ii) For a square lattice with repulsive interactions between nearest-neighbor particles, the detailed transfer-matrix and Monte Carlo data indicate that the chemical diffusion coefficient has a minimum at critical coverages and its value at these points decreases with increasing lattice size (there is even evidence that D→0 at L→). © 1995 The American Physical Society.

Authors: Belyi A.S., Kiryanov D.I., Smolikov M.D., Zatolokina E.V., Udras I.E., Duplyakin V.K.
Title: O2-adsorption and (O2-H2)-titration on electron deficient platinum in reforming catalysts
Affiliations: Omsk Department of Boreskov Institute of Catalysis RAS, Omsk, 644040, Russian Federation
Authors with affiliations: Belyi, A.S., Omsk Department of Boreskov Institute of Catalysis RAS, Omsk, 644040, Russian Federation; Kiryanov, D.I., Omsk Department of Boreskov Institute of Catalysis RAS, Omsk, 644040, Russian Federation; Smolikov, M.D., Omsk Department of Boreskov Institute of Catalysis RAS, Omsk, 644040, Russian Federation; Zatolokina, E.V., Omsk Department of Boreskov Institute of Catalysis RAS, Omsk, 644040, Russian Federation; Udras, I.E., Omsk Department of Boreskov Institute of Catalysis RAS, Omsk, 644040, Russian Federation; Duplyakin, V.K., Omsk Department of Boreskov Institute of Catalysis RAS, Omsk, 644040, Russian Federation
Abstract: Behavior of supported Pt in O2 chemisorption and (O2-H2) titration has been studied. In Pt/SiO2, Pt/α-Al2O3 and Pt/γ-Al2O3 Pto catalysts are characterized by the following stoichiometric coefficients of oxygen adsorption (X), hydrogen adsorption (Y) and oxygen-hydrogen titration (Z) X:Y:Z=1:1:1.5. The co-efficients differ for Pt-Cl/γ-Al2O3 reforming catalysts. This is explained by the presence of electron deficient platium (Ptσ) with a coefficient ratio of X:Y:Z=0.5:2:1.5. © 1994 Akadémiai Kiadó.

Authors: Goryunov V.N., Til' V.E., Serkova L.E.
Title: Finite-element models of linear motors with permanent magnets
Authors with affiliations: Goryunov, V.N.; Til', V.E.; Serkova, L.E.
Abstract: Mathematical models of linear electric motors, based on the finite element method, have been presented. In calculating magnetic fields of unipolar electromechanical devices with high-coercitivity permanent magnets (PM), certain assumptions have been made. In particular, PM magnetic permeability is the same in all directions and equals magnetic permeability of air. Linear motors with symmetric magnetic systems have proved their superiority over those with asymmetric systems. Linear motors with asymmetric magnetic systems give way to motors symmetric systems as superior in pulsation levels and resulting effort values.
Index Keywords: Electric excitation; Linear motors; Magnetic fields; Magnets; Mathematical models; Vectors; Brushless motors; Linear induction motors; Electric motors
Correspondence Address: Goryunov, V.N.

Authors: Zhilin N.S., Maystrenko V.A., Niconov A.V., Sayfoutdinov K.R.
Title: VHF phase and frequency synthesizers based on pLL principle
Source title: IEEE International Symposium on Personal, Indoor and Mobile Radio Communications, PIMRC
Affiliations: Omsk State Engineering University, Russian Federation
Authors with affiliations: Zhilin, N.S., Omsk State Engineering University, Russian Federation; Maystrenko, V.A., Omsk State Engineering University, Russian Federation; Niconov, A.V., Omsk State Engineering University, Russian Federation; Sayfoutdinov, K.R., Omsk State Engineering University, Russian Federation
Abstract: Design of VHF phase and frequency synthesizers using phase lock loops are suggested intended for communication units and systems. Experimental models of phase synthesizers had been developed with low value of phase step at fixed frequencies and errors 0.02O (not more). A low noise frequency synthesizer had been developed with frequency switching time of 10 mks, providing the frequency spacing of 0.1 MHz over the range 0.4 .2 GHz Phase synthesizers can also be designed performing the phase modulation according to a complex law by means of a sequencing program. Maximal frequency of the phase modulation is ilhout 250 kHz. © IEEE
Index Keywords: Frequency synthesizers; Phase modulation; Experimental models; Fixed frequency; Frequency spacing; Frequency switching; Phase lock loop (PLL); Phase steps; Radio communication

Authors: Maistrenko V.A.
Title: Parametric optimization of phase-lock loop systems with frequency conversion
Source title: Telecommunications and Radio Engineering (English translation of Elektrosvyaz and Radiotekhnika)
Authors with affiliations: Maistrenko, V.A.
Abstract: The practical development of radio devices using phase-lock loops with frequency conversion is linked to the solution of the problem of minimizing the locking error and the transient time while ensuring operating reliability and essential economies. In view of the contradiction between these requirements the optimum value of the parameters of a PLL system depends on the chosen criterion of optimality, defined by the purpose the PLL system is designed to serve in the radio system. In general, the problem of finding the optimal values of the parameters of the PLL system reduces to solving multicriterial optimization problems [1, 2], and in special cases of finding the extremum of a certain functional with respect to one parameter when there are limitations on the other system parameters. Below we consider the results of a parametric optimization of continuous PLL systems with respect to secondary beats and pulse PLL systems for 'phase-code' radio-pulse converters, phase and amplitude signal generator-calibrators in the UHF band, generator-calibrators of time intervals, and subsystems for synchronizing automatic control systems [3-5, 7].
Index Keywords: Control systems; Errors; Estimation; Frequency converters; Optimization; Radio equipment; Radio systems; Reliability; Synchronization; Automatic control systems; Frequency conversion; Locking error; Phase errors; Phase-lock loop systems; Transient time; Phase locked loops
Correspondence Address: Maistrenko, V.A.
Publisher: Scripta Technica Inc, New York, NY, United States

Authors: Nikonov A.V., Subbotin L.S.
Title: A precision measurement strobe converter
Authors with affiliations: Nikonov, A.V.; Subbotin, L.S.
Abstract: The basis of a method of correcting the structure of a precision measurement strobe converter with feedback, in which, to minimize the total conversion error, the parameters of the strobe pulses are adjusted, is presented. The converter is designed to transform the time scale of wide-band periodic signals, about the frequency and amplitude of which preliminary data are available. In the absence of a priori data, measurement of the signal parameters is performed in stages. © 1994 Plenum Publishing Corporation.

Authors: Myshlyavtsev A.V., Zhdanov V.P.
Title: Surface diffusion and anisotropic lateral interactions
Affiliations: Institute of Catalysis, Novosibirsk, 630090, Russian Federation; Department of Applied Physics, Chalmers University of Technology, S-412 96 Göteborg, Sweden
Authors with affiliations: Myshlyavtsev, A.V., Institute of Catalysis, Novosibirsk, 630090, Russian Federation; Zhdanov, V.P., Institute of Catalysis, Novosibirsk, 630090, Russian Federation, Department of Applied Physics, Chalmers University of Technology, S-412 96 Göteborg, Sweden
Abstract: Anisotropic lateral interactions between particles on a rectangular lattice are shown to result in anisotropy in the coverage dependence of the chemical diffusion coefficient. As an example, diffusion of Au and Pt atoms on the (110) surface of these metals is analyzed in detail. © 1993.

Abstract: A lattice-gas model with anisotropic lateral interactions is used to describe formation of the missing-row structure of the clean Pt(110) surface and destruction of this structure during CO adsorption at coverages above a quarter of a monolayer, and to interpret the special features of thermal desorption spectra of the CO/Pt(110) system. © 1993, American Chemical Society. Authors: Nikonov A.V., Nikonova G.V.
Title: Frequency synthesizer for automated control systems of the ultrahigh frequency range
Affiliations: Politekhnicheskij Inst, Omsk, Russian Federation
Authors with affiliations: Nikonov, A.V., Politekhnicheskij Inst, Omsk, Russian Federation; Nikonova, G.V., Politekhnicheskij Inst, Omsk, Russian Federation
Abstract: A frequency synthesizer for the 64-1024 MHz range has been described. The output signal of the synthesizer has levels of gallium arsenide integral circuits (low from -0.2 up to +1.5 v) and a root-mean-square deviation of time noise up to 7 ps at a frequency of 1 GHz. The synthesizer may be used as a carrier of the phase shift angle for a system with tact frequencies from hundred kHz to several dozens of MHz. For this purpose division coefficient for a counter in the divider of the signal frequency in a fine-adjusted generator should be varied and a corresponding multiplexer should be installed.
Index Keywords: Frequency dividing circuits; Frequency synthesizers; Integrating circuits; Logic circuits; Phase measurement; Pulse generators; Pulse shaping circuits; Schematic diagrams; Synchronization; Timing circuits; Tuning; Integrated circuits
Correspondence Address: Nikonov, A.V.; Politekhnicheskij Inst, Omsk, Russian Federation

Authors: Goryunov V.N., Kozlov V.N., Serkova L.E., Til' V.Eh.
Title: A finite element model of magnetic systems for multipole disc electromechanical devices with permanent magnets
Authors with affiliations: Goryunov, V.N.; Kozlov, V.N.; Serkova, L.E.; Til', V.Eh.
Abstract: A method to calculate the three - dimensional spatial - periodic fields of multipolar disc devices of electromechanics (EM), has been presented. Its use has been illustrated by an example of no-contact tachogenerators with electron switching of windings. It is pointed out that allowance for the spatial-periodic structure of a field gives larger economic efficiency in using computer resources as compared to methods of solving directly a three - dimensional problem. The representation of the solution of a field problem as Fourier series relieves of the further harmonic analysis of the results. This analysis is necessary in studying the integral characteristics of EM. The method and the programme based on it are recommended to be used in engineer design practice.
Index Keywords: Electromechanical devices; Finite element method; Magnetic circuits; Magnets; Magnetic thick films
Correspondence Address: Goryunov, V.N.

Authors: Myshlyavtsev A.V., Yablonskii G.S.
Title: Effect of four-particle lateral interactions on thermodesorption centres: Application to the N2/Ir(110) system
Source title: Physics, chemistry and mechanics of surfaces
Affiliations: Tublinsk Komplex Otd. Akad.
Authors with affiliations: Myshlyavtsev, A.V., Tublinsk Komplex Otd. Akad.; Yablonskii, G.S., Tublinsk Komplex Otd. Akad.
Abstract: The effect of four-particle lateral interactions on the thermal desorption spectra of monomolecular adsorption is investigated by the transfer matrix method. By taking N2/Ir(110) as the example, it is shown that, in a number of cases, it is necessary to take account of four-particle interactions for the interpretation of the experimental data. The high efficiency of the transfer matrix method for the calculation of thermal desorption spectra is demonstrated.
Index Keywords: Chemisorption; Iridium; Mathematical models; Matrix algebra; Molecules; Nitrogen; Numerical methods; Thermal effects; Transfer functions; Four particle lateral interactions; Thermodesorption spectroscopy; Transfer matrix method; Desorption
Correspondence Address: Myshlyavtsev, A.V.; Tublinsk Komplex Otd. Akad.

Authors: Kalinin A.P., Makeev S.A., Tyshenina R.S.
Title: UV-irradiation of the blood in the treatment of polycystic ovary syndrome [UF-obluchenie krovi v lechenii sindroma polikistoznykh iaichnikov.]
Authors with affiliations: Kalinin, A.P.; Makeev, S.A.; Tyshenina, R.S.
Abstract: Effect of extracorporeal UV irradiation of the blood on the clinical picture and hormonal profile of patients with the polycystic ovaries syndrome was under study. 119 women were administered 582 sessions, and in 54 of these the results were followed up for 1-25 months. A good clinical effect was achieved in 88.9% of these cases, it consisted in recovery of the cycle rhythm (70.7%), pregnancy (29.2%), reduction of hirsutism manifestations (19.04%), decrease of galactorrhea (41.7%), cessation or alleviation of headaches (86.2%), body mass reduction (40%), arterial pressure normalization (43.8%). Well-being of the majority of women was improved by therapy. 17-ketosteroids excretion normalized and persisted normal in a month after the treatment. Blood LH level and the LH/FSH ratio significantly reduced in those in whom these values were elevated in disease. Elimination of hyperandrogenism and a trend to normalization of gonadotropin secretion, resulting from extracorporeal UV irradiation of the blood, indicate that such treatment modality is pathogenetically grounded and justify its use in the treatment of women with the polycystic ovaries syndrome.
Index Keywords: 17 Ketosteroids; 17 oxosteroid; follitropin; luteinizing hormone; article; blood; female; follow up; human; ovary polycystic disease; phototherapy; 17-Ketosteroids; English Abstract; Female; Follicle Stimulating Hormone; Follow-Up Studies; Human; Luteinizing Hormone; Polycystic Ovary Syndrome; Ultraviolet Therapy
Chemicals/CAS: follitropin, 9002-68-0; luteinizing hormone, 39341-83-8, 9002-67-9; 17-Ketosteroids; Follicle Stimulating Hormone, 9002-68-0; Luteinizing Hormone, 9002-67-9
Correspondence Address: Kalinin, A.P.

Authors: Kovalev Yu.Z., Nenishev A.S., Khamitov R.N., Myznikov M.O.
Title: The influence of the electrohydrodynamic transformer power conditions on its operating efficiency
Affiliations: Omskij Politekhnicheski Inst, Omsk, Russian Federation
Authors with affiliations: Kovalev, Yu.Z., Omskij Politekhnicheski Inst, Omsk, Russian Federation; Nenishev, A.S., Omskij Politekhnicheski Inst, Omsk, Russian Federation; Khamitov, R.N., Omskij Politekhnicheski Inst, Omsk, Russian Federation; Myznikov, M.O., Omskij Politekhnicheski Inst, Omsk, Russian Federation
Abstract: The results of the experimental investigation of the influence of impulse supply voltage on the work efficiency of the electrohydrodynamic (EHD) transformer are presented. It is shown, that the supply of EHD-transformer by means of the unipolar impulse rectangular voltage is most energetically advantageous. As it revealed by the experiment, that the constant compositioning of the voltage or the level of the voltage displacement penalizes the power efficiency of the energy transformation process. The optimal value of the displacement level is within the range 2-3 kV. It was concluded that it is necessary to create the definite amplitude versus time response characteristics of the supply voltage for the work of the specific EHD-transformer. For the solving of this task it is necessary to realize the agreement of the high voltage source and the specific EHD-transformer on the development stage of the joint system the voltage source - the EHD-transformer.
Index Keywords: Efficiency; Electrohydrodynamics; Productivity; Pulse circuits; Pulse modulation; Voltage control; Electrohydrodynamic transformer; Impulse supply voltage; Pulse transformers
Correspondence Address: Kovalev, Yu.Z.; Omskij Politekhnicheski Inst, Omsk, Russian Federation

Authors with affiliations: Filimonova, S.V., Institute of Catalysis, Siberian Branch of Russian Academy of Sciences, Novosibirsk, 630090, Russian Federation; Mastikhin, V.M., Institute of Catalysis, Siberian Branch of Russian Academy of Sciences, Novosibirsk, 630090, Russian Federation; Smolikov, M.D., Institute of Catalysis, Siberian Branch of Russian Academy of Sciences, Novosibirsk, 630090, Russian Federation; Belyi, S.S., Institute of Catalysis, Siberian Branch of Russian Academy of Sciences, Novosibirsk, 630090, Russian Federation; Duplyakin, V.K., Institute of Catalysis, Siberian Branch of Russian Academy of Sciences, Novosibirsk, 630090, Russian Federation
Abstract: 129Xe nuclear magnetic resonance spectra of xenon adsorbed on supported platinum-alumina catalysts have been examined. Authors: Makeev S.A., Odinokova V.A., Belous G.G.
Title: Characteristics of morphological changes in ovary wounds after the use of steel and plastic scalpels [Osobennosti morfologicheskikh izmeneniǐ ran iaichnikov pri ispol'zovanii stal'nogo i plazmennogo skal'pelia.]
Authors with affiliations: Makeev, S.A.; Odinokova, V.A.; Belous, G.G.
Abstract: A comparative study of steel and plasma scalpel use in ovary operations is carried out in an experiment. 25 fertile female rabbits were operated on, in each one ovary was dissected by a steel scalpel, the other--by a plasma one. Sampling was performed on the 3-d, 7, 14, 21, 28-30-th day. At the relaparotomy of appendages operated on with the help of plasma scalpel, commissuring process was less prominent. Histological picture analysis has also shown plasma scalpel advantages--smaller tissue injuries, speeding up of wound healing process, drop in inflammatory reaction in response to influence.
Index Keywords: plastic; steel; animal; article; comparative study; female; laparotomy; ovary; rabbit; reoperation; surgical instrument; wound healing; Animal; Comparative Study; English Abstract; Female; Laparotomy; Ovary; Plastics; Rabbits; Reoperation; Steel; Surgical Instruments; Wound Healing

Authors: Kovalev Yu.Z., Goryunov V.N., Khod'ko D.G.
Title: Calculation of the three-dimensional magnetic field in electrical machines having rare-earth magnets
Affiliations: Omskij Politekhnicheskij Inst, Omsk, Russian Federation
Authors with affiliations: Kovalev, Yu.Z., Omskij Politekhnicheskij Inst, Omsk, Russian Federation; Goryunov, V.N., Omskij Politekhnicheskij Inst, Omsk, Russian Federation; Khod'ko, D.G., Omskij Politekhnicheskij Inst, Omsk, Russian Federation
Abstract: Three-dimensional magnetic fields in electric machines (EM) having permanent magnets (PM) are usually being calculated by finite elements method (FEM). For the solution of two-dimensional differential equations a combination of methods has been suggested. This combination includes the known Grinberg method and FEM. The following assumptions have been made: the armature response and the influence of currents in stator windings are neglected, ferromagnetic sections of a magnetic circuit are considered non-saturated, demagnetization curve for a PM is linear and the medium for a PM is considered to be one-axis-anisotropic by demagnetization and isotopic by magnetic permeability. The calculated band for a EM and the chart of a magnetic circuit are shown in a figure. The described approach is illustrated by results of calculations (shown in a figure) of the induction vector component in the air gap of a magnetic system of the end type.
Index Keywords: Computer Programming Languages - FORTRAN; Magnetic Fields; Rare Earth Elements; Electric Machinery
Correspondence Address: Kovalev, Yu.Z.; Omskij Politekhnicheskij Inst, Omsk, Russian Federation

Authors: Vdovina T.N., Belyi A.S., Smolikov M.D., Duplyakin V.K.
Title: Distribution of active component among pores of different sizes in structure of oxide supports. V. Distribution of molybdenum sulfide in pore structure of γ-Al2O3
Affiliations: Inst of Catalysis Acad of Sciences, of the USSR, Russian Federation
Authors with affiliations: Vdovina, T.N., Inst of Catalysis Acad of Sciences, of the USSR, Russian Federation; Belyi, A.S., Inst of Catalysis Acad of Sciences, of the USSR, Russian Federation; Smolikov, M.D., Inst of Catalysis Acad of Sciences, of the USSR, Russian Federation; Duplyakin, V.K., Inst of Catalysis Acad of Sciences, of the USSR, Russian Federation
Abstract: Procedures based on the adsorption of oxygen and capillary condensation of water have been used in a study of the distribution of molybdenum sulfide in the pore structure of γ-Al2O3 (microdistribution). It has been established by means of preadsorption of water molecules that, depending on the molybdenum concentration, the catalysts contain either one type of centers for the chemisorption of oxygen (catalysts with ≤4% Mo) or two types of centers (>4% Mo). The major part of the surface of the molybdenum sulfide (approximately 80%) is localized in the mesopores. Differences in the chemisorption of oxygen on MoS2/SiO2 and MoS2/γ-Al2O3 are examined critically.

Authors: Lutsevich L.V., Elokhin V.I., Myshlyavtsev A.V., Usov A.G., Yablonskii G.S.
Title: Monte Carlo modeling of a simple catalytic reaction mechanism: Comparison with langmuir kinetics
Affiliations: Computer Center Sib. Br. Acad. Sci. USSR, Nouosibirsk, USSR; Institute of Catalysis Sib. Br. Acad. Sci. USSR, pr. acad. Lavrentieva 5, Nouosibirsk, 630090, USSR; Touvinian Complex Department, Kyzyl, USSR
Authors with affiliations: Lutsevich, L.V., Computer Center Sib. Br. Acad. Sci. USSR, Nouosibirsk, USSR; Elokhin, V.I., Institute of Catalysis Sib. Br. Acad. Sci. USSR, pr. acad. Lavrentieva 5, Nouosibirsk, 630090, USSR; Myshlyavtsev, A.V., Touvinian Complex Department, Kyzyl, USSR; Usov, A.G., Computer Center Sib. Br. Acad. Sci. USSR, Nouosibirsk, USSR; Yablonskii, G.S., Touvinian Complex Department, Kyzyl, USSR
Abstract: Using a Monte Carlo simulation technique, we have investigated the model of a simple catalytic reaction (the Langmuir-Hinshelwood mechanism) A + Z → k1 AZ, B2 + 2Z → k2 BZAZ +BZ → k3 AB + 2Z, k3 → ∞, under varying intensities of surface diffusion. Having compared the results of the MC simulation with those obtained previously in the model based on the kinetic equations (formulated under the assumption of ideal adsorbed layer, the IAL model), we found the conditions under which both models give identical results. The difference between the results obtained with the IAL and those obtained with the MC model is associated with clustering of the adsorbed substances on the surface. © 1991.

Authors: Smirnova I.E., Belyi A.S., Smolikov M.D., Duplyakin V.K.
Title: Distribution of the active component over pores of different size in the structure of oxide supports. IV. The effect of impregnation conditions on the platinum distribution in the porous structure of alumina
Affiliations: Acad of Sciences of the USSR, Russian Federation
Authors with affiliations: Smirnova, I.E., Acad of Sciences of the USSR, Russian Federation; Belyi, A.S., Acad of Sciences of the USSR, Russian Federation; Smolikov, M.D., Acad of Sciences of the USSR, Russian Federation; Duplyakin, V.K., Acad of Sciences of the USSR, Russian Federation
Abstract: A study was carried out on the nature and amount of the competitor in the joint adsorption with H2PtCl6 on the nature of the distribution of the platinum particles over pores of different size (microdistribution) in the reduced form of Pt/γ-Al2O3 reforming catalysts. Upon the adsorption of H2PtCl6 on γ-Al2O3 in the absence of competition, the metal is concentrated predominantly in large pores with R > 10 nm. The introduction of hydrochloric acid into the impregnation solution leads to levelling of the surface concentration of platinum in the meso pores and increases the amount of metal in the fine pores with R < 4 nm. The adsorption of platinum in the presence of oxalic acid leads to localization of the active component in a narrow range of pore size dependent on the amount of the competitor taken.
Index Keywords: Alumina - Impregnation; Catalysis - Reforming; Impregnation Condition; Microdistribution; Oxide Support Structure; Platinum Distribution; Catalysts

Authors: Borodin A.V., Makeev S.A., Sokolovskii Z.N.
Title: Determining dynamic loads in a crank-slide mechanism with a flexible connecting rod
Authors with affiliations: Borodin, A.V.; Makeev, S.A.; Sokolovskii, Z.N.
Abstract: The goal of this study is to develop a method for calculating the stress in the flexible connecting rod in terms of the inertial force of the ring and to develop a method for approximating the static and dynamic components of the stress. The experimental determination of the normal stresses in the edge sections of the flexible rod was carried out by strain measurements of the stand which imitates the loading conditions of a flexible connecting rod in a piston machine. The precise calculation method proposed in this study for the analysis of the stresses in a flexible connecting rod take into consideration the inertial forces of the connecting rod ring. The application of this method will decrease the volume of work at the design stage of a crank-slide mechanism (CSM).

Authors: Myshlyavtsev A.V., Sales J.L., Zgrablich G., Zhdanov V.P.
Title: The effect of three-body interactions on thermal desorption spectra
Affiliations: Institute of Catalysis, Novosibirsk, 630090, Russia; Instituto de Investigaciones en Technologia Quimica, San Luis, 5700, Argentina
Authors with affiliations: Myshlyavtsev, A.V., Institute of Catalysis, Novosibirsk, 630090, Russia; Sales, J.L., Instituto de Investigaciones en Technologia Quimica, San Luis, 5700, Argentina; Zgrablich, G., Instituto de Investigaciones en Technologia Quimica, San Luis, 5700, Argentina; Zhdanov, V.P., Institute of Catalysis, Novosibirsk, 630090, Russia
Abstract: Thermal desorption spectra are calculated for a one-dimensional chain and for a two-dimensional square lattice using the transfer-matrix technique and Monte Carlo simulations. Lateral interactions of adsorbed particles cause a splitting of spectra. The repulsive three-body interactions are shown to lead to an inequality of the integral intensities of the thermal desorption peaks. © 1990 Plenum Publishing Corporation.

Authors: Belyaev P.P., Polyakov S.V., Rapoport V.O., Trakhtengerts V.Y.
Title: The ionospheric Alfv/'en resonator
Source title: Journal of Atmospheric and Terrestrial Physics
Affiliations: Radiophysical Research Institute, Gorky, Russian Federation; Institute of Applied Physics, Academy of Sciences, the U.S.S.R., 46 Uljanov Street, 603600 Gorky, Russian Federation
Authors with affiliations: Belyaev, P.P., Radiophysical Research Institute, Gorky, Russian Federation; Polyakov, S.V., Radiophysical Research Institute, Gorky, Russian Federation; Rapoport, V.O., Radiophysical Research Institute, Gorky, Russian Federation; Trakhtengerts, V.Y., Institute of Applied Physics, Academy of Sciences, the U.S.S.R., 46 Uljanov Street, 603600 Gorky, Russian Federation
Abstract: The ionospheric Alfvén resonator (IAR) associated with peculiarities of the plasma distribution in the F-region ionosphere affects significantly the spectral form of electromagnetic noise registered on the Earth's surface and by satellites. The eigenfrequencies of the IAR are in the range from 0.1 to 10 Hz, and the Q-factor is ~ 10. This is proved experimentally by the spectral resonance structure (SRS), excited by lightning, which manifests itself as pronounced minima and maxima in the averaged spectral intensity of atmospheric background noise of a few hertz. A theory for the SRS is constructed which explains the main experimental facts. New ground-based diagnostics of the electron density profile above the F-layer maximum derived from SRS data are discussed. © 1990.

Authors: Myshlyavtsev A.V., Zhdanov V.P.
Title: The effect of adsorbate-induced surface reconstruction on the apparent Arrhenlus parameters for desorption
Affiliations: Institute of Catalysis, Novosibirsk 630090, Russian Federation
Authors with affiliations: Myshlyavtsev, A.V., Institute of Catalysis, Novosibirsk 630090, Russian Federation; Zhdanov, V.P., Institute of Catalysis, Novosibirsk 630090, Russian Federation
Abstract: The effect of adsorbate-induced surface reconstruction on the apparent preexponential factor and activation energy for desorption is analyzed and discussed. The reconstruction is assumed to be a continuous order-disorder phase transition. The adsorbate-induced changes in the surface are shown to result in a rather strong (of the order of 102) coverage dependence of the preexponential factor for desorption. The direction of the variation is in accordance with the compensation effect (the preexponential factor and the activation energy decrease with increasing coverage). © 1990 American Institute of Physics.

Authors: Popov P.K., Shtripling L.O.
Title: Calculation of the errors in the angular position of the output shaft of a drive with harmonic gear transmission
Authors with affiliations: Popov, P.K.; Shtripling, L.O.
Abstract: The errors, of manufacture and assembly of elements of a harmonic gear transmission (HGT) lead to transverse vibrations during operation. This gives rise to high-frequency vibrations of the output shaft at frequencies which are multiples of the speed of rotation of the wave generator, and to vibrations at a frequency twice this speed of rotation relative to the constant and uniform rotation, with the dynamic kinematic error θ″(ω-j$/t). Therefore from the side of the output shaft of the transmission unit the drive will be subjected to the action of a kinematic disturbance connected with the HGT, and this gives rise to load vibrations even in the absence of an external source of disturbances. A calculation method is proposed, based on experimental results, for determination of the maximum allowable error in the angular position of the output shaft of a drive.
Index Keywords: Gears--Reliability; Power Transmission--Vibrations; Critical Speeds; Effector Axis; Output Shaft; Permissible Errors; Shafts and Shafting
Correspondence Address: Popov, P.K.

Source title: Radioelectronics and Communications Systems (English translation of Izvestiya Vysshikh Uchebnykh Zavedenii Radioelektronika)

Abstract: A method of setting the cutoff angle is proposed, which enables the resolving power of the equipment to be increased, on the basis of which an automatic generator with precision control of the harmonic coefficient is designed. Methods of increasing the accuracy of the equipment are investigated, and a generator circuit with microprocessor correction of the components of the error is presented.

Authors: Bogomolova O.B., Ostrovskii N.M., Smolikov M.D., Belyi A.S., Duplyakin V.K.
Title: Contribution of electron-deficient platinum to benzene hydrogenation and its activation by water
Affiliations: Department of Institute of Catalysis, Omsk, 644029, Russia
Authors with affiliations: Bogomolova, O.B., Department of Institute of Catalysis, Omsk, 644029, Russia; Ostrovskii, N.M., Department of Institute of Catalysis, Omsk, 644029, Russia; Smolikov, M.D., Department of Institute of Catalysis, Omsk, 644029, Russia; Belyi, A.S., Department of Institute of Catalysis, Omsk, 644029, Russia; Duplyakin, V.K., Department of Institute of Catalysis, Omsk, 644029, Russia
Abstract: The activity of metallic (Pto) and electron-deficient (Ptσ) platinum in Pt/Al2O3 catalysts has been studied in the low temperature hydrogenation of benzene. Authors: Perepelkin K.E., Ivantsova T.M., Serkov A.T., Egorova R.V.
Title: Defect content and nonuniformity in mechanical properties of polyacrylonitrile fibres
Authors with affiliations: Perepelkin, K.E.; Ivantsova, T.M.; Serkov, A.T.; Egorova, R.V.
Abstract: Defect content and nonuniformity in mechanical properties of polyacrylonitrile fibres have been investigated in the cross section of tow and over the length of individual elementary fibres. For a generalized evaluation of defectiveness and nonuniformity in mechanical properties we have used the scale dependence of strength and histograms for strength distribution. Scale coefficients for the strength of polyacrylonitrile fibres have been determined. For rapid characterization of defectivity and nonuniformity of mechanical properties of fibres one can use the ratio of the mean strengths at two clamped lengths which differ significantly (by an order of magnitude or so). © 1989 Plenum Publishing Corporation.
Index Keywords: Materials Testing; Strength of Materials; Textile Fibers - Spinning; Yarn - Synthetic; Fiber Defect Content; Fiber Nonuniformity; Polyacrylonitrile Fibers; Strength Distribution; Strength Histograms; Tow Breaking Load; Polyacrylonitriles

Authors: Shcherba V.E., Bolshtyanskii A.P., Ivashnev E.A., Shubaev V.E.
Title: Calculation of the compression process in a general-purpose piston-drive compressor.
Authors with affiliations: Shcherba, V.E.; Bolshtyanskii, A.P.; Ivashnev, E.A.; Shubaev, V.E.
Abstract: Analytical solutions are derived for the calculation of the compression process. Calculation results are in good agreement with experimental data.

Authors: Maistrenko V.A., Nikonov A.V., Krutov S.N.
Title: AMPLITUDE-FREQUENCY ERROR OF A STROBE CONVERTER WITH FEEDBACK.
Source title: Radioelectronics and Communications Systems (English translation of Izvestiya Vysshikh Uchebnykh Z
Authors with affiliations: Maistrenko, V.A.; Nikonov, A.V.; Krutov, S.N.
Abstract: The conversion of a radiofrequency harmonic signal to a low intermediate frequency (IF) is accompanied by an error in the transfer of information about the amplitude of the initial signal to the intermediate frequency. In precision oscillators used to calibrate the amplitude of harmonic signals, in sampling oscillographs, and in other radio measurement devices that require minimization of this error strobe converters with feedback (SCFB) are employed; they have a high-linearity amplitude response and a broad passband. An SCFB has an amplitude-frequency error, however, owing to the fact that as the frequency omega //S of the input harmonic signal rises there is a substantial change in the frequency over the fixed finite duration tau //S of the strobe pulses. This error component increases nonlinearly as omega //S increases, leading to an increase in the error in conversion to the IF of information about the amplitude of the input harmonic signal in precision devices using SCFB. Our aim is to obtain analytic relationships for calculation of this amplitudefrequency error and to investigate ways of reducing it in the practical development of SCFB having low error in transfer of information about the amplitude of a radiofrequency signal to an IF.
Index Keywords: AMPLITUDE-FREQUENCY ERROR; BROAD PASSBAND; HARMONIC SIGNAL; STROBE CONVERTER; STROBOSCOPES
Correspondence Address: Maistrenko, V.A.

Authors: Shcherba V.E., Bannov M.A.
Title: INVESTIGATION OF THE PROCESS OF COMPRESSION BY A PISTON COMPRESSOR WITH A TWO-PHASE WORKING MEDIUM.
Authors with affiliations: Shcherba, V.E.; Bannov, M.A.
Abstract: The process of compression by a piston compressor with a two-phase working medium is considered while taking account of the relative motion of the phases. A mathematical model of the process has been developed and implemented in the FORTRAN-4 algorithmic language. Calculations on a ES-1033 computer make it possible to reveal some regularities of the motion of the cooling liquid droplets in the piston compressor cylinder. The results obtained permit a more effective cooling of the gas being compressed. The method presented may be utilized in designing piston compressors operating with liquid injection.
Index Keywords: FLOW OF FLUIDS - Two Phase; GASES - Cooling; HEAT TRANSFER - Fluids; LIQUIDS; COOLANT INJECTION; COOLING LIQUIDS; PISTON COMPRESSORS; RECIPROCAL COMPRESSORS; COMPRESSORS
Correspondence Address: Shcherba, V.E.

Authors: Shcherba V.E., Berezin I.S., Titov I.E.
Title: Law of Liquid Injection in a Theoretical Volumetric Compressor with a Two-Phase Working Medium. [O ZAKONE VPRYSKA ZHIDKOSTI V TEORETICHESKOM OB''EMNOM KOMPRESSORE S DVUKHFAZNYM RABOCHIM TELOM.]
Authors with affiliations: Shcherba, V.E.; Berezin, I.S.; Titov, I.E.
Abstract: Using the first principle of thermodynamics for the gaseous phase and the heat balance equation for the liquid phase of the working medium, a method of calculation is developed. It permits determination of the law of injection of a cooling liquid into a compressor with purpose of carrying out the process of compression with the required polytropic curve index, in a volumetric effect compressor with any law of variation of the compression chamber volume. Cases of equilibrium and disequilibrium states of the two-phase working medium are considered. Calculation of the current relative quantity of the injected liquid for reciprocating and rotary compressors are carried out in accordance with this method for the isothermal and polytropic compression processes.
Index Keywords: GASES; LIQUIDS; THERMODYNAMICS; ISOTHERMAL COMPRESSORS; POLYTROPIC COMPRESSORS; COMPRESSORS
Correspondence Address: Shcherba, V.E.

Authors: Belyi A.S., Smolikov M.D., Fenelonov V.B., Gavrilov V.Yu., Duplyakin V.K.
Title: DISTRIBUTION OF THE ACTIVE COMPONENT IN THE STRUCTURE OF OXIDE CARRIERS. II. DISTRIBUTION OF PLATINUM IN THE STRUCTURE OF Pt/Al//2O//3.
Affiliations: Acad of Sciences of the USSR, Acad of Sciences of the USSR
Authors with affiliations: Belyi, A.S., Acad of Sciences of the USSR, Acad of Sciences of the USSR; Smolikov, M.D., Acad of Sciences of the USSR, Acad of Sciences of the USSR; Fenelonov, V.B., Acad of Sciences of the USSR, Acad of Sciences of the USSR; Gavrilov, V.Yu., Acad of Sciences of the USSR, Acad of Sciences of the USSR; Duplyakin, V.K., Acad of Sciences of the USSR, Acad of Sciences of the USSR
Abstract: The method of titrating chemisorbed hydrogen by oxygen in an atmosphere of water vapor has been used to investigate the 'microdistribution' of platinum particles of various size ranges in the Pt/Al//2O//3 system. Two states of the platinum were established: an ultrafine form stabilized by strong interaction with the carrier, and fine Pt particles located in the mesopores and macropores. A method has been developed for quantitative estimation of the surface areas of these forms of Pt, and also the nature of the distribution of the fine metal particles in the mesopore volume in low-concentration aluminoplatinum catalysts.
Index Keywords: ADSORPTION - Applications; ALUMINA - Applications; PLATINUM COMPOUNDS - Measurements; ADSORPTION ISOTHERMS; ALUMINO PLATINUM CATALYSTS; CHEMISORPTION MEASUREMENT; MESOPORE VOLUME; PLATINUM PARTICLE DISTRIBUTION; CATALYSTS
Correspondence Address: Belyi, A.S.; Acad of Sciences of the USSR, Acad of Sciences of the USSR

Authors: Belyi A.S., Smolikov M.D., Fenelonov V.B., Gavrilov V.Yu., Duplyakin V.K.
Title: DISTRIBUTION OF THE ACTIVE COMPONENT OVER THE PORES OF DIFFERENT SIZES IN THE STRUCTURE OF OXIDE CARRIERS. I. A METHOD OF QUANTITATIVE ANALYSIS OF PLATINUM DISTRIBUTION IN THE POROUS STRUCTURE OF SILICA GELS.
Affiliations: Acad of Sciences of the USSR, USSR, Acad of Sciences of the USSR, USSR
Authors with affiliations: Belyi, A.S., Acad of Sciences of the USSR, USSR, Acad of Sciences of the USSR, USSR; Smolikov, M.D., Acad of Sciences of the USSR, USSR, Acad of Sciences of the USSR, USSR; Fenelonov, V.B., Acad of Sciences of the USSR, USSR, Acad of Sciences of the USSR, USSR; Gavrilov, V.Yu., Acad of Sciences of the USSR, USSR, Acad of Sciences of the USSR, USSR; Duplyakin, V.K., Acad of Sciences of the USSR, USSR, Acad of Sciences of the USSR, USSR
Abstract: A method is proposed for the quantitative analysis of platinum distribution over the regions of silica gel surface formed by different sizes of pores. The analysis has been based on determining the change of platinum surface (S/S//0)Pt and of the carrier surface (S/S//0)//c for different degrees of occupation of the pore volume by condensed water phase. The platinum distribution has been determined in the form of the function (S/S//0)//P//t/(S/S//0)//c equals f(R) (where R is the pore radius) in Pt/SiO//2 catalysts with different structural porosity. Data have been obtained on the nonuniform distribution of platinum over regions of carrier surface formed by pores of different sizes.
Index Keywords: CATALYSTS - Platinum Compounds; OXIDE CARRIERS; PLATINUM DISTRIBUTION; POROUS STRUCTURE; SILICA GEL
Correspondence Address: Belyi, A.S.; Acad of Sciences of the USSR, , Acad of Sciences of the USSR, USSR

Authors: Zhilin N.S., Maystrenko V.A., Nikonov A.V.
Title: INVESTIGATION OF THE CONVERSION LINEARITY OF THE AMPLITUDE OF A HIGH-FREQUENCY SIGNAL BY RING DISCRETE-SAMPLING CONVERTERS.
Source title: Soviet journal of communications technology & electronics
Authors with affiliations: Zhilin, N.S.; Maystrenko, V.A.; Nikonov, A.V.
Abstract: The nonlinear differential equation, describing the conversion processes of high-frequency signals in a symmetrical ring circuit of a discrete-sampling converter employing semiconductor diodes, is solved by the small-parameter and harmonic-balance methods. Equations are obtained for calculating the nonlinearity of the amplitude characteristic of discrete-sampling converters without feedback and with feedback together with relations for estimating the phase shifts introduced. The formulas and graphs obtained make it possible to estimate the decrease in the nonlinearity of the amplitude characteristic resulting from the introduction of feedback and to make an optimum choice of the parameter of discrete-sampling converters for their practical development. Experimental tests of discrete-sampling converters employing KD514A diodes confirm the principal conclusions of the theoretical studies.
Index Keywords: MATHEMATICAL TECHNIQUES - Differential Equations; SEMICONDUCTOR DIODES; SIGNAL THEORY; RING DISCRETE-SAMPLING CONVERTER; SAMPLING PULSES; TIME-SCALE CONVERSION; ULTRAHIGH-FREQUENCY ELECTRICAL SIGNALS; ELECTRONIC CIRCUITS
Correspondence Address: Zhilin, N.S.

Authors: Kuznetsov V.I., Belyi A.S., Yurchenko E.N., Smolikov M.D., Protasova M.T., Zatolokina E.V., Duplyakin V.K.
Title: Mössbauer spectroscopic and chemical analysis of the composition of Sn-containing components of PtSn Al2O3(Cl) reforming catalyst
Affiliations: Institute of Catalysis, Novosibirsk, 630090, Russian Federation
Authors with affiliations: Kuznetsov, V.I., Institute of Catalysis, Novosibirsk, 630090, Russian Federation; Belyi, A.S., Institute of Catalysis, Novosibirsk, 630090, Russian Federation; Yurchenko, E.N., Institute of Catalysis, Novosibirsk, 630090, Russian Federation; Smolikov, M.D., Institute of Catalysis, Novosibirsk, 630090, Russian Federation; Protasova, M.T., Institute of Catalysis, Novosibirsk, 630090, Russian Federation; Zatolokina, E.V., Institute of Catalysis, Novosibirsk, 630090, Russian Federation; Duplyakin, V.K., Institute of Catalysis, Novosibirsk, 630090, Russian Federation
Abstract: Based on NGR parameter analyses [δ, Δ, W and f'(T)], we have studied the genesis of the states of Sn-containing components of catalysts prepared by impregnating the prechlorinated γ-Al2O3 with a solution containing a mixture of complex anions, [PtCl3SnCl3]2- and [PtCl2 (SnCl3)2]2-. At the initial step, Sn-containing compounds interacted with OH or Cl atoms of the support surface. Two types of Sn(IV), three to four states of Sn(II), and several Pt-Sn alloys were identified after reduction of samples with H2 at 823 K. The amount and composition of Sn(II) components of the catalyst tend to change most dynamically due to a strong interaction of some of the Cl ions and Sn atoms with the support lattice. The problems encountered in the application of the method are discussed. © 1986.

Authors: Shcherba V.E.
Title: Use of Galerkin's Method to Calculate Working Processes of Compression and Expansion of Volumetric Compressors with a Two-Phase Working Medium. [PRIMENENIE METODA GALERKINA DLYA RASCHETA RABOCHIKH PROTSESSOV SZHATIYA I RASSHIRENIYA OB''EMNYKH KOMPRESSOROV S DVUKHFAZNYM RABOCHIM TELOM.]
Authors with affiliations: Shcherba, V.E.
Abstract: A system of differential equations describing the variation of the thermodynamic parameters of the working medium in the compression chamber of a compressor is transformed into a linear differential equation of the second order with variable coefficients. The differential equation thus obtained, together with the noted boundary conditions, forms a boundary problem which is solved by the Galerkin method. To determine the unknown values of the boundary conditions, a system of integral equations is set up. It is solved by the method of the fastest descent.
Index Keywords: FLUIDS; GASES; LIQUIDS; RECIPROCATING COMPRESSORS; TWO-PHASE WORKING MEDIUM; COMPRESSORS
Correspondence Address: Shcherba, V.E.

Authors: Biryukov S.V., Volkova O.V., Koryavin A.R., Nesterov N.P., Subachev A.S.
Title: OPERATING TESTS OF 1150 KV MAKE-BREAK DEVICE.
Authors with affiliations: Biryukov, S.V.; Volkova, O.V.; Koryavin, A.R.; Nesterov, N.P.; Subachev, A.S.
Abstract: Results are reported of field tests of a 1150 kV make-break device, involving a check on the working capability of the device for spark connection of a reactor, a check on operation of the apparatus in reactor-disconnection mode, determination of the discharge characteristics of the device for spark connection of a reactor, and determination of the intrinsic connect and disconnect times of the apparatus. It has been established that the characteristics of the 1150 kV make-break device obtained under laboratory conditions correspond to field-test results and that the apparatus fully meets the requirements applying to it that assure its operating reliability.
Index Keywords: ELECTRIC CIRCUIT BREAKERS; ELECTRIC LINES - Overvoltage Protection; ELECTRIC POWER TRANSMISSION - Overvoltage Protection; ELECTRIC REACTORS, CURRENT LIMITING; 1150 KV MAKE-BREAK DEVICE; SHUNT REACTORS; SPARK CONNECTIONS; ELECTRIC SWITCHGEAR

Authors: Rubtsov N.A., Masyagin V.B., Shalai V.V., Shepelev N.V., Emel'yanov A.A.
Title: Effect of Radiative Properties of Metallic Surfaces Forming Small Gaps on Radiation Heat Transfer. [O VLIYANII IZLUCHATEL'NYKH SVOISTV METALLICHESKIKH POVERKHNOSTEI, OBRAZUYUSHCHIKH MALYE ZAZORY, NA TEPLOOBMEN IZLUCHENIEM.]
Source title: Izvestia Sibirskogo otdelenia Akademii nauk SSSR. Seria tehniceskih nauk
Authors with affiliations: Rubtsov, N.A.; Masyagin, V.B.; Shalai, V.V.; Shepelev, N.V.; Emel'yanov, A.A.
Abstract: The dependence of the total radiation heat flux in a small gap on the surface impedance function is investigated in view of the fact that its magnitude is determined as an integral and the effect of the surface impedance function on the heat flux is not obvious. An analysis of the results obtained shows the determinant effect of the surface properties of the radiating media on the dependence of the total radiation heat flux on the distance between the interfaces.
Index Keywords: Surfaces; Heat transfer
Correspondence Address: Rubtsov, N.A.
Abbreviated Source Title: Izv Sib Otd Akad Nauk SSSR Ser Tekh Nauk

Authors: Rubtsov N.A., Masyagin V.B., Shalay V.V., Shepelev N.V., Yemel'yanov A.A.
Title: EFFECT OF EMISSIVE PROPERTIES OF METAL SURFACES IN SHORT GAPS ON THE RADIANT HEAT TRANSFER.
Authors with affiliations: Rubtsov, N.A.; Masyagin, V.B.; Shalay, V.V.; Shepelev, N.V.; Yemel'yanov, A.A.
Abstract: The article is concerned with the effect of emissive properties of metal plates forming short gaps. It is shown that the state of the surfaces may both amplify and diminish the total radiant heat transfer over small distances.
Index Keywords: METALS AND ALLOYS - Surfaces; PLATES; HEAT FLUX; HEAT TRANSFER
Correspondence Address: Rubtsov, N.A.

Authors: Shcherba V.E., Yusha V.L., Kabakov A.N.
Title: Theoretical Volumetric Compressor with Injection of a Nonevaporating Liquid. [TEORETICHESKII OB''EMNYI KOMPRESSOR SO VPRYSKOM NEISPARYAYUSHCHEISYA ZHIDKOSTI.]
Authors with affiliations: Shcherba, V.E.; Yusha, V.L.; Kabakov, A.N.
Abstract: The conceptual model of a theoretical three-dimensional compressor with injection of a nonevaporating liquid is proposed. A method is presented making it possible to determine the law of variation of the volume and the relation between the main parameters of the injected liquid for carrying out the compression process with the desirable polytropy index.
Index Keywords: LIQUIDS - Thermal Conductivity; Compressors
Correspondence Address: Shcherba, V.E.

Authors: Shcherba V.E., Plastinin P.I.
Title: Method for calculating the operational processes of a volumetric compressor.
Authors with affiliations: Shcherba, V.E.; Plastinin, P.I.
Abstract: A method is presented for calculating the operational processes of a volumetric compressor based on the use of the momentary value of the polytropic exponent. Comparison of the calculation results with the numerical solution of the differential equations by the Euler method indicates that the proposed method gives accurate results. It also permits mathematical optimization of the compression process. (R.H.)

Authors: Anikonov J.E., Stepanov V.N.
Title: Uniqueness and stability of the solution of a problem of geometry in the large
Authors with affiliations: Anikonov, J.E.; Stepanov, V.N.
Abstract: This paper considers the problem of determining a convex surface from the area F(n) of its orthogonal projection on any plane (x, n) = 0 and the area S(n) of the portion of the surface illuminated in the direction n. It is proved that in a certain class a convex surface is uniquely defined (up to translation) by a function ϕ(n) = 2aF(n) + bS(n) for a, b, a + b≠ 0. Moreover, the surface is analytic if and only if ϕ(n) is an analytic function on the unit sphere. The surface is shown to be stable, and a quantitative estimate related to stability is given. Bibliography: 6 titles. © 1983 American Mathematical Society.
References: Blaschke, W., (1956) Kreis und Kugel, , 2nd ed. Authors: Shcherba V.E., Kabakov A.N., Yusha V.L.
Title: Efficiency of the Working Process of Compression of a Volumetric Effect Compressor with Injection of an Evaporating Liquid. [EFFEKTIVNOST' RABOCHEGO PROTSESSA SZHATIYA KOMPRESSORA OB double prime EMNOGO DEISTVIYA SO VPRYSKOM ISPARYAYUSHCHEISYA ZHIDKOSTI.]
Authors with affiliations: Shcherba, V.E.; Kabakov, A.N.; Yusha, V.L.
Abstract: The effectiveness of application of injection of an evaporating liquid into the working chamber of a volumetric-effect compressor is considered. Based on Maxwell's equations, equations of thermodynamics of a variable-mass body, and of heat balance equations, an equivalent index of the polytropic curve of the compression process and thermodynamic efficiency of the application of liquid injection is determined. Results of calculations of the thermodynamic efficiency of the compression process of the 14VK screw compressor with different quantity and dispersion of the injected liquid are presented.
Index Keywords: Evaporation; LIQUIDS - Thermodynamics; Compressors
Correspondence Address: Shcherba, V.E.

Authors: Kuznetsov V.I., Yurchenko E.N., Belyi A.S., Zatolokina E.V., Smolikov M.A., Duplyakin V.K.
Title: Mössbauer spectroscopic studies of the state of Pt-Sn/Al2O3 catalyst for hydrocarbon conversion
Affiliations: Institute of Catalysis, Novosibirsk, Russia
Authors with affiliations: Kuznetsov, V.I., Institute of Catalysis, Novosibirsk, Russia; Yurchenko, E.N., Institute of Catalysis, Novosibirsk, Russia; Belyi, A.S., Institute of Catalysis, Novosibirsk, Russia; Zatolokina, E.V., Institute of Catalysis, Novosibirsk, Russia; Smolikov, M.A., Institute of Catalysis, Novosibirsk, Russia; Duplyakin, V.K., Institute of Catalysis, Novosibirsk, Russia
Abstract: Mössbauer spectroscopic studies of the state of Pt-Sn catalyst for hydrocarbon conversion supported on prechlorinated γ-Al2O3 indicate that, unlike nonchlorinated Al2O3, this system is much more reduced and besides Pt3Sn-PtSn2, its surface contains sigfificant amounts of Sn(II) and Sn(IV) chlorides bonded to the surface. © 1982 Akadémiai Kiadó.

Authors: Belskaya O.B.
Title: Age changes in the synovia of the knee joint of man
Affiliations: Lab. Obshch. Patol. Anat., Inst. Morfol. Cheloveka, AMN SSSR, Moscow
Authors with affiliations: Belskaya, O.B., Lab. Obshch. Patol. Anat., Inst. Morfol. Cheloveka, AMN SSSR, Moscow
Abstract: The knee joint synovia obtained from subjects (aged 30-69) who had died as a result of trauma was studied with the use of histochemical and morphometric methods. It was shown that with aging the number of capillaries in the subintimal layer decreases, and there is a tendency to the thickening of the layer due to the development of sclerosis.
Index Keywords: aging; autopsy; cartilage; histology; joint; knee; major clinical study; synovium

Authors: Panchuk K.L.
Title: Geometrical Synthesis of Plane Gears. [GEOMETRICHESKII SINTEZ PLOSKOGO ZUBCHATOGO ZATSEPLENIYA.]
Authors with affiliations: Panchuk, K.L.
Abstract: Problems of synthesis of a plane geared mechanism along the engagement line on the basis of an investigation of the geometric picture of the gear contact with a constant gear ratio are considered. A solution to the problem of determination of the shape of the conjugated tooth profiles and their curvature is proposed. The geometric basis of the solution is a representation of the corresponding radii-vectors of the contact point in the form of their components in unit vectors of the accompanying reference point of the plane curve as well as the known Bobolier constructions.
Index Keywords: MATHEMATICAL TECHNIQUES; GEARS
Correspondence Address: Panchuk, K.L.

Authors: BIRYUKOV S.V., VOLKOVA O.V., KORYAVIN A.R.
Title: SPARK GAPS OF EXTRAHIGH-VOLTAGE CONNECT-DISCONNECT SWITCHES.
Authors with affiliations: BIRYUKOV, S.V.; VOLKOVA, O.V.; KORYAVIN, A.R.
Abstract: AN ANALYSIS OF THE CONNECTION BETWEEN THE ELECTRIC FIELD OFLONG AIR GAPS AND THE PROCESS OF DISCHARGE FORMATION IN THEM IS USED AS A BASIS FOR CONSIDERING THE POSSIBILITY OF DEVELOPING DEVICES TO LIMIT OVER-VOLTAGES IN EXTRAHIGH-VOLTAGE NETWORKS. IT IS SHOWN THAT FOR PARTICULAR ELECTRIC-FIELD PARAMETERS IT IS POSSIBLE TO OPTIMIZE THE DISCHARGE CHARACTERISTICS OF OPEN SPARK GAPS FOR A BROAD RANGE OF VARIATION IN THEFORMS OF APPLIED VOLTAGE OF BOTH POLARITIES. A METHOD IS GIVEN FOR CALCULATING THE OPTIMAL SPARK-GAP CONFIGURATION.
Index Keywords: ELECTRIC SWITCHGEAR - PROTECTION; ELECTRIC POWER TRANSMISSION, EHV; Electric spark gaps
Correspondence Address: BIRYUKOV, S.V.

Authors: Kabakov A.N., Shcherba V.E.
Title: Mathematical modelling of the function of a piston compressor with injection of water into the stream of compressed air.
Authors with affiliations: Kabakov, A.N.; Shcherba, V.E.
Abstract: The Omsk Polytechnical Institute has derived a system of equations for determining the variations in the parameters of the two phase flow of the air in any chamber of a piston compressor. This enables a mathematical model to be formulated for the operational factors arising in the cylinder of the VU-3/8 piston compressor, in which water is also injected into the intake chamber. This water injection approximates the compression process to an isothermal process. The temperature of the air being compressed and that of the liquid droplets, differ considerably from each other. (R.H.)

Authors: Smolikov M.D., Savchenko V.I.
Title: Interaction of CO and O2 on the oxidized surface of polycrystalline palladium
Affiliations: Institute of Catalysis, Novosibirsk, Russia
Authors with affiliations: Smolikov, M.D., Institute of Catalysis, Novosibirsk, Russia; Savchenko, V.I., Institute of Catalysis, Novosibirsk, Russia
Abstract: The interaction of CO and O2 on the oxidized surface of polycrystalline palladium under steady state reaction conditions has been studied. The adsorption of carbon monoxide leads to the appearance of its α and β states. The β state on the surface shifts the temperature dependence of the CO oxidation rate under s.s. conditions by about 200 K. © 1979 Akadémiai Kiadó.

Authors: Biryukov S.V., Buinov A.L., Dobrokhotov R.B., Mal'chukov G.P., Morozov M.N., Puzyriiskii G.S., Savinkov Yu.T., Chernov Yu.P.
Title: 110-750 kV Aerial Switches of the VNV Series with 40 kA Nominal Disconnection Current. [VOZDUSHNYE VYKLYUCHATELI SERII VNV NA 110-70 kV S NOMINAL'NYM TOKOM OTKLYUCHENIYA 40 kA.]
Authors with affiliations: Biryukov, S.V.; Buinov, A.L.; Dobrokhotov, R.B.; Mal'chukov, G.P.; Morozov, M.N.; Puzyriiskii, G.S.; Savinkov, Yu.T.; Chernov, Yu.P.
Abstract: The principles of design of a series of VNV-type air-brake switches with a large arc extinguishing module, the design of this module and the functioning of its mechanisms during the disconnect and connect operations are described. Results of supplementary investigation of 750 kV switches of the VNV type during commutation of an unloaded overhead power line are presented. A report is given on industrial manufacture of 330 and 750 kV VNV-type switches with the rated disconnection current of 40 kA by the Uralelektrotyazhmash production association.
Index Keywords: Electric circuit breakers, Air blast; Electric switches
Correspondence Address: Biryukov, S.V.

Title: Selection of Objects by Speed and Direction of Motion with the Aid of Methods of Electronic Modeling.
Authors with affiliations: Odinets, A.I.
Abstract: 7 refs. In Russian.
Index Keywords: Electronic circuits; Systems science and cybernetics

Authors: Khomchenko V.G.
Title: Synthesis of Combined Polydynamic Laws of Motion. [SINTEZ KOMBINIROVANNYKH POLIDINAMICHESKIKH ZAKONOV DVIZHENIYA.]
Authors with affiliations: Khomchenko, V.G.
Abstract: Two families of combined polydynamic laws of motion are synthesized in the article. These laws represent three conjugated algebraic polynomials and have a sector of constant acceleration. The latter permits polydynamic laws of motion to be obtained with lower values of the maximum acceleration rate. A nomogram is presented in the article for selecting the length of the constant acceleration sector and its position with respect to the unit interval of motion. Application to cam and cam lever mechanisms is mentioned.
Index Keywords: Dynamics; Mechanisms; Cams
Correspondence Address: Khomchenko, V.G.
